fields.neighbourhood_overview: Quiet yet just 10 mins walk to the hubs of Bondi Junction transport, Double Bay with it's ferry and smart shopping and eating, and Queen Street chic. There's a beautiful rainforest park at the bottom of the hill if you're a runner.
fields.transit: There is a bus at the bottom of attunga st that goes either to the station or bondi junction.  15 mins walk will take you to a ferry to the city (7 mins ) 10 mins walk will take you to trains and endless buses all over Sydney.
fields.title: Woollahra/double bay1

fields.summary: On the shore of Sydney harbour in the heart of Double Bay village. Spacious room in whole-floor apartment with level access, gardens, spacious interior. 50m from boutiques, cafes & shops. Only 10 mins to city by ferry + close to bus & train.
fields.description: On the shore of Sydney harbour in the heart of Double Bay village. Spacious room in whole-floor apartment with level access, gardens, spacious interior. 50m from boutiques, cafes & shops. Only 10 mins to city by ferry + close to bus & train. This apartment is about lifestyle; large expanses of polished wood floors, furnished sparingly with design furniture and a few select art pieces. Minimalist, uncluttered space is the luxury here.  Occupying the entire ground floor of a large freestanding house built early 20th century there is only one direct neighbour, in the single apartment above. Both places have separate entries and share surrounding courtyard gardens.  There are no children or dogs on the premises and the neighbourhood is quiet and peaceful despite being only 50m from a thriving village shopping centre famous for cafes, boutiques and restaurants, and remarkably less than 4km from Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. This part of Sydney Harbour (eastern suburbs) is home to s
fields.notes: There is free 2 hour street parking in this and adjacent streets. Across the road there is untimed street parking on weekends. A short walk's distance there is unlimited untimed parking making possible several days continuous parking. A comprehensive supermarket is within a short level stroll and open from 7am till midnight everyday. Most shops in Sydney open 7 days a week. Some restaurants are closed Monday and Tuesday but there is always somewhere nearby to get prepared food.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: There is a small schoolhouse across the road, beyond that a small park then less than 100m away (60yds) from the front door is the ferry direct to the city. A peaceful and safe environment to walk at night and alone. 50m (30yds) away is  the shopping village famous for boutiques, cafes and restaurants and with a large supermarket open till midnight. Considered one of Sydney's most prestige suburbs it is a perfect location to base your visit, for work or pleasure. Its close proximity to the city, while sheltered from the hustle & bustle, offers welcome homely relief after a busy day.
fields.transit: Sydney downtown is less than 4km (2.5miles). From there it's 1 minute walk to Opera House, The Rocks 'Old Town', Botanical Gardens, Central Business District and main transport terminal. The fastest way is ferry in 10 minutes, train (Edgecliff) in 15 minutes or bus in 25 minutes. If here to work, commuting by ferry offers a spectacular way to start the day, arriving at Circular Quay between Opera House and bridge. Many guests flag this as the highlight of their stay. If you catch the ferry in the opposite direction, you'll soon be in beautiful Watson's Bay - with clifftop nature reserve, beaches, more restaurants and cafes, and from 'The Gap' a breathtaking 360 vista of ocean and harbour, including spectacular views of the city in the distance.
fields.title: Harbour, shops, cafes, city 10 mins

fields.description: Welcome to beachside paradise! A beautiful beachside villa in Bundeena with waterfront access and gorgeous views of Port Hacking, overlooking Gunyah Beach - a swimming, snorkeling and boating paradise. A perfect spot for sun and water lovers! The Villa This newly built villa sleeps up to six adults. It has two double bedrooms on the upper level, one with a large ensuite. The floor to ceiling glass doors in each bedroom open on to a terrace enabling a complete indoor/outdoor environment. The master bedroom has a free-standing two person bath overlooking Port Hacking. Adjustable skylights and air-conditioning create a comfortable living and sleeping atmosphere. There is a third bedroom on the lower floor, also with an open fireplace.  The lower floor also comprises a large open kitchen/living/dining area with polished concrete flooring, an open fireplace and new appliances, with floor to ceiling glass doors opening to a sunny grassed area.  There is also a boat slab barbeque area on the
fields.title: Le Soleil Beach Front Luxury Villa

fields.summary: Our gorgeous home is ideally situated on a quiet street with beach, famous coastal walk, park, BBQs, playground, ocean pools, shops and buses only minutes away.
fields.description: Our gorgeous home is ideally situated on a quiet street with beach, famous coastal walk, park, BBQs, playground, ocean pools, shops and buses only minutes away.    Our gorgeous home is ideally situated on a quiet street with beach, famous coastal walk, park, BBQs, playground, ocean pools, shops and buses only minutes away. It is just a short bus ride to the University of NSW. The apartment has lofty 10-foot ceilings with beautiful hard wood polished floor boards in the lounge room and kitchen. There is super soft New Zealand pure wool carpet in the bedroom so that your feet will feel on holiday too. The lounge room is North facing so our apartment is filled with light throughout the day which is just lovely. In the afternoon the breeze from the ocean flows from the lounge room through the apartment and out through the kitchen. There is a cosy bay window seat (big enough to nap on) in the lounge room with loads of comfortable cushions for your relaxation. There is a dining table in the
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Across the road is a French Café (open every day except Tuesdays), convenience store (open 7 days until 9pm), a manicure/pedicure specialist and a laundromat. On the other side of the block (1 minute walk) you will find a hairdresser, beautician, and Thai restaurant (open 7 days). It is a 5-7 minute walk to all the action on Coogee Bay Road, which offers a wide variety of cafés and restaurants for your culinary pleasure. There are all the shops you could need including a supermarket, green grocer, bottle shop, pharmacies, surf shops and Thai massage. The famous Coogee Bay Hotel with its beer garden is right on the waterfront just 5 minutes walk away. We are one block (3-5 minute walk) from the beach, parks, a large children's playground, the stunning and famous coastal walk (you can walk north to Bondi or south to Maroubra), ocean pools including Wylies Baths, the Women's and Children's Baths and Coogee Life Saving public pool. There are BBQ facilities all within the same walking dista
fields.transit: 1 minute walk to a bus stop with buses going to the City, Bondi, Randwick, Drummoyne and the University of NSW.
fields.title: Beachside Coogee 2 bed apartment

fields.description: This space is located in the professional, clean, leafy north shore suburb of Gordon.  Surrounded by nature with plenty of quiet natural walks in a 1km radius.  If you are after an area that is quiet and relaxing and has some nice restaurants nearby then Gordon is the place for you! I'm an experienced traveller, couchsurfer, professional who loves talking to travellers from around the world. There is free wireless internet to use and FREE freshly baked bread (ask me about it) for all guests. It is directly opposite Gordon train station, the most efficient train line in Sydney.  Its a 30 minute ride to the CBD, 10 minutes to the Chatswood CBD where you will find loads more restaurants and shops and a 5 minute bus ride to Macquarie Shopping Centre. You have easy access via car to the F3 Freeway which will take you north to the Central Coast, Newcastle and all the way to Queensland if you feel like an adventure.
fields.title: Opposite North Shore Train Station

fields.summary: This comfortably furnished home is a relaxing retreat. Large living room is perfect for family connection, plenty of comfortable seating with a relaxed light and bright 'beachy' atmosphere.  Front entertaining courtyard is fantastic for entertaining and has total privacy from the driveway and the Cottage and Garden Retreat which are not even visible. There is also a private back sundeck. NB:  We also can direct you to excellent and well priced apartment overseas accommodation particularly fiji.
fields.description: This comfortably furnished home is a relaxing retreat. Large living room is perfect for family connection, plenty of comfortable seating with a relaxed light and bright 'beachy' atmosphere.  Front entertaining courtyard is fantastic for entertaining and has total privacy from the driveway and the Cottage and Garden Retreat which are not even visible. There is also a private back sundeck. NB:  We also can direct you to excellent and well priced apartment overseas accommodation particularly fiji. Beautiful, light, sunny, peaceful apartment looking out to treetops.  Level entry with parking and 30 metres to city transport, local shopping centre and childrens park.  Waterfall and wetlands reserve creek walk is in 2 different directions starting 5 houses away.  20 minutes walk to nearest surf beach.   This is the large upstairs house, there is a seperate sandstone 3 bedroom apartment underneath and a cottage further down the property, all on 1100 sqm of grass and garden backing onto reserve
fields.notes: On request we can supply baby and children toys and books, porta cot, potty, feeding chair, stroller and beach equipment.   We have a very extensive selection of books, dvds, videos and games for those rainy days or for those who find just lying around a perfect holiday.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Beach, walks, sunshine, long lazy barbecuues, friendly neighbours and yet a sense of the local shopping, cafes and outdoor activities that make a holiday so much fun.  We are surrounded by the relaxiing lovely outlook of bush and nature.
fields.transit: While the outlook from the living, kitchen & sundeck helps you feel like you are in the middle  of the country with a nearby beach, the entry has quick access to all.  Main shopping complex 3 minute walk and buses to the city a 60 metre walk away. Taxi from the airport is between $100-$170 however it is worth looking into Northern  beaches aIrport shuttle options which may work out more economical.  Car hire is an option with about a 45 minute drive north to the beaches - along the way you will see the Opera House and drive across the famous Harbour Bridge.  Alternatively a train can be caught direct from the airport and we can arrange pickup from Chatswood or Gordon Station on Sydneys North Shore for $60 per group of 4 however the train fare will likely have already cost $15 per person. Or you could catch a train to Wynyard Station and then the L85 bus direct to the house from outside of the Menzies hotel in the city.  This would best suit those with limited luggage.
fields.title: Best of Both Worlds North Narrabeen

fields.description: Loft Style Apartement in Sydney's trendiest suburb.  On the border of Redfern and Surry Hills this great apartment is located in a spanish style 2 story block surrounding a leafy tropical courtyard.  Great Character.  Great Location. The (phone number hidden) buses leave every 10 minutes to the City and Circular Quay via Hyde Park and the M20 leaves every 20 minutes towards Central Station and Chinatown. Only a short walk to Moore Park which leads onto Fox Studios, The Entertainment Quarter and Centennial Park. Surry Hills itself is renowned for its stylish eateries and funky cafes, with vintage clothing stores and eclectic shopping.  Redfern in recent years has taken over in the hip and trendy department as far as eateries, cafes and bars. Redfern is where Sydney's nightlife is now hopping.  With the Crystal Street Shopping depot at your door step.  Within 2 min walking distance there are 2 x Supermarkets, Pharmacy, Bakery, Cafes and Newsagents available.  The apartment is close enoug
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Close to Redfern and Surry Hills both trendy and hip Sydney suburbs. Quick bus ride to city. Walk to Centennial Park.
fields.transit: There are three buses that take you straight into the city from Baptist St. M20 take you straight to central and Darling Harbour from across the road on Phillip St.
fields.title: Loft Style Apartment in Sydney

fields.summary: This bright modern 4 bedroom house is within 20 mins of the city or beach. Woollahra is a trendy, smart suburb abounding with coffee shops and parks.l invite you to share healthy breakfasts with other guests or in the leafy garden. There is a double bed, ample wardrobe space, a computer work station and it is bright and sunny.  There are other rooms also to accommodate a family or couples holidaying together.
fields.description: This bright modern 4 bedroom house is within 20 mins of the city or beach. Woollahra is a trendy, smart suburb abounding with coffee shops and parks.l invite you to share healthy breakfasts with other guests or in the leafy garden. There is a double bed, ample wardrobe space, a computer work station and it is bright and sunny.  There are other rooms also to accommodate a family or couples holidaying together. Hi, Being an avid traveller I am very happy to host you and show you my exciting city from this leafy suburb of Woollahra... my home is just 10 mins by bus or train from the city, Bondi beach. Double Bay and Bondi Junction. Both shops and transport just a10 minute walk away. Woollahra is a luxurious suburb with exciting coffee shops, fashion shops in the famous Queen Street, beautiful parks for meditation and walks, friendly and safe. The house offers free wireless,free and  easy parking, a great sustainable garden with barbeque and lots of seating. You are welcome to help yoursel
fields.notes: Occasionally I look after a dog. Free tea, coffee, meals or treats.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The charm of queen street  Proximity to a swim Rainforest park Level 10 min walk to Double Bay, touch of Europe and a ferry to city in 10 mins. Easy access to all transport if you're happy to walk 8 mins, or bus at bottom of street to city.
fields.transit: Parking at the door. Bus on street to stations and shops. Walking around is very safe at all times.
fields.title: Woollahra/double bay2

fields.summary: This modern bright 4 bedroom home is in a leafy safe suburb yet just 10 mins walk to  trains, buses and ferry.  The ferry is just 10 mins to Circular Quay, the train just 7 mins to the city, the bus just 8 mins to Bondi beach. The advantage of staying in this central but not city or beach area is that you can explore north/south/east/west with ease! The neighbourhood is smart, safe and very social.
fields.description: This modern bright 4 bedroom home is in a leafy safe suburb yet just 10 mins walk to  trains, buses and ferry.  The ferry is just 10 mins to Circular Quay, the train just 7 mins to the city, the bus just 8 mins to Bondi beach. The advantage of staying in this central but not city or beach area is that you can explore north/south/east/west with ease! The neighbourhood is smart, safe and very social. Hi, Being an avid traveller I am very happy to host you and show you my exciting city...having stayed with airbnb hosts I understand your needs also... my home is just 10 mins by bus or train from the city, Bondi beach. Double Bay and Bondi Junction. Both shops and transport just a 10 minute walk away. Woollahra is a luxurious suburb with exciting coffee shops, fashion shops in the famous Queen Street, beautiful parks for meditation and walks, friendly and safe. The house offers free wireless, easy parking, a great sustainable garden with barbeque and lots of seating with morning sun for a s
fields.notes: If you have an issue with hills don't stay here!!! I live near the bottom of a short but steep hill . It is necessary to walk 10 mins  gently uphill to Bondi Junction and its transport hub. Or a level 10 min walk to Double Bay also takes you to the city by ferry or bus.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: I love the safety, the proximity to many beaches and also the city. The rainforest park Queen street village Buzzy cafe on my street
fields.transit: Buses, trains and ferries are all within 10 mins.

fields.description: We have a wonderful 1 bdrm apartment that is fully self contained . You will have 1 bdrm with queen bed and comfy mattress , bedside tables and built in wardrobes , lovely big windows and ceiling fan . The bedroom will accomodate a child as well and we have portable blow up mattress available .  Fully equipped kitchen with modern cooktop and oven , microwave , fridge , freezer . Just purchased a new Espresso machine for the kitchen !! Brand new 26" TV with DVD player in bedroom !!  Large bathroom with toilet , shower and vanity basin plus loads of storage , hairdryer provided . Living room off kitchen with  42' Plasma TV , ADSL wireless internet plus computer provided , lounge and ceiling fan . Foxtel Cable TV Platinum package .You will also have a washing machine and dryer , Iron and Ironing Board . Our apartment is beautiful and bright , living areas have porcelain tiles while the bedroom has soft carpet , it is also fully air conditioned throughout . We have a lovely home that is qu
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We live in a beautiful neighbourhood , we have tree lined streets and beautiful well cared for homes . We live opposite a reserve and we have walking tracks just opposite us and wide open spaces if you wish to exercise  . There are also 2 shopping centres very close by and you can be sure that you can find anything you wish for . Many restuarants plus Cinema Complex at the shopping centre .
fields.transit: We have a great Bus Service that runs every 10 minutes or so , more often during peak periods . The Bus will take you to the City and back and almost anywhere you wish to go to .
fields.title: Modern Spacious  1bdrm Apartment !!

fields.summary: Cosy spacious roomy bedroom with Queen bed on one level and a sitting room on the  three steps up level. Accommodation is comfortable ,  nicely well furnished in the large room. A kettle toaster, microwave, bar frig, lounging chairs & coffee table, towels, linens TV/DVD  en-suite bathroom,  bedside table & reading lamps wardrobe  and  a range of DVD's .  Sunny north facing Veranda Private Quiet oasis. Day/Nightly rate 160 per couple per night  Strictly Minimum 2 night stay
fields.description: Cosy spacious roomy bedroom with Queen bed on one level and a sitting room on the  three steps up level. Accommodation is comfortable ,  nicely well furnished in the large room. A kettle toaster, microwave, bar frig, lounging chairs & coffee table, towels, linens TV/DVD  en-suite bathroom,  bedside table & reading lamps wardrobe  and  a range of DVD's .  Sunny north facing Veranda Private Quiet oasis. Day/Nightly rate 160 per couple per night  Strictly Minimum 2 night stay Retreat to your spacious Queen bedroom cosy room, a quiet oasis, furnished comfortably with all that is required for a self styled stay. Bring your favourite book, a tooth brush and personals to make your stay the best ever.  Use the provided kettle, cups for coffee and tea.  Toast your bread or muffins with jam & honey ( we provide)  for breakfast or the  scramble the egg.  Microwave for lunch and dinner. Glasses for juices or wine.   Relaxingly  quiet,  open veranda has a  180 degree view of local fauna and flora.
fields.notes: Three National Parks on our boundary.   A fast 40 mins direct train rail travel to Sydney and Airport.  Buses trains, taxi's.  As we are located in a quiet suburban family area. We ask all our guests therefore to abide with a low noise tolerance by  day and night, so we may all enjoy the laid back atmosphere our accommodation offers to our many guests.  Rate is $160  per night  per couple.  We have a strict No Smoking policy.  You may enter the gazebo or the garden to indulge in. No parties No events
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Leafy quiet suburban town of Engadine is just 23 kilometers south of Sydney Airport . Large cosmopolitan town Friendly clubs , coffee Cafe's  early breakfast Restaurants late evening  Service Clubs.   Fast trains (Rails) to city  & Airport both are Direct. Road travel access to Sydney via Princes Highway  Local bus at corner to Engadine shopping centre.  Strictly No Smoking No pets No parties No events
fields.transit: Fast trains travel direct to the City and the Airport.  City Central at Circular Quay ferries .  Travel is fast to the Airport or Bondi Beach & Cronulla Beach. Local bus service no  998  is down around the corner travels to Engadine  shopping centre in about 5 minutes. If walking is your thing then consider 15 minutes  exercise.
fields.title: Queen bed  Cosy Suite 160 per couple per night

fields.summary: Fabulous 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom penthouse apartment in Tamarama. Ideal for families, couples or executives. Nicely fitted out with all modern amenities. Steps from Tamarama beach and a short walk to Bondi and transport options. Limited availability on the calendar at the moment, please message me to discuss dates.
fields.description: Fabulous 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom penthouse apartment in Tamarama. Ideal for families, couples or executives. Nicely fitted out with all modern amenities. Steps from Tamarama beach and a short walk to Bondi and transport options. Limited availability on the calendar at the moment, please message me to discuss dates. Amazing Beach Pad in Tamarama. Top floor penthouse apartment with great views over Tamarama and Bronte Beach. Set in a quiet neighborhood close to cafes and restaurants and a short walk to vibrant Bondi Beach. - 2 minutes to Tamarama Beach - 5 minutes to Bondi Beach - Free Wireless Internet / Desktop - Small office space - 8km from Sydney city, easy access to bus/train services - Close to coffee shops, restaurants & bars - BBQ, fully equipped kitchen - Living area with TV, Apple TV, Xbox360  - Two bathrooms with Shower - Quiet neighbourhood - 2 minutes from bondi-bronte-coogee cliff walk - Outdoor gyms at Tamarama and Bondi Beach - Pool at Icebergs in Bondi Beach ($5/swim) - F
fields.notes: Some of the photos are a little old, the apartment, especially the bathrooms have just been renovated.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Tamarama is a fantastic neighborhood with coffee shops, restraurants and bars within a short walk. Close to the hustle and bustle of Bondi yet a quiet neighborhood full of locals enjoying beach life.
fields.transit: Close to bus and train to get into the city.
fields.title: Tamarama Penthouse

fields.summary: Fabulous location for  travellers and business people working in the CBD of Sydney or North Sydney. Transport very close with even the ability to walk either to the city or North Sydney.
fields.description: Fabulous location for  travellers and business people working in the CBD of Sydney or North Sydney. Transport very close with even the ability to walk either to the city or North Sydney. Charming apartment with one room to rent, 5 minutes walk to Kirribilli Village with great choice of restaurants, cafes, small supermarkets and boutique shops.  5 minutes walk to Sydney Harbour Bridge, a ferry to the city or train to the city or suburbs. 2 minutes walk to a bus into the city, harbour foreshore and the Ensemble Theatre.  Added bonus is the rainforest garden and outdoor deck. Kirribilli is across the harbour from the CBD, so you can easily avail yourself of the transport or get some exercise walking across the bridge - spectacular.  There are beautiful harbour foreshore walks from here too in different directions   There is a charming single room for one person with a bathroom to share.  Wifi is available, along with landline to Australian phone numbers.  Digital TV is there for your enjo
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Kirribilli is a wonderful neighbourhood with a delightful village feel - great coffee shops, with a terrific choice of local restaurants and bars - seafood, Asian, modern Australian, burgers - all very close to the harbour.
fields.transit: For the immediate village walking is the best mode of transport, but for ventures further afield you can walk, ferry, train or bus it and then the airport is only 15-20 minutes by car and 30 -40 minutes by train.
fields.title: Rainforest garden apartment - deck

fields.summary: Positioned in Ultimo´s convenient locale, on a street that will instantly make you feel welcome, this sunny New York loft style apartment is the perfect place for your next city getaway. From the high ceilings, polished timber floors throughout, generous bedroom with queen bed and large kitchen, this apartment is not only stylish, spacious and comfortable but is also conveniently located being only moments to Darling Harbour, Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre and a leisurely walk to Sydney CBD.
fields.description: Positioned in Ultimo´s convenient locale, on a street that will instantly make you feel welcome, this sunny New York loft style apartment is the perfect place for your next city getaway. From the high ceilings, polished timber floors throughout, generous bedroom with queen bed and large kitchen, this apartment is not only stylish, spacious and comfortable but is also conveniently located being only moments to Darling Harbour, Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre and a leisurely walk to Sydney CBD. Recent updates  - Air conditioning installed - Black out blinds installed in bedroom - Bathroom updated This property features: - Generous bedroom with queen bed and ceiling fans - Neat bathroom with shower - Integrated laundry with washer and dryer - Secure car parking for one small/medium car - Open plan living and dining area featuring high ceilings and polished timber floor Neat kitchen with a wealth of storage - Well maintained and boutique warehouse conversion building - Wi-Fi - Smart TV - Celling
fields.notes: Booking's are subject to Beachside Breaks terms and conditions. These can be found on our website or we can provide a copy to you. Confirming a booking at this property constitutes acceptance of our terms and conditions.  This is an accurate description of the property, if there is any item that you do not see in the description of amenities list that is imperative to your stay, please contact us for more information.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Ultimo and nearby Pyrmont are ideally located for walking access to the city and Darling Harbour, as well as nearby Glebe. There are a wide range of local attractions in walking distance from the apartment including great cafes, restaurants and bars, the Powerhouse Museum, the Acquatic Centre with full pool and gym facilities, the fish market and the Star Casino. There are great walks around the Harbour Foreshore and parkland at Pyrmont.
fields.transit: 5 minutes walk: Darling Harbour and exhibition centres Powerhouse Museum Ian Thorpe Aquatics centre Light rail/501 QVB bus stop around corner Eateries galore/bars/historic local pub  Ultimo Community Centre & Public Library 10 min walk: China Town, Paddy's Markets, Coles/IGA super market, Sydney Fish Markets, Star City 15 min walk: Townhall or Central railway stations There are also lots of public transport options available including regular buses on Harris St (2 minute walk), Central train station (15 minute walk) and a ferry service at Pyrmont.
fields.title: Loft Style Apartment minutes walk from the city

fields.summary: This is a lovely bright, quiet and sunny art deco apartment close to absolutely everything.
fields.description: This is a lovely bright, quiet and sunny art deco apartment close to absolutely everything. This stylish art deco semi-sized apartment is set on the ground floor of a boutique security block of 4. It features a large shared garden at the rear as well as a sunroom. The apartment has original polished timber floors and high ornate ceilings and a garden outlook from every room. It's north facing with lots of large windows so it is very bright and light.  The apartment block is set on a leafy quiet residential street and Bondi Junction's retail hub is only a short 5 min walk where you will find great cafes, restaurants, banks, Westfield Shopping complex with luxury shopping and a multiplex cinema.  It's a 15 min walk to stunning beaches (Bondi, Bronte, Tamarama) from where you can do the world famous Bondi to Bronte coastal walk. You can also walk to beautiful Centennial Park. We have two bikes that you are welcome to borrow. The Bondi Junction transit interchange (buses and train station)
fields.title: Private Art Deco Garden Apartment

fields.description: A sunlit room with a very comfortable Australian designed sofa bed. When my daughter stays, she says I should mine for it.  You share  my unit with me, Rosemary. I am a very helpful, friendly hostess, presently on leave from teaching. A verandah with a cool summer breeze and warm winter sun is your to use. Clean and pleasant bathroom and kitchen- minus a microwave. You are welcome to tea,coffee, milk and nibbles plus the use of the fridge. Hand washing in laundry (unless you request machine) and outside close line available. A 5 minute walk to Waverton Station, then 10 min. to CBD.  Local cafe, grocery store and Thai restaurant all available at Waverton Station. A 10 minute walk to Crows Nest where they boast 30 mutil-cultural resaurants. A very quiet street for all hours. Unique walks around Sydney Harbour, seeing local flora and fauna zre just down the road. Walk to Luna Park and catch the ferry to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour or Balmain.  !0 min. walk and you are on a bus to one o
fields.title: Wise host. Sunny room. 10min to CBD

fields.summary: Arty, light-filled apartment across the road from the ocean and a coastal stroll to cafe's, bars and Coogee beach. Incredible views!
fields.description: Arty, light-filled apartment across the road from the ocean and a coastal stroll to cafe's, bars and Coogee beach. Incredible views! Literally ocean-side, minutes to Coogee Beach, Wiley's Baths, the Ladies (ocean) Pool and 5-10 mins coastal wander to cafés, bars, restaurants and shops. 10 mins drive to University of NSW (UNSW), Prince of Wales Hospital, Royal Hospital for Women and Sydney Children's Hospital.  Walk the coast-walk and swim in some of the most beautiful beaches in the world. If you're lucky, depending on the time of year, you'll even see whales. Late June and early July is the best time to see them. This location is truly amazing. Everyday stepping out and seeing the sun on the ocean, great days on the beach, swimming, snorkelling, walking along the coast and then seeing the moonlight on the water coming home. Winter is Coogee is even more chilled out than usual. Click on the Guidebook icon on this page for more details of just some of the places to eat, see and do in wa
fields.notes: Currently there is a construction occurring next door. The good news is that this gives direct 180 degree views of the ocean and cliffs plus direct sunshine into the apartment - perfect on chilly Winter days. I have even seen whales spouting water our at sea whilst doing the washing up! The bad news is that there is extra noise during the daytime.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Coogee is part of the Eastern suburbs of Sydney. A relaxed vibe with plenty of cafe's, a few bars, lovely beach and a few ocean baths.
fields.transit: Free on-street parking is available. If arriving by plane Taxi will cost approx $30AUD. Bus stops into the city of Sydney, Bondi Junction, Universities and Hospitals a 10 min walk away.
fields.title: Sunny Oceanside Deco Apartment

fields.summary: We have four bedrooms in our home for guests.
fields.description: We have four bedrooms in our home for guests. This room has a queen bed with ensuite.  We have a large comfortable home with three double bedrooms and a single bedroom available with the usual homestay conditions. Our price includes breakfast of juice, cereal, toast, tea and coffee. We can provide special breakfast needs if required. You can  make your own dinner or we will provide dinner at a small cost. The upstairs bedrooms have a share bathroom and the downstairs double bedroom has its own bathroom. In each room we provide clean hotel quality bed linen and towels. The upstairs bedrooms are airconditioned. We are in the northern suburbs of Sydney in a quiet bushland setting. Being out of the city centre we can provide you with the tranquility you need after a hard day's sightseeing - away from the noise and lights! We have a pool, wireless internet and cable TV. Use of the family computer if you do not have a laptop (limited to one hour per day). Use of the washing machine is includ
fields.title: Northern suburbs tranquility

Huge windows opening out on to district and park views. Polished wooden floorboards.  MIDDLE FLOOR:   - 2 large bedrooms: one with bunk bed and huge bi-fold windows; second with single bed and french doors leading onto a verandah overlooking the street.  - Both bedrooms have built in wardrobes. - Large family bathroom with bath and separate shower - Separate toilet. - Polished wooden floorboards. GROUND FLOOR  2 separate living areas - front room with deluxe new sofa bed - spacious open plan living, dining and kitchen with high ceilings and full width bi-fold doors opening on to courtyard. Separate laundry/toilet. Polished concrete floors.  Ducted airconditioning throughout the entire house.  The house is 2 minutes walk from the cool shops, cafes, restaurants, pubs and bars of King Street.  Newtown train station o

Apartment Description  The apartment  was cut and built into the Bondi sandstone with the generous help of my 3 children and friends over 2 years. The apartment is located below our home. Apartment Inclusions  The ap

It is a quiet location abundant with wildlife and wonderful bushland walks.  There is so much to explore locally but yet it is within comfortable distance of also exploring the main sites that Sydney has to offer.
fields.description: Hideaway Cottage is nestled on the shores of Fisherman's Bay in Port Hacking in the Royal National Park,  just 50 klms drive south of the Sydney CBD.  It is a quiet location abundant with wildlife and wonderful bushland walks.  There is so much to explore locally but yet it is within comfortable distance of also exploring the main sites that Sydney has to offer. Experience the best of the Australian bush and Sydney city life with a holiday in this spacious open plan and comfortable waterfront cottage, located on the shores of beautiful Fisherman's Bay in the Royal National Park within 50kms from the Sydney CBD and just 40 minutes from Sydney Airport. Whether you are traveling from overseas to experience Sydney and the surrounds or just want a great short getaway without having to travel miles, Hideaway Cottage is just for you. Accommodation consists of 3 bedrooms, 2 with Queen sized beds, another large bedroom with 2 single beds. . There are 2 large bathrooms one with spa, plus an extr
fields.notes: Although the pantry is always fully stocked with all the basics, guests should provide their own fresh produce and meat supplies. Fresh milk, bread, butter will be supplied on arrival. If a shopping list is supplied, I will ensure that all the groceries etc are in the fridge/pantry ready on your arrival.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: A special part of the world.  If you want a slice of the Australian Bush and also like the water and still do not want to travel for hours to find both.  Then this is for you. The Maianbar/Bundeena basin is an artists haven and there are plenty of  small studios to explore.
fields.transit: A car is definitely required but there is a little ferry from Bundeena across to Cronulla.  From there you can take the train into the city if you do not feel like driving.
fields.title: SYDNEY BUSHLAND WATERFRONT HIDEAWAY

fields.description: Waterloo is a hip inner city suburb, 3km south of Sydney's CBD. Close to Dank St where you'll surround yourself with restaurants, art galleries and designer furniture stores. East Village marketplace has amazing fresh produce, restaurants and Virgin Active. Stylishly designed one bedroom apartment located in Waterloo.  Just around the corner to Danks Street as it's a 4 minute walk away or a 5-10 minutes cab ride to the city (depending on traffic) with Surry Hills as our neighbouring suburb which has so many great places to visit at your fingertips.  East Village marketplace is a 5 minute walk where you'll find a butcher, fishmonger, green grocer, bakery, pharmacy and supermarket. ACCOMMODATION; comprises 1 bedroom, spacious open plan lounge/dining with floor to ceiling sliding doors leading to an entertaining courtyard with barbecue, state of the art kitchen with Caesarstone bench tops and gas BOSCH cooking, chic designer bathroom, built-in robes, internal laundry and bedroom facing a

Virgin Active my gym is only a 5 minute walk.  East Village marketplace is my local shopping centre, has great produce as I love to cook.

If you hire a car you can park this is the in complex as we have vistors bay or on Hunter Street with no metre restrictions.

fields.summary: Staying in Newtown means you get all the fun of Sydney, with all the fun people. This is seriously the best part of Sydney. Newtown is known for its eateries, coffee shops, book stores, art galleries, cinema and bars. It is awesome.
fields.description: Staying in Newtown means you get all the fun of Sydney, with all the fun people. This is seriously the best part of Sydney. Newtown is known for its eateries, coffee shops, book stores, art galleries, cinema and bars. It is awesome. The house is in Newtown in a quiet street with large trees and a park. You just have to cross the park to get to King street. The shops, train station, hospital and the University are 5 minutes away. The house is very modern with a lap pool. Spread over 3 floors it has 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a large open plan kitchen, lounge, laundry and garage. The bedroom has a nice comfortable queen bed, a desk and chair, lots of wardrobe space, a fan, air/con and a balcony.  There is facility for tea and coffee in your room. You can put breakfast stuff in the kitchen but no cooking allowed. I live with one cat( a Devon Rex) who is no problem with people with allergies. There is wireless internet for you to use. The house is quiet except for the birds at sunset. You ca
fields.notes: There are 300 restaurants close by in Newtown and most of them  very reasonably priced.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Newtown is very convenient to the Airport and Sydney's CBD. The Sydney University and Royal Prince Alfred Hospital are also within a short stroll away. Once a modest working class area, Newtown now boasts one  of the most popular restaurant strips which this city has to offer. Excellent eating from many nationalities abounds here. Best of all you don't have to be on an endless budget to enjoy breakfast, lunch and dinner. There are 600 restaurants close by in Newtown and most of them are very reasonably priced. Our local area is now one of the most sought after residential addresses. Businesses, particularly restaurants, have flocked to King Street, which is at Newtown's heart. The area is well serviced with smart shopping and is now a far cry from its modest beginnings in the 1960's. Culturally Newtown is like no other suburb in Sydney, or, quite possibly, Australia. Here is the highest concentration of live theater venues found anywhere in the country. Newtown is a stimulating melting
fields.title: Stunning room + own bathroom + POOL

fields.description: Welcome to Alexandria! Come stay and enjoy this beautifully presented 1 bedroom security apartment in Alexandria, conveniently located near public transport to City, Coogee Beach and Airport. Features 1 bedroom with a king sized bed, ensuite with bath and second toilet in the fully equiped internal laundry, a large balcony, ceiling fans, a dishwasher, Gas stove, Electric Oven, Wireless Internet and a lift. There is also plenty of visitor parking available, but you need someone inside the apartment to press the button to allow access. You are well positioned to enjoy all that Sydney has to offer; restaurants, cafes, galleries, our beautiful harbour and beaches. There are still plenty of fashion warehouse stores around if you're looking for a new outfit to step out in.

The loft apartment will surprise you with design and style. Bright and airy in the day time and cosy at night- this is the perfect place to come home to, whatever your day entails.

My place is equipped with fast internet, fridge, washing machine, tv etc. I haven't rented my place out before much but have rented from people through
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Newtown is one of Sydney's most vibrant and eclectic suburbs. The Historic 19th Century inner city precinct of Newtown balances classic Victorian Architecture with cutting-edge modern city life. It is home to Sydney's most colourful mix of cosmopolitan and bohemian cultures. All of this is prominently on display on King Street, the central Newtown promenade and a mecca of alternative street life. King Street is packed with cheap restaurants, quirky cafes, late night bars, off-beat fashion stores, left-of-centre bookshops, cinemas and much, much more.
fields.transit: Newtown is a great place to base yourself as there is lots of fast public transport options going to the city, darling harbour, Sydney olympic park. the beach you name it. Train is 5 mins walk from my place and bus is about 1 minute away. Newtown is close to Sydney Uni, Central Station, hospitals, parks, theatres and pools.

The access to the accommodation is a little narrow with stairs ( quirky old pub) but we haven't had any problems, any concerns please contact us.  Room configuration as follows: - 4 Queen rooms - 1 Queen room with double bunk  -Two and a half bathrooms and a lounge/breakfast room. All rooms have TV ,air con, ceiling fans and external windows some with views over the city and harbour bridge. Rooms can also  be booked individua

fields.description: You can see the ocean from your balcony and it's only a ten minute walk down for a swim or a short bus ride into the city to enjoy all that Sydney has to offer Welcome! I do a lot of traveling so am happy to host you in my home & show you my part of the world. My apartment is a short stroll down to Coogee one of Sydney's most popular beaches, and only a 20/25min bus ride into the city & Sydney Harbour. Coogee itself is full of cafes & restaurants to suit all palettes & purses & has a wonderful coastal walk winding past Gordons Bay which is great for snorkeling, Bronte which is a good surf beach & ending at Bondi Beach. Balcony and Ocean View! My apartment has a balcony off the living area and one also off your room with views over the Pacific Ocean where you can watch the sunrise. Or if you prefer, enjoy the walk and watch it sitting on the beach!  There is also an ocean pool nearby & tennis courts. You'll be sharing the bathroom with me along with the kitchen if you choose to cook occ

fields.description: Furnished, sunny, 1 bedroom apartment with a beautiful view of the city skyline through a huge picture window. Wonderfully located on our unique Springfield Avenue in Potts Point. Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood. ★ If the dates you want are not available but you would still like the convenience of Potts Point, please follow this link https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/1261500/listings to view my other listings close by.  ★ The building is art deco. The apartment has windows on three sides. It has a queen sized bed, a kitchen with dishwasher, a washer/drier and a two flat-screen TVs. ★★ Key Features ★★  LIVING ROOM:  - Plasma TV - PlayStation 2 & a selection of games - Dvd player (in the playstation) - ipod sound cube - Tastefully & comfortably furnished - Huge west facing window - Unlimited wireless internet connection - Fireplace - Desk  KITCHEN: - Dishwasher - Fridge  - Microwave  - 2 Burner stove - Cutlery, utensils, pots, pans etc. - Breakfast counter  BEDROOM:
fields.notes: ★ Parking. Parking is subject to availability. The cost is $25 per day and must be booked at the time of your reservation.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood (think Soho London, The East Village NYC). During the last decade Potts Point has become recognised as one of the most desirable places to live in Sydney. Many empty-nesters have sold their family homes in the suburbs and bought an apartment in the neighbourhood. Many young families now choose to live here, so much so that the sight of prams, once as rare in Potts Point as koalas, are now part of the diverse mix of locals. And why wouldn't anybody want to live here? It is the most cosmopolitan 'hood' in Australia. It is beautiful, grand old art deco buildings, and harbour side parks; it is a walk to the city through the Botanic Gardens; you can get a coffee downstairs, and have a drink after dinner. It is all about amenity. It is a vibrant, living, inner-urban community.
fields.transit: It is two minutes walk to the nearest train station or you can walk into the CBD in fifteen minutes. There is a go-get car for hire by the hour on the street. Harbour-side parks are 5 minutes walk. The surf beaches are also a short train/ bus ride away. Within walking distance of the Botanic Gardens, Opera House, Art Gallery, Australian Museum, central business district & most tourist sites  AIRPORT: - Taxis takes about 20 minutes and cost about $50 (depending on the time of day).  - Shuttle bus stops at nearby hotels. This costs approx. $14 but takes much longer as it makes a number of stops. - Train. Domestic Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.22 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station - Train. International Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.81 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station

Close enough to relax to the sound of the ocean waves at night and only a short stroll to Newport’s restaurants and shops. Relax in the child friendly and private north facing tropical garden, dine ál fresco’, or throw your towel over your shoulder and head to the beach for a dip. Enjoy a game of lawn bowls, tennis or a refreshing drink just 1 minutes walk down your street.  Newport Beach is a good surfing beach.  Locals surf, paddle board, surf ski and make great use of the Newport Surf club. There is also a wonderful sea pool at the southern most end. The streets are very quiet.  There is a lovely old style Bowles club just next to the Tennis club down the road which is wonderful for an afternoon beer or barefoot Bowles.  The restaurants are truly at the end of the street. Newport Arms Hotel is at the top of the Newport hill and has great bands, district views as well a

fields.summary: Your oasis at the beach with an awesome view!
fields.description: Your oasis at the beach with an awesome view! This top floor furnished 2 bedroom (2 queens), 1 bathroom apt is 2 blocks from the beach and comes with parking in front. Fully stocked kitchen. It is on the corner block and therefore, provides panoramic views with cross flow ventilation so an air conditioner is not required. A floor fan is in the apt if needed. It is stylishly appointed with modern furnishings; 8 seater wood dining table; 42" Plasma Television; DVD/Stereo; Wifi; clothes washer and all other basic conveniences.  I prefer mature adults or professionals who will be able to take care of my place as if it was their own. A quiet block of 6 apartments and so this is not a party place. Extra blow up mattress if family with children. Linen, towels and beach towels provided. Cleaning is done weekly. You have full access to the apartment I happy to provide any information you may require. Coogee is a beachside suburb of local government area City of Randwick 6 kilometres south-east
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Coogee is a beachside suburb of local government area City of Randwick 6 kilometres south-east of the Sydney central business district, in the state of New South Wales, Australia. It is also a part of the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney. Within walking distance of the apartment you will find quality restaurants, cosy coffee shops and shops for your daily groceries.

Leichhardt / Annandale and Inner West - State Transit Bus - 370 . Bondi Junction - State Transit Bus - (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  . Maroubra - State Transit Bus 375/376 . Postcard views can be seen from all rooms through floor to ceiling glass sliding doors. Spacious bedroom has built in wardrobes and mosaic tiled bathroom  with oversized walk in shower. A fully equipped designer kitchen with stainless steel bench tops and Smeg appliances. Features - The prime central address includes security parking for one car, 24 hr. concierge, video security and intercom, level lift access, pool gym and sauna. Public transport and extensive shopping is on your doorstep, surrounded by extensive array of restaurants, bars, pubs and shopping. Amenities like Wifi internet access and Cable  are included.

Recently renovated, it has a designer bathroom, courtyard with BBQ for entertaining, a double bed in a quiet room and single bedroom perfect for a child. There is Foxtel, Netflix, wi-fi and all of the bits and pieces (books, games, crockery) you need to make it home. The entire house. I will be available on the phone. The terrace is located in the Redfern side of Alexandria.  Opposite is a beautiful park full of fig trees, a playground and BBQs. It is close to the Fountain Street entertainment precinct where there are some excellent cafes and restaurants. There are two IGA grocery stores within a 15 minute walk, some great small bars and pubs around Redfern and Erksineville and Newtown is really close by. It's a friendly neighbourhood and there are also a bunch of clothing an
fields.notes: We would love if you wouldn't mind giving the plants the occasional drink of water.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The terrace is located in the Redfern side of Alexandria.  Opposite is a beautiful park full of fig trees, a playground and BBQs. It is close to the Fountain Street entertainment precinct where there are some excellent cafes and restaurants. There are two IGA grocery stores within a 15 minute walk, some great small bars and pubs around Redfern and Erksineville and Newtown is really close by. It's a friendly neighbourhood and there are also a bunch of clothing and shoe outlets nearby if you don't mind a little bargain shopping. If you're up for a short bike trip, The Grounds of Alexandria is just up the road.
fields.transit: There is a bus stop on the opposite side of the road that takes you to Bondi and Coogee, and another bus stop a couple minutes walk away that takes you into the City. If you're eager, you can walk into town via Dalring Harbour in around 35-40 minutes. Redfern is the closest train station, but Green Square on the airport line is walkable also. We have two adult bikes that can be used, there is a carpark on site and free parking near the park on the other side of the road.

fields.summary: A true inner city warehouse conversion, what used to be a printing factory is now a sanctuary for plant lovers, chefs, audiophiles and creatives alike. Located in a cull-de-sac lane with street level entry, a shared rooftop with BBQs, views and more.
fields.description: A true inner city warehouse conversion, what used to be a printing factory is now a sanctuary for plant lovers, chefs, audiophiles and creatives alike. Located in a cull-de-sac lane with street level entry, a shared rooftop with BBQs, views and more. Welcome to Sydney! Beautiful high ceilings with exposed wooden beams and an open plan layout are what make this space unique. It's an airy private loft apartment in a surprisingly quiet laneway in Darlinghurst/East Sydney.  2 minutes walk to Oxford Street, 5 minutes to Hyde park in central Sydney. Not many people live this close to Sydney city centre.  The kitchen offers everything you need. We like to cook, so if you do, enjoy it!  The loft has plenty of wardrobe space and a cosy setup for sleeping and watching movies. It has  a fancy queen size mattress, Egyptian cotton sheets, and nice pillows. The living area is spacious and has a nice sound system with record player and records for you to flick through. You can also plugin your iPod o
fields.notes: Our apartment is a converted warehouse with exposed timber ceilings throughout. We have a fancy Blue Air air purifier which does an excellent job of keeping the place as dust free.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Darlinghurst is the 'cool' part of town.. Neighbouring Surry Hills, Kings Cross and the CBD. This is the area where the fun stuff happens, loads of bars, restaurants, cafes and clubs etc. Check the map for a few tips.
fields.transit: Our home does not have designated parking, there is plenty of street parking which is metered during the day, but free at night. While Sydney is NOT renowned for its amazing public transport, we are located in an area that is well connected. Oxford street has buses to the beaches, Museum train station is 5 mins walk, Town Hall is less than 10 min walk. Taxis are everywhere. You can find everything you need like supermarkets, shops, bars etc. on foot - no need for public transport unless you are heading further out!

Nestled in the beautiful suburb of Newington which is the former Sydney Olympic Village, the home is about 15 km inner west of downtown Sydney.  This suburb is surrounded by hundreds of hectares of park and Aussie bush lands, Olympic sporting facilities, walking and cycling paths are everywhere in this leafy Oasis.  A small shopping Market-Place is only 300m away with a large  supermarket, multicultural restaurants(Japanese, Korean, Thai, Middle Eastern, Pizza and Sea Foo

Use of 2 train lines to the city and also to the Central Coast/ Newcastle and to Macquarie Uni. Please note Hornsby is a suburb and is about 35/40 mins by train to the centre of Sydney - the train line is quite safe to travel home late in the evening. Walk to Hornsby Station is about 10 minutes or there is a local bus right outside the door.  Taxi's always available at the Station if you come home late approx. $8. In Hornsby we have a great Westfield shopping centre which is in walking distance plus 2 cinema's.  Restaurants available in Hornsby and surro

My house is a 10-15 min easy walk to Hornsby station or there is a local bus right outside the door.  I am a early riser and go to the gym 3 mornings at 6am and therefore go to bed fairly early in the evening Breakfast is help yourself

We have a great Westfield shopping centre with great shops and competitive prices. Access to small local cinema and also Greater Union cinema complex.  Great new restaurant in Wahroonga (next suburb) called Butchers Block for breakfast and lunch fantastic food. Other good restaurants in Hornsby particularly some of the Japanese small restaurants

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Balgowlah is a great area and has the luxury of being close to the beach while having the city easily accessible as well.  Surrounded by natural beauty, the area is blessed with several beaches and stunning nature reserves where you can while away the time picnicking, barbecuing and sunning yourself or enjoying many of the adventure or sporting activities the area has to offer. Not far from the cafe culture and Bar scene of Manly, Balgowlah also has an array of restaurants and cafes right on the doorstep
fields.transit: There are plenty of buses right out the door that get you to the city, the local malls, Mosman, Neutral Bay, Crows Nest, Manly and along the Northern Beaches. Buses are frequent in all directions and on-street parking is also available. The Manly Ferry wharf is only 2km away with Fast Ferries to Watson's Bay and the Eastern Suburbs, or the traditional ferries taking you in to the heart of the city.

Enjoy the bathroom with a bath tub and a shower. Modern kitchen which is equipped with: - dishwasher - cook-top - oven - microwave +Internal laundry with washing machine.  The area:  Sunny side, 5 mins walk to Coogee beach. Local cafes, fine restaurants, shops, beaches, buses to the city.  Feel free to ask any questions! fields.neighbourhood_overview: Coogee is fantastic neighborhood, with many cafes, restaurants, bars, a great mix of tourists and locals.

fields.description: A bright, quiet, friendly one bedroom, living and dining Bondi Beach pad for you!  Recently renovated kitchen and bathroom.  The apartment is perfectly located in a quiet pocket between two of Sydneys' most famous beaches.  It is in small block with level access, right near the waves, coastal walks and all the good things of Bondi. Fully and joyfully furnished, would best suit a single or couple who want a peaceful retreat.  The apartment is an easy wander to all the action,  bus or train rides into the city and beyond. Nearby numerous cafes and wine bars, restaurants, grocery stores, health-food stores, a fresh fish shop, bakery and butcher are all very close if you choose to get creative in the kitchen.  I will leave my special recommendations for you in a file so you can make the most of local area, although just walking out the door and down the road to the beach will be the first thing you do. Grab a great Australian coffee and a muffin on the way and just sit and absorb it all.
fields.notes: Please use the squeejie provided in the bathroom for shower runoff and you will find the laundry down the right hand side of the building.. you have the keys on your set :)
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Describe Bondi?  No..just go...live it and experience this most famous, gregarious, playful and especially beautiful place.
fields.transit: There is timed parking in the street, 2 hours. The buses in and out of Bondi leave from Bondi Rd, three minutes walk from your front door.
fields.title: Bondi Beach - bright, happy, haven

fields.summary: Decidedly cool. Chill out in this bright & beautiful Darlinghurst Studio, right in the heart of the best of Victoria St cafe's, back street art galleries, theatres plus chic eateries on Stanley St. Live in Art Deco history with best view in town!
fields.description: Decidedly cool. Chill out in this bright & beautiful Darlinghurst Studio, right in the heart of the best of Victoria St cafe's, back street art galleries, theatres plus chic eateries on Stanley St. Live in Art Deco history with best view in town! NEWLY RETILED BATHROOM AND ENTIRE STUDIO PAINTED :-) Entire home, not shared. Last minute bookings cannot be accepted after 4pm same day and we also need 2hrs notice to organise cleaners. This top floor apartment (5th floor, accessible via lift or stairs) with very high ceilings and 1920s heritage art deco features is a space that is full of light all day long with an incredible vista day or night.  Don't stay here if you don't love character with an oldy worldy Parisian loft feel as this studio is filled to the brim with character and charm for those who love original details. Included in the old world charm are old world building sounds like a distant clunking sound when the lift is operated. Older buildings were built so well and the thick
fields.notes: Rates are seasonal and change throughout the year. NYE dates require minimum one week booking. To find the rates and date availability, please go to our home page and click your dates on the top right hand corner. This will also provide rates for dates selected. The studio does not have AC. Installing AC in this studio would be in vain as the studio does not need extra cooling. The studio is on the top floor and has a wonderful cross breeze that all have loved and enjoyed. It also faces east so only gets the morning sun, not the hot afternoon western sun, were it on the other side of the building it would be a different story. The studio has a large ceiling fan if extra cooling is required, but beyond the fan, AC is not needed at all. We are sorry but we do not have the means to check in guests after 11pm.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: This leafy inner city suburb offers stunning residential streetscape. A pocket of pulsating options, the streets come alive at night in this most convenient of locations in Sydney.  Darlinghurst is a very safe inner city suburb. The closest train station, Kings Cross, is sometimes sketchy, but like all blue light areas, there is a high police patrol, so we feel very safe there. Darlinghurst is the next suburb and has a cafe and restaurant vibe, so it's very different to Kings Cross. Darlinghurst has all the best attractions and is walking distance to CBD, the harbour and Oxford Street shopping.
fields.transit: There are many buses and trains all within a close walking distance from our studio. Our street has a 99% walking score! You can walk anywhere to Sydney's biggest attractions and just a bus to beaches such as Bondi Beach :-)
fields.title: Darlinghurst Studio: Sky Oasis

fields.summary: Our private downstairs area is not an "apartment" but part of our home. The space is never shared with guests from another party. Breakfast is on our main deck with views over Newport Beach and ocean.  Newport is on the beautiful northern beaches & is close to Pittwater, Palm Beach & Kuringai Chase National Park.

Those rooms are on the ground floor with a bathroom and a sitting/TV room with cable TV, coffee/tea makings and a bar fridge.  That space and bathroom are yours alone as we will not book other guests during the same period.   For larger groups, such as three coup

fields.transit: Good bus service to the city and points north - every few minutes during the off peak via the 199 and B Line buses or the more infrequent L90.  Drive or bus to Manly for the ferry to the city or to Palm Beach for ferries across Pittwater or to the Central Coast.

fields.summary: Soak up the sunshine on a lounger at this inner-city house, tucked away in a quiet street, yet close to the action. Recharge in this bright, modern, air-conditioned space, which opens onto a secluded outdoor terrace area.
fields.description: Soak up the sunshine on a lounger at this inner-city house, tucked away in a quiet street, yet close to the action. Recharge in this bright, modern, air-conditioned space, which opens onto a secluded outdoor terrace area.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Victoria Street, Stanley Street, and Crown Street are culturally rich destinations. These high street areas are connected by a network of laneways and street corners replete with small bars, cafes, and boutique indie retail.
fields.transit: Getting around the inner areas of Sydney is easy from this location. Most attractions are within walking distance (within 20-30 mins walk). However, if you're not so keen on walking, there are numerous bus routes that service the area (from Flinders Street and Oxford Street). The Sydney public transport network can most easily be accessed with use of an Opal Card - which I can supply if needed.
fields.title: Relax on the Terrace of a Darlinghurst Home

fields.summary: - At the crossroads of Surry Hills, Paddington and Darlinghurst in a quiet lane - Classic terrace house with recent renovations - Private room with queen futon - Shared bathroom and kitchen, 2 shared living areas - Helpful, but hands-off hosts
fields.description: - At the crossroads of Surry Hills, Paddington and Darlinghurst in a quiet lane - Classic terrace house with recent renovations - Private room with queen futon - Shared bathroom and kitchen, 2 shared living areas - Helpful, but hands-off hosts This is a private room in a recently restored character terrace house in Darlinghurst, Sydney.   The room isn't huge, but it has a queen-sized futon with mattress topper and built-in wardrobes. There's a big window with a nice outlook and blinds, warm bedding, bedside lamp and power points. It is up a narrow flight of stairs with the bathroom downstairs, so if you have a small bladder and a hip replacement, it might get uncomfortable during the night. Bathroom is new and shared with us. There are toiletries here for you. There's wireless internet for your use, a printer for tickets etc, a washer/dryer in the bathroom, a clothesline in the backyard and a dishwasher in the kitchen.  There's a living room in the front, extra sofa in the kitchen and
fields.notes: Thanks for reading our description. If this sounds like what you're looking for, please get in touch. We look forward to meeting you.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The terrace is in a leafy lane and very quiet but is steps from 3 of our favourite suburbs: Surry Hills, Darlinghurst and Paddington. We spend time in Surry Hills for our hipster fix, restaurants and groceries; Darlinghurst for bars and the new Eternity Playhouse theatre and Paddington for people watching and shopping.
fields.transit: Aside from the beach, we rarely have reason to venture more than a few blocks from the house for shopping, restaurants, cafes, bars, parks and friends.  It´s a half-hour walk through Hyde Park to the business district and a 15 minute (hilly) walk to Central Station. Buses to the beaches go from around the corner: ~20-40 minutes depending on which beach you choose and the traffic. Our favourite is Bronte. You can also walk to Bronte in just over an hour through gorgeous Centennial Park.  There are lots of GoGet pods if you're a member and we're very well serviced by Uber (their app sometimes thinks our street's one-way, so you might want to walk outside and meet them on Hannam St a few doors down)
fields.title: Stylish Home In Great Location

fields.description: At Linridge Rest B&B it is our pleasure to provide guests with all the comforts of a modern family home.  Hosts, Carol and Alan have over 15 years experience of making visitors welcome to Sydney, be they tourists, country visitors, business people, local family overflow, academics or relatives of patients in nearby hospitals.  Our peaceful and quiet location makes it an ideal springboard for whatever your day’s activities will entail. Linridge Rest B&B is just 10 minutes walk to a direct train service to central Sydney, Sydney Harbour and main attractions including the Opera House, Darling Harbour and The Rocks. We have two spacious, modern rooms with everything you will need.  One has an ensuite and kitchenette and the other a private bathroom.  For two couples, a large family or a group travelling together, the interconnected bedrooms provide ultimate flexibility.  Both rooms feature a 36” LCD TV, sitting area, tea/coffee making facilities, fridge and desk, are heated in winter and a
fields.notes: Guests should be aware that both bedrooms are located up one flight of stairs which are wide, well lit and have a sturdy handrail.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: A good selection of cafes, restaurants, and wine bars are only a short walk away in the local village.  Additionally, in the village is a supermarket, pharmacies, banks, a section of small retailers (gift shop, book shop, newsagent, post office, bakery, butcher) and a medical centre. There are a number of nice parks nearby plus a delightful National Park, all within easy walking distance.
fields.transit: Linridge Rest B&B is just 10 minutes walk to a direct train service to central Sydney, Sydney Harbour and main attractions including the Opera House, Darling Harbour and The Rocks.
fields.title: Hideaway in Sydney's North Shore

Transport: Regular buses go from Glebe Point Road (300m away), into the city. The House: Historic house architect designed in the 1920's, and recently renovated with modern new kitchen and bathrooms.  Bedrooms: 3 large sized bedrooms, perfect for 3 couples or a largish family. All top quality mattresses and linen. Kitchen: Newly r

Art-filled, lovingly renovated, 2 bedroom, 3 storey, 1890s terrace house.  From its iron lacework at the front of the house to a  peaceful and pretty garden at the back, it's a classic home of the area. Great kitchen, living areas. 7 mins walk to bustling Newtown.  No backpackers, unregistered guests or parties.

The little village with its cafes, bakery, pubs, interesting local shops, well-supplied supermarkets and little parks is just a

fields.transit: Lots of public transport - buses to the beach and two different train stations, on different lines, which take you to the city within 8 minutes.  Each station is just 200 m of the house, but due to the triangle of train line we sit within, the train noise is distant.

fields.summary: PRESTIGE HARBOUR SIDE LIFESTYLE You will feel pampered staying at this large contemporary apartment, awash with natural light and showcasing breathtaking un-interrupted iconic views across the Harbour to the soaring city skyline and Harbour Bridge.
fields.description: PRESTIGE HARBOUR SIDE LIFESTYLE You will feel pampered staying at this large contemporary apartment, awash with natural light and showcasing breathtaking un-interrupted iconic views across the Harbour to the soaring city skyline and Harbour Bridge. Imagine waking up to beautiful view of Sydney Harbour from your bed in this spacious apartment. Whether you are sipping wine on our waterfront balconies, or relaxing in the spacious bedrooms, you will enjoy 270° uninterrupted view of colourful sky and sparkling Sydney Harbour and its world known landmarks from sunrise to sunset. At sunset, watch its colourful reflection on the city skyscrapers as they lit up and sparkle before night falls. fields.description: An elegant 1865 sandstone hotel converted into a contemporary 3 bedroom home in the waterside suburb of Balmain just a 10 minute bus trip from the heart of the CBD. A private, peaceful and luxurious house that can accommodate up to 7 people. An eclectic collection of objects d'art, paintings and books add to the charm. On the entrance level there are 2 double bedrooms, the main opening onto a small courtyard. A modern mosaic tile bathroom with shower, bath and heated towel rail service these bedrooms. On the same level is a large studio/office with internet connection and a genuine French ‘bebe foot table’ if you wish to re-enact the world cup. This area also has a daybed that can be made up into a single bed creating a 4th bedroom. Upstairs is the open plan living, dining and kitchen with original sandstone walls, pressed metal ceilings and floor boards dating from 1865. Flooded with northern light this charming room opens onto a large covered balcony that runs the width of the house.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Balmain had its  beginnings as a working class suburb. It has gone through many incarnations over the years from bohemians moving in through the 70's, artists, writers, actors and academics with an influx of families in more recent times. A colourful area which once boasted 40 pubs, now retaining some of these with a mix of cafes, restaurants. A peninsular, surrounded by the harbour on both sides lined by parks, a delight to walk around. Friendly, community inspired, this is why I love this area, not  to mention 10 minutes from the centre of the CBD.
fields.transit: Public transport is ideal here, a bus around the corner to the CBD in 10 minutes or take a ferry to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour. I also can provide a visitor's parking permit if required.
fields.title: The eclectic Pacific in Balmain

fields.description: Welcome to Waverton The Apartment Room with exclusive bath/shower/toilet and private access to terrace is available in a high class, modern 3 br apartment. I am inviting you to share lounge, kitchen and outside areas. As our guest all facilities are included for free. Walk through the gardens or in the bush. Have a game of tennis. Enjoy the gym and a sauna. Have a swim in the long indoor lap pool or in any of the two outdoor pools and relax in the spa whenever you want. If you have a car we offer secure undercover parking. The Local Area We live in the beautiful Wondakiah Estate in Waverton and offer you to join us for your visit to Sydney. A quiet oasis very close to the city, Wondakiah offers landscaped gardens between two nature reserves and waterfront to Sydney Harbour. Public Transport Waverton station on the Northern train line is 4 minutes' walk away. From there, it is only a 10 minute train ride into the bustling CBD.  We look forward to having you stay with us. Gregory
fields.title: Resort Style minutes from the City

fields.description: Sunny, breezy, top floor studio with balcony, less than 100 metres to Bondi Beach! Ever dreamed of waking up to uninterrupted sunlight gently filtering in, as you luxuriate in the hotel quality sheets on your four poster bed? Then stepping outside to find a variety of specialty cafes offering tempting breakfasts and excellent coffee, before wandering down to the beach? Spend your days at Ruby’s Oasis exploring what Bondi has to offer. The Bondi to Bronte coastal walk starts at the Bondi Icebergs, where you can also swim laps in the ocean pool, or relax in their sauna that looks out over the water.  Discover the airy yoga studios, cafes, and restaurants, boutique shops and mini galleries before sampling the delicious drinks and live music on offer at one of the many vibrant bars that open their doors at sunset. A luxury beachside lifestyle, plus easy public transport to the CBD! Featuring a sunlit balcony, this renovated  studio comes with a beautiful, four poster queen size bed, fully
fields.title: Ruby's Oasis on Bondi Beach!

fields.description: G'day!   Our studio apartment is self contained with a Queen size bed, sofa, dining table and chairs, work bench and plenty of storage space.   It is equipped with TV, Wi Fi, Air Cond, well stocked kitchen, bathroom with shower and a private entrance.  You would also have the use of our pool and laundry facilities available if need be.  We live in what is known as Sydney's Hills district and are within walking distance to Muirfield Golf Course and Westfield shopping Centre, North Rocks.  Macquarie University, one of Australia's leading universities is not far away. The studio apartment is attached to our house which overlooks Bidjigal Reserve, a place of rugged natural beauty and full of hidden treasures; a time capsule of ancient ecosystems, aboriginal shelters and colonial history with sheer sandstone cliffs, towering eucalypt forest, sparkling creeks and sheltered rainforest gullies, it is an oasis of natural habitat in the middle of urban Sydney. fields.neighbourhood_overview: We are in an area of Sydney called the 'inner west'. Politically, it's a left leaning area with lots of immigrants - Greeks from the 1960s and Vietnamese from the 70s. It also has lots of artists and is gay friendly. About 700 metres from our place is the train to the city - 15 minute ride. There is also a bus to the city just up the road.

fields.description: Welcome to Pennant Hills! Your Space One bedroom available in leafy suburban friendly family home in Sydney's northwest, 1/4 acre yard with gardens, fishponds, chickens and a black Labrador dog. Large sunny deck overlooks the back yard. Walk to shops and train (45 minutes to CBD). Free wireless internet. Breakfast is included.      Local attractions The entry to the Great Northern Walk (a bush walk which goes from Sydney all the way to Newcastle) is at the end of our street. Koala Park, where you can see and even pet a wide range of native animals, is also in Pennant Hills, with an easy bus service to it. Pennant Hills Park is a large public sports complex with tennis courts, soccer fields, netball, and archery. Your Hosts We are a relaxed older professional couple, we enjoy meeting travellers from around the world.  He is a research scientist/inventor. She is a videomaker and ESL teacher.

fields.description: We're located in Sydney's Inner West, about 6km from the city centre.  The nearest train station is an 8 minute walk with a 12 minute ride to Central Station. Only a stop or 2 more and you have easy access to the Harbour, Opera House and museums and galleries. We're also 15-20 minutes drive from the airport. As for most of Sydney there's a huge range of cuisines and cultures on your doorstep. Our neighbourhood and close surrounds feature strong flavours of Portuguese, Italian and Vietnamese cultures.  Our neighbourhood has many nice old houses and established trees. There are several parks within walking distance as well as a local swimming pool. It's an area with many families as well as people who just want to live in a nice area in close proximity to the centre of Sydney and easy access to the bush, harbour and bay walks, cycling paths, city cafes and Sydney's 'arty' areas in the Inner West. Our home is open plan, light and has a lovely feel. The original house dates from the 1880s,
fields.title: Lovely spacious 3 bedroom home

fields.description: One of the best kept secrets of Sydney's South, beautiful, sheltered Shipwright Bay Just 15 minutes from Sydney's domestic and International airport and with the most relaxing, tranquil views from balcony, bedroom and lounge room you will think you have arrived in heaven This spacious and tastefully decorated apartment is so comfortable you will love lazing around and may not even want to visit the two a la carte restaurants that are one minute walking distance. Two double bedrooms both with fantastic queen size beds.  The famous Smith's oyster barn and fresh fish and chippery is only a few doors away.  Go to sleep with the sound of gentle wavelets lapping up to the stonewall of your balcony and wake up to the sound of kurrawongs and kookaburras echoing across the Georges River. Overlooking Blakehurst marina, the jetty and Shipwright Bay where you can fish from our balcony or at Tom Ugly's Point. About your Hosts Italian/Australian hosts who live in the main house will ensure you have

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Chippendale is the creative hub of Sydney. It's so close to the city, yet it's such a quiet and peaceful suburb. Plenty of restaurants and cafes in the immediate vicinity and the neighbourhood. There are two shopping centres close by: Broadway and Central Park. We have lived here for more than 10 years, and still loving it!

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Surry Hills is well known for being the buzziest inner city suburb with a diverse range of bars, excellent restaurants and shopping. It is surrounded by parks and tree lined streets, charming laneways and many gorgeous heritage listed terraces. It champions as the suburb that has the most cycle lanes. It has the most number of designers, creative people living and working here as it's demographic in Sydney. Over 60% of people are creatives and over 90% are small entrepreneur businesses. Groceries, cafés and galleries are at my doorstep. Public transport are all within minutes walk.  Bus stops are all within 2-8 minutes walk. Central Train station - 10 mins walk 20 mins walk to the inner city.  15 mins by bus to the city.  20 mins by bus to Bondi beach.  All in all, you're probably be saving close to $40 a day on taxis fares if you're further out as everything is close enough. If you're well travelled and keen to explore all that Sydney has to offer, This is the perfect spot, The house
