fields.neighbourhood_overview: Newport Beach is one of Sydney's premier surfing beaches and is just 10 minutes away accessed by a pathway and stair opposite the apartment.  There are a number of walks around the Crown of the Hill reserve which take you to patches of remnant rainforest and spectacular coastal views.  Newport Village is also nearby and has a number of restaurants of varying price ranges as well as a bar, supermarket, delicatessens and liquor stores. A number of restaurants provide home delivery. Newport is at the start of the Barrenjoey Peninsula which has some of Sydney's finest surfing beaches on the east and Pittwater, a sailor's paradise, to the west. There are several nearby golf courses and tennis courts for hire. "The Newport", Justin Hemmes recent upgrade of the famous "Newport Arms Hotel" is 5 min. by car or a 20 min. walk away. Set on the stunning shores of Pittwater, it is a vibrant gathering place for all ages. Nestled amongst idyllic gardens, and incorporating various outdoor dining space

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is safe, giant old Moreton Bay fig trees line the streets, alive with bird song, surrounded by a small forest, friendly, arty, close to everything you need, nice people, close to the harbour and city. You can walk from the house across to Rushcutters Bay - 10 minutes - to the harbour foreshore and see the Harbour Bridge. Paddington was workers cottages originally so there are lots of little terraces, winding streets and laneways and is full of character. The area used to be a sandstone quarry. Please note that we are in a valley and it is an uphill walk to all public transportation/shops
fields.transit: There is a lot of public transport around our area. We are minutes walk to Edgecliff Station which has the Inner city train line that starts at Bondi Junction (Westfield), Edgecliff Station (our stop), Kings Cross (nightlife), Martin Place (city), Town Hall (city), Central (main station where all trains go). We are also a 10 minute walk to Oxford St where you can catch a 378 all the way to Bronte Beach or the 380 or 333 which run from Bondi Beach- Circular Quay (main buses of the Eastern Suburbs). Ferries depart from Circular Quay to view our sublime Harbour. I have a local map and a Sydney map printed for you to use with busses, restaurants etc on it to help you get about.

Setting the scene for your exploration of Newtown's galleries, shops, music venues, theatres, & restaurants (and exclusively for the enjoyment of guests), is a retrospective by Australian artist Tony Twigg. fields.neighbourhood_overview: Newtown has a buzz like no other suburb in Sydney.  Our street may bring you the music of young children at play in the primary school opposite, or the singing of worshippers in the Church just over the road, who coexist with rock bands that hire their church hall for rehearsals, as well as the classical musicians practising in their home just a couple of doors away. In Newtown it is no so much about the glitz or the glamour, it's more about our need to self-express. We're one big alternative vibe with our apartment, the venues, the food, the shops, the pubs and parks managing to keep life weirdly wonderful.
fields.transit: The bus stop at the corner of King Street and Carillon Avenue is about a 5 minute walk. Macdonaldtown train station is about 10/12 minute walk. Your apartment is close to the action, being just 350 metres from Sydney University School of Business , the University Union Wentworth Building and Art Galleries, Indoor pool etc.and 350 metres from Carriageworks and  Eveleigh Farmers' markets,  and 350 metres from King Street, with countless restaurants, cafes and pubs., the Vanguard Performance Venue, boutique shops ETC.  The apartment is also about 350 metres from Hollis Park which has a children’s play area in a beautifully leafy corner of the Park, right near a row of grand terrace houses. Sydney's major attractions are at Circular Quay; the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, Ferries to Manly, the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Rocks and the Botanic Gardens are just some of the attractions at Circular Quay. fields.description: A real home away from home.  Queen size room in spacious garden flat 5 minute walk to the famous Bondi Beach.  Each room looks out onto a leafy garden. Wooden floors, wifi, netflix, laundry, dishwasher and smoochy cat. Double bedroom available in a gorgeous, large sunny garden flat in North Bondi, just 5 mins from the famous Bondi beach and 1 min to transport. It really is a great base to explore both the immediate area and out and about around Sydney. Close to the cafes and shops and all that Bondi has to offer, but tucked away in a quiet community street - nice and tranquil, yet close to everything! The bedroom is a very good size, with Queen Bed, chair, hanging rail. Lovely polished floorboards. The room looks out over the garden - leafy and private. The flat itself has a large living area, in a quiet block of 4.  Polished wooden floor, living room, dining room, new kitchen, internal laundry, sunroom, wifi, plasma tv, netflix, Free on-street parking is available. To share with just
fields.neighbourhood_overview: It is so close to the beach, yet is very quiet and has a lovely community vibe. So many cafes, bars, restaurants to discover, along with the infamous Bondi Beach and iconic coastal walks. Transport is a few minutes away. There is everything that you need so close and all that Bondi has to offer, but still a tranquil escape.
fields.transit: There is a bus stop directly to the City just 2 mins from the front door. Further buses are just 5-7mins walk at the beach. The Rose Bay ferry is a 20 minute walk or 5-10min drive away.
fields.title: North Bondi Garden flat near beach

The kitchen is older in style and essentially looks like a homely beachhouse kitchen with all amenities provided. It looks very lively in brightly coloured reds and blues. The house is very close to public transport with various buses leavi

Enjoy your breakfast,  lunch or dinner on the deck overlooking the water. Enjoy surf and ocean pool swimming, long walks along the beach to Barrenjoey headland and lighthouse, Pittwater sunsets.  Can accommodate up to 6 people in three bedrooms - one queen, one king and two singles. A comfortable and relaxing atmosphere  - board games, books and broadsheets, the order of the day, rather than the big screen!  Cook your own meals in a cute 80s 'retro', wattle coloured, fully equipped, but basic, kitchen. Two bathrooms (one upstairs in th

A  Security Deposit bond will be required.* * The Security Deposit bond will be refunded subject to the conditions in the Standard Terms and Agreement being met. It is designed to cover any additional costs incurred including but not limited to, any breakage, damage or excess cleaning requirements, extra guests beyond those declared ..etc.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The beauty, peace and quietude of this magnificent part of Sydney's northern beaches must be seen and experienced. You will be in awe of the stunning natural beauty that surrounds you. Long walks on the beach, relaxing swims in crystal clear waters and relaxing on the deck, soaking up the view, with all the comforts of this cosy cottage at your fingertips!
fields.transit: Situated on the ocean side of Palm Beach on Whale Beach Rd if driving. You can catch a mini bus if you are arriving from the airport. The L90 Sydney bus service from the city to the Pittwater peninsula (Central via Wynyard stations to Palm Beach) runs regularly. It is the last stop on the peninsula.  I may be able to arrange to pick you and your bags up from the bus terminus, depending on your ETA or it is a 10-15 minute walk to the cottage from the bus stop. Of course, you might decide to drive or hire a rental car to get here and use it to get out and around during your stay. There is parking at street level on the road just outside the cottage.

fields.description: Recently renovated tranquil ground floor apartment with own entrance and garden in charming Classic Victorian 5 apartment building. 200m from the Beach near cricket oval and tennis courts. Walking distance to main Coogee high street with shops, restaurants, pubs and general amenities. Bus to city and Bondi Junction directly opposite. Coastal walk to Bondi at the end of the street. Property located on the northern side of Coogee just next to Clovelly. Marble kitchen fully equiped with Smeg appliances (gas cooktop) and integrated fridge and freezer. Everything you need for entertaining inside or out in the garden which has also been recently landscaped with limestone paving and new grass laid. Outdoor copper hot and cold shower for those warm summer days to wash off the sand from the beach. Marble bathroom with underfloor heating and heated towel rail. Shower (no bath). Decorated to reflect breezy Sydney beach lifestyle. Original floorboards painted white throughout with 3m high ceilings

fields.notes: CHECKING IN AND CHECKING OUT While we have set preferred check-in (2pm) and check-out times (9 - 9.30am), we will be as flexible as possible outside of these times to accommodate your needs whenever we can.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The neighbourhood is vibrant and lovely. Long ago it was an area with a rougher reputation but it is now becoming gentrified and has a strong, family community spirit.  Lots of families and academics are our neighbours. There are several local cafes and take-aways at your doorstep, vibrant Farmers Markets in our street on weekends, and we are near 2 large culture/performing arts centres (Seymour theatre and Carriageworks), if you want to catch a show while here - check out their websites. You can walk there! The studio is also walking distance to the vibrant Newtown and Glebe, yet remains a peaceful area.
fields.transit: Location & Getting Around The Darling Studio is in a fantastic location. Despite being located within 40ms of local friendly cafes, shops and parks, it is usually whisper-quiet. It is situated on a laneway, so the outlook is not stunning, but happily The Darling Studio is only 15 minutes walk to the hustle and bustle and all that King Street (Newtown), and its fabulous cafe and restaurant lifestyle, has to offer.  As the Studio overlooks a laneway, even though it is not a thorough-fare, you do hear vehicle noise and delivery vans occasionally. Redfern train station is just minutes away (but far enough away so that train noise is not a problem). By train, you can be at The Opera House, and the centre of Sydney, in less than 15 minutes. We are located just minutes from the University of Sydney, while UTS and Notre Dame campuses are a slightly longer walk away (about 12 - 18 minutes).  Australian Technology Park is also just 15 minutes walk away. The Darling Studio is also within an easy

Darlinghurst is a great location choice when visiting Sydney as it is centred between the City and Bondi.

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Wonderfully located on Victoria Street in Potts Point. Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood (think Soho London, The East Village NYC). Victoria Street is unique. Lined with beautiful trees, it starts at the Harbour and is filled with cafes and restaurants. During the last decade Potts Point has become recognised as one of the most desirable places to live in Sydney. Many empty-nesters have sold their family homes in the suburbs and bought an apartment in the neighbourhood. Many young families now choose to live here, so much so that the sight of prams, once as rare in Potts Point as koalas, are now part of the diverse mix of locals. And why wouldn't anybody want to live here? It is the most cosmopolitan 'hood' in Australia. It is beautiful, grand old art deco buildings and harbour side parks; it is a walk to the city through the Botanic Gardens; you can get a coffee downstairs, and have a drink after dinner. It is all about amenity. It is a vibrant, living, inner-urb
fields.transit: It is one minute walk to the nearest train station (Kings Cross) or you can walk into the CBD in fifteen minutes. There is a goget car for hire by the hour on the street. Harbour-side parks are 5 minutes walk. The surf beaches are also a short train/ bus ride away. Within walking distance of the Botanic Gardens, Opera House, Art Gallery, Australian Museum, central business district & most tourist sites  AIRPORT: - Taxis takes about 20 minutes and cost about $50 (depending on the time of day).  - Shuttle bus stops at nearby hotels. This costs approx. $14 but takes much longer as it makes a number of stops. - Train. Domestic Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.22 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station - Train. International Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.81 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station

fields.summary: We are a friendly household with a large (6 bdrm) house on Sydney's lower north shore. The neighbourhood is safe, leafy and easily accessible by bus and ferry.  We have two rooms available for guests, one twin, one double.  Breakfast is included.
fields.description: We are a friendly household with a large (6 bdrm) house on Sydney's lower north shore. The neighbourhood is safe, leafy and easily accessible by bus and ferry.  We have two rooms available for guests, one twin, one double.  Breakfast is included. We have two rooms available to guests.  This room has two king single beds and shared bathroom.  The beds are very comfy.  The other room has a queen bed and ensuite bathroom.  We have unlimited wifi, a swimming pool and on road parking.  The laundry is available for guests' use plus a spare refrigerator.   We look forward to welcoming you. Breakfast is included in the cost and you can either have access to the kitchen to make your own dinner or join us for $7 extra per person.  We have dinner together most nights so you would be welcome to join us.  The pool is also available to guests approx six months a year from mid Oct - mid Apr. We will interact with guests as much or as little as they wish to.  I am home quite often during the day so am
fields.notes: There will probably be other guests staying at the same time.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is friendly and safe.  The Longueville - Circular Quay ferry terminal is 5-10 mins walk away.  The houses are mostly quite large and there are several parks and bush walks within a short distance of each other.  The local shopping village is 2 km from our home.
fields.transit: We have easy access to the city centre.  There is a weekday ferry to Circular Quay just 7 mins walk away and the bus stop is 2 mins walk.  There is safe and plentiful on-road parking just outside.  To get to our home from the airport there are various options.  You can take a train to Wynyard then from Clarence St near Wynyard take the 261 bus and get off at the first stop on Kenneth St.  Uber or taxi can cost anything from $45-85 depending on traffic  or I offer a pick up service for $45  1 person, $50 for 2, $55 for 3. I am not always available to do this so please check first.

fields.summary: The Garden Cottage is a cosy and quiet one bedroom house in the leafy north of Sydney. Sleeping up to five people, it has everything to make your visit very comfortable. We are only 5 minutes' walk to Denistone train station and from there, it is 30 minutes on the train into Sydney. We are also handy to Sydney Olympic Park and Parramatta CBD. We are only a few minutes' easy walk from two supermarkets, shops, cafes and restaurants.
fields.description: The Garden Cottage is a cosy and quiet one bedroom house in the leafy north of Sydney. Sleeping up to five people, it has everything to make your visit very comfortable. We are only 5 minutes' walk to Denistone train station and from there, it is 30 minutes on the train into Sydney. We are also handy to Sydney Olympic Park and Parramatta CBD. We are only a few minutes' easy walk from two supermarkets, shops, cafes and restaurants. This luxurious one bedroom house is situated at the rear of our property in quiet Denistone in the Ryde area on Sydney’s leafy North Shore.  The House  Our house has a spacious living/dining room with views of the large garden, which is visited daily by native birds. You are welcome to sit and relax in the tranquillity of the garden - you won't want to leave! There is plenty of safe, free parking in the street. There is a full kitchen with stove, microwave, large refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster and dishwasher as well as all the pots and pans, plates and d
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Denistone is a very leafy, quiet and safe suburb but it is close to amenities and transport. Lots of safe, free parking in the road.
fields.transit: Five minutes' walking will bring you to either Denistone or West Ryde stations where regular trains will take you to Sydney CBD in 30 minutes. Good bus services will take you to Parramatta or Chatswood.
fields.title: Cosy Cottage close to Transport!

fields.description: Large top floor 2 bedroom double brick art deco apartment with balcony, polished floorboards, chandeliers and freshly painted white walls in a small block of 12. New bathroom, fully equipped kitchen with gas stove and electric oven. Washer/dryer, dishwasher, coffee machine, grinder and plenty of kitchen utensils, great for dinner parties. $700 per week is market value for long term rent. (Go to (URL HIDDEN) Happy to waive usual premium associated with a short term stay. Manion Avenue is a quiet street in Rose Bay surrounded by Sydney Harbour, a golf course, Rugby playing fields and a 20min walk to Bondi, Vaucluse and Double Bay. You could practice your golf, go watch a rugby game at the East's rugby club, have lunch or dinner at two of Sydney's iconic harbouside restaurants, Pier and Catalina's. You could even catch a seaplane from Rose Bay marina to Bennelong on the Hawkesbury or the Boatshed in Palm beach. Ideal for short stay professionals.  Large carpark. Plumer Rd shops across the
fields.title: Rose Bay - 10mins to CBD and Bondi

fields.description: Welcome to Sydney! On offer is an oversized room in a conveniently located, spacious, bright and modern, fully-furnished security apartment within a landmark Sydney complex designed by reknown Australian architect, Harry Seidler. "The Horizon" is your inner-city oasis located in trendy Darlinghurst and a stones throw from the areas' famed cafes, bars and restaurants. The best Sydney has to offer is also at your doorstep.  Within Walking Distance: 5min to Kings Cross, Potts Point & Taylor Square/Oxford St. 10min walk to Woolloomooloo Wharf, Cook & Phillip Park Aquatic Centre, Hyde Park, Australian Museum and the CBD.  15min to Sydney Harbour, Art Gallery of NSW, Botanical Gardens, Surry Hills & Rushcutters Bay. 20min to the Opera House, Museum of Contemporary Art, Chinatown and Paddington.   Nearby Destinations: Bondi Beach: 20min by bus Manly: 40min by train/ferry  The room itself is a spacious and relaxing double bedroom with Queen size bed and linens, a fantastic benchtop workspace/d
fields.title: Harbour Views, Resort Facilities!

fields.summary: Live like a local in our renovated terrace house in trendy inner Sydney. The place is located at the crossroads of Surry Hills, Paddington and Darlinghurst in a quiet lane. Perfect location for anybody wanting to see what Sydney has to offer!
fields.description: Live like a local in our renovated terrace house in trendy inner Sydney. The place is located at the crossroads of Surry Hills, Paddington and Darlinghurst in a quiet lane. Perfect location for anybody wanting to see what Sydney has to offer! The bedrooms are not big, but have built-in wardrobes. It has a window with a pleasant outlook and blinds, warm bedding, bedside lamps and power points. The bedroom is up a narrow flight of stairs with the bathroom downstairs, so if you have a small bladder and a hip replacement, it might get uncomfortable during the night. Bathroom is new with a rain shower and 'bath' made out of tiles. We'll leave some toiletries for you. There's a lounge room at the front with bookshelves, sofas and a little desk and a new deck with table and chairs at the back. There's wireless internet, a printer for tickets etc, a dishwasher in the kitchen, and washing machine and clothesline. The house will be set up as-is, with clean linen on the bed, towels etc. It's full
fields.notes: The convenient location comes with strict parking inspectors, so let us know beforehand if you're thinking of bringing a car. We have a short 'manual' for the house and detailed directions for your arrival - both will be sent to you upon confirmation. If this sounds like what you're looking for, please get in touch. We look forward to meeting you. Anna
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The terrace is in a leafy lane and very quiet but is steps from 3 of our favourite suburbs: Surry Hills, Darlinghurst and Paddington. We spend time in Surry Hills for our hipster fix, restaurants and groceries; Darlinghurst for bars and the new Eternity Playhouse theatre and Paddington for people watching, shopping and the local bottle shop.
fields.transit: Aside from the beach, we rarely have reason to venture more than a few blocks from the house for shopping, restaurants, cafes, bars, parks and friends.  It´s a half-hour walk through Hyde Park to the business district and a 15 minute (hilly) walk to Central Station. Buses to the beaches go from around the corner: ~20-40 minutes depending on which beach you choose and the traffic. Our favourite is Bronte. You can also walk to Bronte in just over an hour through gorgeous Centennial Park.  There are lots of GoGet pods if you're a member and we're very well serviced by Uber (their app sometimes thinks our street's one-way, so you might want to walk outside and meet them on Hannam St a few doors down)
fields.title: Live like a local

fields.summary: We put a lot of thought into the design of our home and fortunately we love it. It has 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, exposed concrete ceilings, decked outdoor space, and water views. Perfect for a family holiday.  PS. We have a new dining table to the one shown in the pics - a vintage Danish design that extends to seat 10.
fields.description: We put a lot of thought into the design of our home and fortunately we love it. It has 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, exposed concrete ceilings, decked outdoor space, and water views. Perfect for a family holiday.  PS. We have a new dining table to the one shown in the pics - a vintage Danish design that extends to seat 10. Our home was designed by award winning Sydney architects MCK and other than the facade (built 1905) it was completely renovated in 2011. The design is both beautiful and functional.  Comfortably fits 6-8 people. Features Include: - Water views - Unique contemporary architectural design - Suitable for children (we have 2 boys aged 5 and 8) - Secure front and rear gardens - 3 good sized bedrooms downstairs with 1 very comfortable 'Sealy' double ensemble, 1 solid single bed and 1 double Aerobed (Platinum pillow top if required) -1 large master bedroom upstairs with a very comfortable 'Sealy' Queen ensemble bed - Spacious, open plan living areas with exposed concrete and wate
fields.notes: The house is located on Vincent street which overlooks the water (White Bay) and is a 2 min walk up to the main street. It has unmetered 24 hour street parking and there is a lovely children's playground a minute from our door. A short 10 min walk away you will find Mort Bay and Ballast Point parks along the water. Both have beautiful picnic grounds, play equipment, walking/jogging pathways along the foreshore.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Balmain is a charming 'inner west' suburb of Sydney surrounded by water. It is popular for its proximity to the city (3 km), shops, cafes and restaurants along the main street (Darling St) and its village feel. A lot of young families who still want to be amongst cafes and good shops choose to live in Balmain and there are numerous parks and playgrounds.
fields.transit: You can walk into the village or into the city or catch a bus along Darling st - they come every 5-10 mins. We have a 'Go get' share car in our street.
fields.title: Balmain Beautiful Family Home

fields.summary: This newly renovated modern and totally private 2 storey eco friendly house is walking distance from the hustle bustle of Bondi but set at the end of a cul de sac where you can hear birds chirping and see the sun shining . Our home and decor is very funky modern, with an eclectic asian influence.
fields.description: This newly renovated modern and totally private 2 storey eco friendly house is walking distance from the hustle bustle of Bondi but set at the end of a cul de sac where you can hear birds chirping and see the sun shining . Our home and decor is very funky modern, with an eclectic asian influence. This unique house has all the comforts you can ask for whilst caring for the environment at the same time. There is off street parking for up to 3 cars. There are 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, 1 play room, 1 balcony upstairs and a study, T.V room, open plan lounge dining kitchen downstairs . There are 2 sets of bedding per room, towels, beach towels for everyone. Foxtel in both the T.V room and the master bedroom. Computer and WIFI, Large BBQ, undercover outdoor entertaining area which includes a lounge area , table and chairs. All rooms overlook a private park, if you rise early enough you can catch the sun rise right outside your bedroom. We have private access to this unique park which is very k
fields.notes: Beautiful private family home, opened up for your family to enjoy Sydney Summer in Bondi !
fields.neighbourhood_overview: North Bondi shares Bondi and Bondi Beach’s laid-back attitude, but it differs slightly in manner, in style, and in its suburban sensibilities. This eastern enclave lacks the crowds and the busyness of the rest of Bondi while supporting sustainable farms and local yoga studios. Art Deco facades and ultra-modern designer apartments lend North Bondi a trendier, more exclusive reputation than its southern counterparts, and so does its array of sartorial boutiques and restaurants that name themselves with single syllables.
fields.transit: Please use the app city mapper

fields.summary: Our upstairs large double bedroom has a garden view, ensuite bathroom & TV.  Breakfast is on our main deck with views to New Zealand.  Newport is on the beautiful northern beaches and close to Pittwater.
fields.description: Our upstairs large double bedroom has a garden view, ensuite bathroom & TV.  Breakfast is on our main deck with views to New Zealand.  Newport is on the beautiful northern beaches and close to Pittwater. Come stay with us in our spacious Newport Beach B&B.   Heather and I have a top floor room available as a second listing.  Our downstairs area with three bedrooms and a private sitting room is separately listed (see 307028), but all four rooms are available for one booking, accommodating up to seven guests.   This room is a larger bedroom with double bed, ensuite, TV and garden view for $150.   A continental breakfast is included served in our living room or on the patio with a view to New Zealand.   The room is $10 cheaper without breakfast  and discounts apply for longer stays through special offers.  Free WIFI is available.  Our laundry can be accessed for washing or ironing.  Sorry, there are NO COOKING FACILITIES for guests and NO PETS are allowed. Newport is on Sydney's beautiful
fields.notes: Please note that we have over 50 steps up to the cream front door and more stairs inside to reach the room.  So the property is NOT SUITABLE for guests with mobility issues.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Great beach, walking trails.  Close to other beaches and Pittwater.  Good shops and restaurants and the famous Newport Arms pub (now "The Newport").
fields.transit: Regular limited stop bus service to and from the city and Palm Beach via the B Line, 199 or L90.  Every 10 minutes or so until 9PM.  Drive or bus to Manly for the ferry to the city or to Palm Beach for ferries across Pittwater to to the Central Coast.  Ask us for details.

With a plethora of restaurants to choose from, you will never be bored from the variety of cuisine available. The train trip to the CBD takes around 25 minutes while a bus ride usually takes 45. Please feel free to get in touch if you have

fields.summary: My flat is in a really handy location to get to everywhere on foot and public transport - no car required. The front door is downstairs from the street, so the flat stays cool in summer, and opening the back door to the sunny shared garden can be quite a surprise!
fields.description: My flat is in a really handy location to get to everywhere on foot and public transport - no car required. The front door is downstairs from the street, so the flat stays cool in summer, and opening the back door to the sunny shared garden can be quite a surprise! Welcome to Bondi Junction!  Come and enjoy a double bedroom in my 2 bedroomed garden flat.  Make use of the fully equipped kitchen (newly fitted in June 2017). The kitchen, bathroom and living room will be shared with 1-2 other people but you will have it to yourself most of the time. In addition the apartment offers:  - TV and DVD players in bedroom and living room - Washer in outhouse and drying green - quiet and secluded outside area - accessed from my back door, shared by 6 flats, but very rarely used by them except to dry clothes. Please take notice Short lets only - up to 2 weeks. The area: The Junction offers everything you can think of. The massive Westfield Shopping Centre offers many shops, supermarkets, a  multi sc
fields.notes: My place is a basement flat (although not underground at all!), so stays nice and cool when its hot outside.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: So many cafes in Bondi Junction with great coffee, supermarkets a short walk away, beaches, city, the bush...all very accessible.
fields.transit: Only about 20 minutes to the CBD (Opera House, Harbour Bridge, China Town, The Rocks) by bus or train. Public transport runs very regularly, day and night. A service bus(number 400) from the airport to Bondi Junction costs less than $5. Walk to Bondi or Bronte Beach in less than 30 minutes, or hop on one of many buses and be there in 10. If you like to be out in the Bush, the Royal National Park to the south and Kuringi to the north are about one hour away on the train. 2 hours to the Blue mountains or Kiama by train too. Cars can be a bit of a nuisance in Sydney as parking is hard to find and can be expensive. In my street, from 8am-6pm Monday-Saturday, parking is restricted to one hour. Its unlimited otherwise. There are other streets in the area where parking is not restricted, so you may have to drive round a bit to find a spot.
fields.title: Double Room, Bondi Junction, Sydney.

There are BBQ facilities and plenty of grass, it is the perfect place for you to sit and relax and watch Bondi's magnificent sunset. Large open plan living area, floorboards, light & bright, dishwasher (whisper quiet), internal laundry. Huge lovely shared garden the size of a tennis court with gazebo BBQ entertaining area, hardwood furniture and gas BBQ. 2 huge bedrooms, main with built in wardrobes and walk in, great neighbours and area. Our Neighborhood: Bondi Beach is one of the world's most famous beaches. Bondi Beach is as much a lifestyle choice as a place.

fields.description: Welcome to Potts Point! This apartment open plan studio has a balcony with a view to Sydney Harbour, and every time you leave the apartment you will see the top of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge! Located in the "Paris End" of Potts Point, you can walk to the world class restaurants of Finger Wharf, or up the street to amazing bars and eateries. Go for a jog to the Boy Charlton swimming pool which hangs over the harbour, or stroll to the Botanic Gardens and stop at the magnificent Art Gallery of NSW.  Easy walking access to the train station and bus stop, and taxis are easy to find. The bus to the city is just across the road. The train station is a 10 min walk and from there you can catch a train to Central and change to catch the airport train to the domestic or international airport. Taxis are frequent outside the apartment too. The apartment has tv and wifi internet. There is a double bed in a nook, a shower bathroom, a small sofa which pulls out into a sleeper, an ar
fields.title: Paris End Potts Point HARBOUR VIEW!

fields.description: This delightful first floor apartment is just what you need for a month, a week or just a few days in Sydney. Just a few minutes walk to the ferry, the bus into the city and the beautiful waterfront parks. Our apartment has a queen bed in the bedroom and all  linen and towels are provided. There is also parking available. You may want to spend a moment sitting on the balcony admiring  the Harbour Bridge views but my guess is you will want to jump straight onto one of the passing ferries and explore Sydney and our wonderful harbour. We will always be there to greet you and unless you are catching a very early flight we will farewell you. There are restaurants, cafes and shops all along Darling Street and a great pub just minutes away. The room includes a good-quality queen bed and has its own ensuite bathroom and shower. There's also a full kitchen, with just about every kitchen appliance known to man. As for the location, it's hard to beat. Lots of great / fun time to be had!

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Campsie is a bustling, diverse and multicultural suburb where you will get to experience many cultures and enjoy incredible restaurants and local offerings: from Vietnamese Pho, Malaysian delights, Middle Eastern groceries, Indian samosas, cafes to frozen yoghurt! And so much more. Local food is affordable and many restaurants and eateries are family-run with authentic dishes you'd have to travel all over Sydney to find.  Each year in May, the Campsie Food Festival celebrates the suburbs love of food and diversity: (website hidden) Campsie has parks, a swimming pool and an ice rink. Well serviced by public transport. Just a stones throw from the inner west suburbs of Newtown (short walks from St Peters or Erskineville train stations) and Marrickville, Dulwich Hill.  To the West on the train line, you can explore the foods and cultures of Belmore, Lakemba, Bankstown and more.

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Bronte is a beachside suburb of Sydney, in the state of New South Wales, Australia. Bronte beach is located 8 kilometres east of the Sydney central business district, in the Waverley Council local government area of the Eastern Suburbs. Bronte Beach sits on Nelson Bay, surrounded by Bronte Park. Bronte offers scenic cliff-top walking paths south to Coogee via the Waverley Cemetery and north to Tamarama and Bondi Beach. The cliff-top path offers views which extend from Ben Buckler in the north to Malabar in the south. Bronte is located about 2.5 km south of Bondi Beach.
fields.transit: Uber to the CBD in 10-20 minutes or bus stop (to CBD) is only a 10-minute walk from the apartment. The Bus will take 20-30 minutes to reach the city depending on traffic.

fields.summary: A modern, light renovated family home for a relaxing beach holiday in Manly and its environs.
fields.description: A modern, light renovated family home for a relaxing beach holiday in Manly and its environs. **AVAILABLE EASTER LONG WEEKEND AND EASTER SCHOOL HOLIDAYS ** Sharing is caring, and we like to share our home while we are away!   Relax and enjoy your holiday in a quiet 'home from home', perfect for couples, families and extended families.  Our place is a 4 bed, modern, renovated, family home in Manly, Sydney. Ocean and harbour pristine beaches are minutes from your door and Sydney CBD is less than 30 minutes by a scenic ferry ride across Sydney harbour.  Our classic Californian Bungalow retains many of its heritage charms yet has been sympathetically renovated to provide a light filled, breezy family home: 2 x  adult queen bedrooms  1 x  bunk bed room (2 x single beds) 1 x  single room Space for a baby's travel cot (to be provided by guests) 1 x modern family bathroom with deep soaker bath and separate double shower  1 x modern fully equipped gourmet kitchen with island seating for 5 1 x d
fields.notes: Check out (Website hidden by Airbnb) to start planning your break now. We have 2 guinea pigs and a cat that would love you to feed them!
fields.neighbourhood_overview: A quiet peaceful family neighbourhood, yet in easy walking or bus ride to Manly and its waterside attractions….The best of both worlds. 'Worlds best deli' - or so we think - on your doorstep.  5 minutes walk to Harris Farm for all your fresh produce needs.   Many supermarkets and shops a short bus or car ride away. Manly's Ocean and harbour beaches are close by, about a 10 minute walk in either direction as well as many parks and playgrounds. The awesome newly renovated Manly swim centre is less than a  5 minute walk away. The ferry terminal providing access to Sydney and all its attractions is a 10 minute walk or free bus ride down the hill.
fields.transit: Free Manly 'HOP SKIP AND JUMP' bus goes past the door.  Just hail it down to stop.  The bus provides easy access around Manly 7 days a week between 7am and 6pm.  A timetable is available in the property Sydney Ferries depart around every 30 minutes from Manly Wharf for the CBD and interconnecting ferries to all Sydney's attractions.

Check out the photos to get a bette
fields.notes: PRICING AT PEAK TIME:  The cost of our place is a little more in peak holiday time here in Australia: our Summer - especially around Christmas and January.    PRICING FOR LONGER STAYS:  We provide a discount for longer stays. You'll find our discounted monthly cost in the 'Price' section. Also, when you put in your check-in and check-out dates, AirBnB will take into account our reduced monthly price in its calculation of the total cost. If you're staying 4 months or more, please get in touch and we'll see what we can do.    VALUE FOR MONEY:  We try to keep our price competitive and good value compared with other stays around us. You probably won't find another place as big as ours for the price in this part of Sydney (in the East and near the beach.) If you do let us know! Mostly you'll get a small apartment for the price we charge. Plus we throw in lots of added extras - like great movies, kids toys and the best local guide you'll find.    AVAILABILITY:   Sometimes we get booked up! I
fields.neighbourhood_overview: CLOVELLY BEACH & CLIFFTOP WALK:  Clovelly is one of Sydney's hidden gems. There's a beautiful secluded beach 10 minutes walk away, plus access to the scenic coastal walk that runs along the beaches and clifftops from Coogee through Clovelly, Bronte and on to Bondi Beach. (You can see how close we are in the aerial shot in our photos.)    CLOVELLY VILLAGE:  At the same time we have great little eateries here on our doorstep. Just in our local strip you'll get a sense of the multi-cultural nature of Sydney - including authentic Italian, Thai and Japanese food, a Hungarian patisserie and an upmarket bistro. Also nearby are a delicatessan, two great cafes, a great little bakery, and yummy fish & chips (run by a French couple!) There's also yoga, pilates, massage and a gym in the block too.    NEARBY IN COOGEE:  If you want even more cafes and restaurants it’s 10 minutes walk down Beach Street to the shops at Coogee. There you’ll find heaps of places to eat out. There's also great swimming
fields.transit: GOING TO THE CITY:   To get to the central business district, the 338 and 339 buses go from outside and will take you there in about 30 minutes. It runs past Centennial Park and the Entertainment Quarter (where there are things to do for kids), Surry Hills (which has even more eateries), Central Station and the city (where you can see the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour and other tourist sights.)     GOING TO BONDI JUNCTION:  It's 15 minutes on the 360 bus to Bondi Junction. There you’ll find the colossal Westfield Shopping Centre, Apple Store, and just about every shopping thing you need.    BUSES:  It's best to get an Opal card for each of you to travel on Sydney's transit system. You can buy them from our local grocery store and put money on them there.    SYDNEY AIRPORT:  The Airport is 25 minutes away by taxi. It'll cost about $40 to $50.   PARKING:   You can drive into the back of our place via the laneway and park your car in our backyard. There's also free (untimed

This is a character filled terrace in a perfectly located spot.

fields.summary: A beautiful and comfortable home in Australia's most historic suburb. Only a short stroll away from Sydney's best attractions.
fields.description: A beautiful and comfortable home in Australia's most historic suburb. Only a short stroll away from Sydney's best attractions. Welcome! This home is in The Rocks, Sydney’s oldest and most central neighbourhood. Stunningly beautiful, this neighbourhood is only minutes from the Sydney Central Business District ('CBD'), Sydney Harbour and the new Barangaroo Headland Park. The apartment is spacious and very comfortable. It is close to :  -The restaurants and old pubs of The Rocks (5 mins walk)  -Harbour bridge climb (5 mins walk)  -Sydney CBD (10 mins walk)  -Circular Quay (10 mins walk)  - Barangaroo Headland Park (2 mins walk) -The Sydney Opera House (20 mins walk)  -Darling Harbour (20 mins walk)  -Museum of Contemporary Art (MCA) (10 mins walk) The Apartment  The apartment is spacious and on two levels. It is a lovely 100 year old building with modern bathroom and kitchen. The main living room, kitchen, courtyard and one toilet are downstairs. Upstairs are the two bedrooms, a second li
fields.notes: If you wish to book for New Years Eve, please send me a message. New Years Eve 2019 and 2020 is blocked but may still be available.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: A Truly Spectacular Part of Sydney  The Rocks is Australia’s oldest neighbourhood, being the original location of the British penal colony. It became a thriving maritime area during the 19th and early 20th Centuries. Many of the original houses, pubs and shops are still standing. These days it is a charming, leafy neighbourhood right on the doorstep of the city and all of it’s attractions, including nearby restaurants and bars. Sydney’s oldest pub, The Lord Nelson, is our local where they brew their own beer on site and serve up a great meal too. Take a stroll through the cobblestone laneways of The Rocks or up to the park in nearby Observatory Hill and take in the great view of the harbour!  The incredible Barangaroo Headland Park opened recently and is a great place to chill out by the harbour and escape the city.
fields.transit: Most of the major sites of Sydney are within a short walk and it's a really nice way to see the city. If you’re not much into walking, there is a bus stop 50 metres away with regular buses to the CBD, Town Hall Station and Central Railway Station. Hailing a taxi from my front door is easy and takes no time at all for one to come past.  To get to and from the airport there are regular Airport Link trains leaving from Circular Quay station (10min walk from the apartment) and the airport. A taxi takes about 35 mins from the airport to the apartment (depending on traffic).
fields.title: Sydney City Home in Historic Rocks

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Right in the heart of Sydney's best beach neighbourhood, Manly! We love Sydney and the natural beauty of Australia and for us, there's just nowhere like Manly- gorgeous ocean and harbourside beaches a few minutes walk apart, the best commute in the world (as one of our guests put it) via the iconic Manly ferry, fantastic restaurants and shops, and a tranquil national park with the best views in Sydney just up the road from our home. Everything you could possibly need is right here, yet it's kept its laid back beachy village feel.
fields.transit: Completely central. So close to the beach, restaurants and shopping, a car is optional while holidaying here. Walk to anything- and ferries and buses are only a block away. Even getting to the CBD is only 15 minutes on the fast ferry!

fields.neighbourhood_overview: We live in the best place in the world. We are lucky enough to have a mix of natural beauty, clean ocean and beaches, and a great mix of cafes and restaurants. fields.neighbourhood_overview: Stanmore is a quiet historic suburb lined with Victorian terraces and cottages, making it one of the most desirable inner-west neighbourhoods. Nearby Enmore and Newtown are famous for their live music scene, vibrant cafe culture, delicious and inexpensive restaurants, interesting shops, record stores and retro fashion - all in a fun and alternative atmosphere.
fields.transit: Free and unlimited parking in a wide tree lined street, within easy walking distance to Sydney University, Enmore Road and Newtown, and Stanmore train station (direct trains to the city take approximately 10 minutes) .  The closest bus to the city is the 412 which leaves from around the corner on Salisbury Road. Plenty of other buses depart regularly on nearby Parramatta road, and are a fast and easy way to get to the city. If you need to go further afield, do an internet search for "transportnsw" and you will find a public transport website with a trip planner to help you get directions to all the main attractions. When travelling from the airport, the quickest and easiest option is a taxi, since the studio is only a 16km ride.  If there's 2 of you, then this option is also the cheapest!

fields.description: You have found one of the best food locations in Sydney to stay during your visit. Surrounded by busy cafes and popular restaurants, Potts Point is a vibrant "inner city village" that is walking distance away from city centre, Sydney Harbour, Opera House, NSW Art Gallery, Australian Museum, beautiful parks and excellent public transport is minutes away. Designed and equipped for Airbnb visitors, the apartment is situated in heritage building called The Springfield (corner of Orwell St and Llankelly Place, Potts Point Sydney). This apartment is on the 3rd floor of this building with no lift access. So we recommend that you are mobile and enjoy being active. We provide a high-quality bed (picture included), computer and many handy items to enhance your visit. Metro buses & trains are only minutes away. Daily visitor car parking vouchers are available on request. Check the street view to see how central this location is within Sydney.  If this apartment is booked out, then take a look at
fields.notes: Most things you need are in the places you expect to find them.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Rich with history, culture and sophistication, Potts Point is an ideal place to stay or visit for those who want to enjoy the picturesque surroundings of a bygone era and still be close to everything Sydney has to offer. Potts Point situated within Sydney City is just a short 20-minute walk to the CBD and a stone's throw from Kings Cross Railway Station, so you can easily catch a train to some of Sydney's major attractions. Sydney Buses, Taxis and Car Hire are also readily available in the immediate vicinity. As for dining out, Victoria St, and in particular Macleay St, are dotted with a range of restaurants to suit all tastes. Kings Cross, Darlinghurst Rd offers a countless number of nightclubs, bars and theatres for those who enjoy the nightlife. Or for the more subdued there are plenty of parks, museums and harbour side charm in the neighbouring suburbs.
fields.transit: Plenty of public transport is just outside the door, but walking to the city is even easier than the one or two stops on the train.
fields.title: Refurbished! Spacious & Modern Walk to CBD

Our house is available from time to time, usually when we go on holidays over summer.  It is an 1880s two-floor terrace with three bedrooms and two bathrooms in the heart of Newtown, Sydney — the same street that Henry Lawson, Australia's great bush poet, lived. In fact, he lived in the terraces opposite us.  With a one-minute walk to King St and Enmore Rd, you can access dozens of pubs, restaurants and shops all the way up and down these two iconic Sydney streets. One minute from Newtown train station too, which means you can also be in the city in 10-15 minutes!  Our terrace has recently been renovated and has new spotted gum wooden floorboards, two brand new bathrooms with large showers, a claw foot bath, classic subway tiles and fixtures, plus a brand new kitchen with modern appliances. The main bedroom upstairs has a king-size bed and l

Originally built as  gentleman's chambers in 1926 and once home to actors, painters, dancers and writers, Regents Court is a great boutique accommodation option in one of Sydney's funkiest neighbourhoods. The apartment, located on the top floor, has a large north facing (what you want in the southern hemisphere to catch the sun) picture window. The spacious studio has been designed to offer a more comfortable accommodation alternative to discerning travellers. The apartment has its own we
fields.notes: ★ Parking. Parking is subject to availability. The cost is $25 per day and must be booked at the time of your reservation.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood (think Soho London, The East Village NYC). During the last decade Potts Point has become recognised as one of the most desirable places to live in Sydney. Many empty-nesters have sold their family homes in the suburbs and bought an apartment in the neighbourhood. Many young families now choose to live here, so much so that the sight of prams, once as rare in Potts Point as koalas, are now part of the diverse mix of locals. And why wouldn't anybody want to live here? It is the most cosmopolitan 'hood' in Australia. It is beautiful, grand old art deco buildings, and harbour side parks; it is a walk to the city through the Botanic Gardens; you can get a coffee downstairs, and have a drink after dinner. It is all about amenity. It is a vibrant, living, inner-urban community.
fields.transit: It is two minutes walk to the nearest train station or you can walk into the CBD in fifteen minutes. There is a go-get car for hire by the hour on the street. Harbour-side parks are 5 minutes walk. The surf beaches are also a short train/ bus ride away. Within walking distance of the Botanic Gardens, Opera House, Art Gallery, Australian Museum, central business district & most tourist sites  AIRPORT: - Taxis takes about 20 minutes and cost about $50 (depending on the time of day).  - Shuttle bus stops at nearby hotels. This costs approx. $14 but takes much longer as it makes a number of stops. - Train. Domestic Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.22 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station - Train. International Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.81 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station

Two double bedrooms, one with balcony, located in a Victorian terrace house in Paddington, one of Sydney's most beautiful suburbs.  The house is decorated in mostly a mid-century style with a bit of eclecticism. The house is certainly not new and slick, it has some old quirks and charm. Within the house you'll find:   Two bedrooms  Master room with queen bed and balcony  Widescreen TV  Wi-fi internet  Two living spaces  Dining room  Kitchen   Bathroom  Lovely courtyard  Washing machine  Clothes dryer  Dishwasher  Access to DVDs, music, books We will be away during your stay however will be available via phone. Our family members live a block away and if there are any issues can be on hand to help.  Around The Area  Cafe and shopping areas including Surry Hills, Darlinghurst and th
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Around The Area  Cafe and shopping areas including Surry Hills, Darlinghurst and the heart of Paddington are very accessible from our house and are all within walking distance. It's definitely a cafe culture around here.  A small stroll will take you to the beautiful Rushcutters Bay. It's a direct bus trip to Bondi but we think it's also worth exploring the lesser known, but local favourite, spots like Red Leaf, Gordon's Bay and Nielsen Park.
fields.transit: Public Transport  We are a 5 minute walk from a number of bus stops; the 389 which runs between North Bondi and Circular Quay, the 311 which runs to Central station and back, the 378 and 380 to Bondi, and at certain times the 352 to Marrickville via Newtown. We are also a 5-10 minute walk from Kings Cross station.   Parking  There are some un-timed on-street parking spots available in our street, but they are usually taken. If these are not available there is on-street parking with a 1 hour limit during 8am-11pm. Alternatively, please contact us at time of booking if you would like to park and we will obtain temporary passes.

fields.summary: Room 2 has a double sized bed with a built-in wardrobe. The floor is timber.
fields.description: Room 2 has a double sized bed with a built-in wardrobe. The floor is timber. Welcome to our home! We have 3  out of 5-bedrooms to share with our guests for short or long term.  Our house is located in a picturesque, quiet and peaceful area . A calm view to a leafy valley that is habitat to exotic colourful birds and wildlife is inviting to unwind and relax. The area is also great for bicycling, hiking and bush walking.  The listed 3 separated rooms (Room 1, 2, and 3) are well furnitured all with a wardrobe and desk. Every window and door has flyscreen to keep the bugs outside. We enjoy hosting guests from all over the world and are happy to assist wherever we can to make your stay more comfortable and memorable. Shared facilities  Sharing areas include living room, kitchen, guest bathroom, laundry, swimming pool, and pergola. You can also enjoy free access to unlimited high speed cable internet in all rooms and outdoors. Location We are located only 10min walking distance to the closes
fields.notes: Gold coin donation towards washing powder and softener when using washing machine.
fields.transit: 1. how to get to our house via public transport     train to Asquith (local slow train station) first, then walk home for 10-15 min     or train to Hornsby (big station) first, then bus 598 for 11min 2. free-of-charge  off-street parking is available
fields.title: Double bed room in Hornsby Sydney--(Room 3)

fields.summary: Close to beaches and shops. Public transport to the airport, train station and city very close by. Clean and bright rooms in a friendly family neighbourhood. Cafe's bars and beaches a short walk away.
fields.description: Close to beaches and shops. Public transport to the airport, train station and city very close by. Clean and bright rooms in a friendly family neighbourhood. Cafe's bars and beaches a short walk away. Situated in the heart of the Eastern Suburbs, a private room is available in our townhouse, located on a quiet street in Bronte.   The spacious bedroom has a double bed, wooden floors and storage. Fresh linen will be provided according to the season.  All rooms have ceiling fans for air flow.   Besides the room, access to a dishwasher and washing machine are available as well as a patio area - ideal for a barbecue and a cool drink on a warm afternoon.   A short stroll from our family-oriented suburb delivers you access to Bronte and Clovelly beaches, as well as world class cafés and local restaurants. The public transport, a two minute walk away, offers direct travel to the airport ( bus 400) city, beaches and the train station at Bondi Junction. Back yard patio for a barbie, easy parking
fields.notes: There are lots of beautiful walks nearby, we are on a direct bus route to and from the airport, city, Bondi Junction and train station.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We live in a family area, the birds are pretty noisy in the mornings but peaceful in the evenings. We are within walking distance of the beaches, cafes and some great restaurants.
fields.transit: There is plenty of street parking, buses are close by to the city, airport and train stations.  Or if you like to walk, the beaches and parks are just a short stroll away.
fields.title: Bronte! great location for beaches and transport

fields.summary: A quiet place, but not far from beaches, restaurants, bars and transport.
fields.description: A quiet place, but not far from beaches, restaurants, bars and transport. The townhouse is a contemporary space with timber floors and shutters for good ventilation.  The bedrooms  have a double bed with fresh linen to suit all climates, towels are provided.  There is a dishwasher and washing machine for general use and also BBQ in the garden/patio.  There is good parking if necessary but local transport is 1 min away which will take you to the main bus/train terminal at Bondi Junction in 5 mins.    The neighbourhood is family orientated and quite safe, there are good coffee shops, the best in the world, just a short stroll away, along with restaurants, wine bar and pubs.   Great beaches: Bondi, Bronte and Clovelly for surfing, diving and snorkelling and swimming are 10 mins away and some of the most beautiful coastal wallks you will find anywhere on the planet. Centennial Park is very close by, hire a bike or stroll around to look at the beautiful gardens or the bird life. Their room,
fields.notes: We do not tend to make a list of rules.. rather treat the space and people the way you would like to be treated, clean up after yourselves and respect others privacy.  Our cleaner comes once a week on a Friday lunchtime and would love everyone to leave the house for a couple of hours .. it benefits us all :)
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Our house is close to beaches, parks, coffee shops, restaurants, bars and transport ...yet secluded from the hustle and bustle.  The neighbourhood is family oriented and pretty safe to get around in.
fields.transit: Either car - street parking is pretty good and free or public transport is very close and frequent.. bus timetables are available on request, if public transport is preferred an Opal card should be purchased for tap on and off. Walking is a great way to get around, beaches and parks are very close and bike riding is very popular in the area, although hilly.
fields.title: Bronte Great Location!

fields.summary: Room 1 is a large bedroom with a queen-sized bed.  It can accommodate up to 4 persons by adding an extra double mattress.The mirrored wardrobe provides big clothes storage (across almost the whole wall).  The floor is timber. There is an additional private access in addition to the access to the kitchen.
