fields.summary: Location. Location. Location. Comfortable and Homely Living. Fun, Happiness, Excitement, Convenience. Sunshine, Warmth, Relaxing, Spoilt for Choice. Memories, Romance, Holiday of a Life Time. Too Good to be  * There maybe a need to water the Garden Pots during your stay with the hose on the veranda. * Please let me know about your Grand Children who will be visiting you.
fields.description: Location. Location. Location. Comfortable and Homely Living. Fun, Happiness, Excitement, Convenience. Sunshine, Warmth, Relaxing, Spoilt for Choice. Memories, Romance, Holiday of a Life Time. Too Good to be  * There maybe a need to water the Garden Pots during your stay with the hose on the veranda. * Please let me know about your Grand Children who will be visiting you. Oasis By the Sea, Manly, Sydney. Fabulous Location. Clean and Comfortable. Privacy. Fully furnished spacious Apartment including Linen for the Bedrooms and Bathrooms. Large Master Bedroom with Queen Sized Bed, Wardrobe and Chest of Drawers. Fully equipped Kitchen with china and cutlery for 4 people and pots and pans. There is a Pantry for your Groceries. Dishwasher, Microwave Oven, Electric Oven and Gas Cook top. Coffee Maker. Internal Laundry with Washer and Clothes Dryer incl:  Clothes Airier. Vacuum Cleaner, Iron, Ironing Board. Storage cupboard to house all the laundry products and extras. Large wrap around Balcony
fields.notes: At the Manly Wharf is a local Tourist Information Centre which offers Brochures and other printed information and advice about Manly, CBD, Canberra, Blue Mountains, Hunter Valley Wineries etc. Fabulous service run by Volunteers. Opal Card is available to purchase and you add $ $ $ to it and it can be used on Buses, Trains, Ferries. Top up is easy,  quick and convenient. There is a no cash policy sweeping Sydney and so an Opal Card is a MUST. News agencies on the Manly Wharf or on The Corso sell the Opal Card. There are recycling trucks that collect the bottles of the nearby Hotels / Pubs during the day. They access Henrietta Lane. This is a noisy time and lasts up to 15 minutes during the morning.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Atmosphere: What I love about the neighbourhood is that Manly is an exciting and vibrant place to visit during the day and into the evening. There is a fabulous choice of clothing stores and food outlets / cafe's / restaurants. Weather: There is plenty of sunshine every day and the atmosphere is friendly and positive. Amenities: The Apartment provides many extras. Such as:  Cleaning products, Umbrellas, Security Safe, Beach Towels etc. Convenience: Access to the shopping area is 5 minutes and to the surf beach is 1 minute. Variety: There are so many activities to do in Manly that one is spoilt for choice. Transport: Manly offers Bus, Ferry, Car and Bicycle and Motor Bike transport to where you want to go. Roller Blades as well. Walking is also an option as there are good maps and pathways to follow with sign age instructions for the walker.
fields.transit: The Apartment provides 1 x Security Garage for your car. No storage. There is a great choice of Buses and Ferry Transport ( Slow Ferry or Fast Ferry) to choose from to and from Manly to the CBD. Local Buses around the Neighbourhood. Transport from Sydney Airport to Manly: * Train from Sydney Airport to CBD and then Manly Ferry from CBD to Manly and walk to Complex. * Taxi from Sydney Airport to Manly. * Hire Car.
fields.title: Oasis By the Sea. Manly, Sydney. Fab. Location.

fields.description: This bright, beautiful, newly renovated and stylish one bedroom loft is fantastically appointed in the heart of Sydney's coolest and most sought after areas in stunning Rushcutters Bay, by Potts Point, Paddington Darlinghurst and close to the CBD, Opera House, Sydney Harbor and the city's best restaurants, parks and cafes. The two-floor loft is located on the top floor of a truly unique and stunningly designed boutique apartment building. The entrance on the lower floor leads to sitting and dining areas, open plan kitchen and verdant terrace which is great for lunch or breakfast outdoors with the native birds. The stairs lead up to the bedroom with a queen size bed, ample wardrobe storage, bathroom and separate laundry with brand new washer/ dryer. The location could not be more perfect if you want to enjoy Sydney's beautiful harbour-side and be close to the best that Sydney has to offer in night and day-life. Hop on a bus from a short walk to Oxford street with it's great clothing bou
fields.title: Bright Stylish Rushcutters Bay LOFT

fields.description: This older style house is situated just a 15 minute walk from Bronte beach and features two bedrooms plus a cosy living room with tv, dvd and gas heating, a fully equipped kitchen, a huge and sunny backyard, as well as a bathroom with bathtub and shower. Both bedrooms feature comfortable beds.  Outdoor laundry and second bathroom (with toilet and shower) are close to the house and there is a washing line outside to receive all day sun. The well maintained garden serves as a perfect backdrop to enjoy the temperate weather.  Bondi Rd shops, restaurants and transport (buses to Bondi Junction and the city) are just a 7 minute walk away. A clean, cosy and comfortable place to chill while you visit this beautiful area of Sydney, please don't hesitate to contact me with further enquiries. I won't be available in person  but my son lives nearby quiet area but handy to shops/restaurants/best beaches. 7 minutes walk to buses to everywhere.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: quiet area but handy to shops/restaurants/best beaches.
fields.transit: 7 minutes walk to buses to everywhere.
fields.title: Tranquil Bondi free standing house with sunny yard

fields.description: My apartment is a light and sun-filled sanctuary in the lower north shore suburb of Mosman. It has been re-painted in fresh, light colours; re-carpeted in a soft beige; and there are bright new blinds, all just finished (April, 2015).  Set in a modern block named Avien Court, my place is simple, modern and stylish. It's close to the coffee shops of Military and Avenue Roads, to Taronga Zoo, and to Sydney's most beautiful beach: Balmoral.  It's across the road from St. Clement's Church, and so there's a Down Under version of Oranges and Lemons going on here.  The bells of St Clement's chime in Sunday mornings and services about to start - a very serene sound! It's close to city buses and to Mosman Wharf, with city ferries departing regularly.  Guests have noted traffic noise in the mornings, as it is close to Mosman Prep School, and it does get a bit noisy.  It's also part of the patchwork of suburban streets between Mosman and the Bridge which Sydney- siders call " The Back Way to the
fields.notes: The apartments are very quiet (except for some traffic noise, as mentioned).  It is really vital that you respect my neighbours, and keep noise to a  minimum.  It is not permitted to host parties during your stay.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Mosman is a quiet and well-heeled neighbourhood of Sydney.  Its charms are the many beautiful old houses built in the signature-Sydney Federation style, its close access to the Harbour and the city, and to beautiful Balmoral, where I swim the whole year around.
fields.transit: My apartment is close to a bus stop that goes down to the ferry at Mosman Wharf.  You can walk 5 minutes to a bus that takes you to the city in 20 minutes.  There is a parking space that comes with the apartment, otherwise, limited parking is available on the streets outside.
fields.title: Mosman - convenient and peaceful

fields.description: This a lovely, well presented, well decorated two bedroom 5th floor apartment in a location you cannot beat.   The apartment has great views to the city and faces north so gets the sunshine. Both bedrooms are a good size, air-conditioned, with good quality queen sized beds. The main bedroom has an ensuite and there is a second bathroom.  There is an open living/dining/kitchen area which is also air-conditioned. The dining table seats six. All linen and towels (including beach towels) are provided.  There is access to Wi Fi. The apartment sits right on the border of Surry Hills and Darlinghurst, only metres from Taylor Square and Oxford St (which is the main arterial road into the city in one direction, and to Bondi Junction and the beach in the other). Bus stops for both directions are a two minute walk.  It is a 10 minute walk to the fashion boutiques of Oxford St, or a 20 minute walk into the main shopping area of the CBD.  Surry Hills is Sydney's premier cafe and restaurant suburb.
fields.title: Surry Hills stylish 2 bedroom appt

fields.summary: A stunning open plan warehouse conversion with roof top pool, BBQ area & brand new gym. The private guest room sleeps 2. Set in the heart of eclectic Redfern combining old style warehouses and trendy eateries and restaurants. Walk to train in 5 minutes (Redfern Station) or 20 minutes to the City. Choose to stay with one of Sydney's original Airbnb hosts with seven years hosting experience.
fields.description: A stunning open plan warehouse conversion with roof top pool, BBQ area & brand new gym. The private guest room sleeps 2. Set in the heart of eclectic Redfern combining old style warehouses and trendy eateries and restaurants. Walk to train in 5 minutes (Redfern Station) or 20 minutes to the City. Choose to stay with one of Sydney's original Airbnb hosts with seven years hosting experience. The private guest room has recently been updated with new carpet, paint and furniture. It sleeps 2 adults in a queen sized bed with luxury bedding. The guest room is located in a modern two bedroom open plan apartment with timber floors, natural light and air conditioning. As host I live in the apartment and sleep in the second bedroom. The restyled guest room boasts a queen sized bed with luxury bedding and towels, full length wardrobe, mirror, digital television & unlimited wifi broadband.  The guest room is private with natural light that opens to a balcony.  Please note that there is some traffic
fields.notes: While I am happy to accept new guests to Airbnb with no previous reviews I would kindly ask that you verify a few details ahead of sending a booking request. If I am opening up my home to you then please have uploaded a recent photograph and verified email or verified other third party web sites from the 'edit profile page' on your Airbnb dashboard. As I host I do not see the details of your passport etc (it is held by Airbnb) it allows me to ensure the person placing the booking will be the person staying. Thanks for your understanding.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The apartment is located in Inner City Redfern.  Redfern is known for young professionals and trendy locals and offers funky cafes and pubs while being a 20 minute walk to the City Centre or Sydney University. Sydney's Best Neighbourhood Bar for 2016/7 is only 100 metres away from the apartment!  While only being one train stop away from the city Redfern is not in the heart of the tourist area. It's an Inner City suburb that is ideally situated to explore Sydney's exciting City of Villages away from the traditional tourist areas. If you wish to stay in the traditional tourist areas may I suggest you look for accommodation in the Darling Harbour and Circular Quay areas. An excellent mix of restaurants and cafes of Surry Hills and Newtown is also a short stroll from my apartment.  The apartment is a 5 minute walk to Redfern train station, just 1 stop from Central Station or walk into the heart of Sydney in 20 minutes.  This train station services all lines including Bondi Junction, City
fields.transit: Redfern station is located 5 minutes walk from the apartment.  From Redfern Station it is 1 stop to Central Station.  All major areas of Sydney can be accessed from Redfern.  Or simply walk!  The City is only 20 minutes walk.
fields.title: Inner City Guest Room w/Pool+Gym

fields.summary: Our immaculate comfortable 1 bedroom garden flat is ideal for visitors wanting to be close to all Northern Beaches attractions. Large Queen bedroom (sgl foldout bed/cot if required). On beautiful Narrabeen Lake, with the beach a short 800m walk away.
fields.description: Our immaculate comfortable 1 bedroom garden flat is ideal for visitors wanting to be close to all Northern Beaches attractions. Large Queen bedroom (sgl foldout bed/cot if required). On beautiful Narrabeen Lake, with the beach a short 800m walk away. We have a 1 bedroom (max 2 adults) ground floor unit/flat/apartment ON Narrabeen Lake on Sydney's beautiful Northern Beaches. We have a single foldout bed and/or travel cot available for children if required (max 2 kids). There are only a small number of property's with full waterfront access to Narrabeen Lake and we are one of them. The apartment is attached to the main house, but you have a completely separate entrance, huge front garden (with electric BBQ, 6 seater outdoor setting, patio umbrella and sandpit for the kids), self contained with kitchenette (complete with dishwasher, convection oven and microwave) and bathroom (shower only).  The area we live in is absolutely beautiful, you will be hard pressed to find anywhere else in the
fields.transit: Major bus terminus a 5 minute flat walk away, with buses heading in to the city, to Manly, North to Palm Beach, west to Macquarie. University and also to Chatswood.
fields.title: On the Lake, by the Beach, 1 bedder

fields.description: Furnished, bright studio with peaceful and private aspect. It is a single, self-contained, large room with kitchenette and separate renovated bathroom and including a deck overlooking the pool where you could relax or enjoy meals. The flat is located higher up in the rear yard of our property but has good separation and privacy from the main residence where we live. The only shared facilities include the pool and laundry. Ideally the flat would suit a couple or a single in a comfortable Queen bed, however the sofa also converts to a simple double bed so that in fact 4 people could sleep (such as children etc) if you don't mind a very compact situation. It would suit someone requiring a quieter, relaxed accommodation away from, but accessible to, the city's hustle and bustle. Key Features: Elevated, private position Queen Bed Comfortable sofa converting to simple double bed Linen & towels Dining Tables (indoors and outdoors) TV with DVD WiFi as well as cable connection Pool Kitchen: Ful
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Wahroonga is a green, leafy suburb 'in the bush' on Sydney's Northshore. The air is fresh and clean and you are surrounded by nature.  It is in close vicinity of Ku-ring-gai National Park and Bobbin Head, Hawkesbury River and Brooklyn, Lane Cove National Park, The Great North Walk and plenty of bushwalking and camping opportunities. It is a 5 minute drive to the start of the F3 freeway heading north out of Sydney to the Central Coast, Newcastle and beyond and it is approximately equidistant from both the Central Coast beaches and some of Sydneys northern beaches. It is also a 5 minute walk to the San Hospital making it ideal for people requiring accommodation in connection with the hospital.
fields.transit: It is handy to have your own car here but certainly not essential. We are a 35 minute train trip into the centre of the city and you need to reach the station by a bus that departs metres from the door. Bus and train time tables are available. Upon arrival, and if you are arriving by train, we generally meet and greet you at the station to help transport luggage if it does not clash with our work times etc. Parking is no problem out the front on our quiet street. We look forward to having you stay soon! Linda and Cem
fields.title: Self Contained Studio at Wahroonga

fields.summary: Great apartment with ocean views located at the most popular Australian Bondi Beach and only 15 minutes away from the Sydney CBA. A short stroll to the nearby shops, cafes and bus stops of Bondi Road and a minutes walk to Fruitologist Bondi for a great healthy packed breakfast. Feel like a swim? We are only a short walk to Campbell Parade, Bondi Beach.
fields.description: Great apartment with ocean views located at the most popular Australian Bondi Beach and only 15 minutes away from the Sydney CBA. A short stroll to the nearby shops, cafes and bus stops of Bondi Road and a minutes walk to Fruitologist Bondi for a great healthy packed breakfast. Feel like a swim? We are only a short walk to Campbell Parade, Bondi Beach. The unit is very bright with lots of natural sunlight, fully furnished with unlimited high speed wi-fi (NBN) and a cozy balcony. The unit also includes a small private laundry area, a bathroom with separate large bathtub and shower and fully fitted kitchen. BEDROOMS The unit has 2 double bedrooms, both with air conditioning.  Main bedroom has mirrored built-in wardrobes and a desk for work.  Guest bedroom has a double bed and wardrobes. We also have a crib, a "pack and play" available, as well as a Moses basket, which are made available upon request. You will have the entire apartment to yourself and your group. Anna is our co host, she
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The sweeping white-sand crescent of Bondi is one of Australia’s most iconic beaches. Use the clifftop Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk, with its dramatic scenery for your morning jog or a nice walk. Remember to check the calendar to not miss out on the famous "Sculptures by the Sea", bringing art to the path every summer. Enjoy Sydney's best breakfasts in one of the laid-back cafes around the block (Dairy at Bennett street - Mere Cafe - Katipo), have a sip of wine in one of the local cocktail joints (The Rhum diaries - The corner House - Stuffed beaver) or indulge a 5 star dinner in one of the restaurants nearby ( Sefa -The corner House).
fields.transit: The  house is located between Bondi Beach and Bondi junction, where the train station is located.  You can walk for 15 minutes to reach either, or simply get a bus.   Bondi is one of the few regions in Sydney that offers bus service 24 hours, conecting you with the city centre and opera house in a single ride.  If you are thinking on driving, the street is very large and parking is free, so getting a parking spot should be easy.
fields.title: Affordable ocean view unit in Bondi

fields.summary: Waldorf Drummoyne Serviced Apartments offers furnished apartments for stays of two nights or more. Our Studio Apartments are self contained and provide a great option of travellers needing holiday accommodation. All Studio Apartments contain one queen size bed.
fields.description: Waldorf Drummoyne Serviced Apartments offers furnished apartments for stays of two nights or more. Our Studio Apartments are self contained and provide a great option of travellers needing holiday accommodation. All Studio Apartments contain one queen size bed. Waldorf Drummoyne Serviced Apartments provides, spacious and comfortable accommodation at less than the cost of a hotel room. The apartments are located in an Art Deco style building which underwent an extensive refurbishment in 2012, resulting in a combination of modern accommodation and 1930's design. Complimentary Wi-Fi is available for guests (up to at 250MB per day). An on-site caretaker resides at the property and is available during business hours to assist guests with their requests. An estimated time of arrival is required for all bookings. There is no lift at the property. There are limited on-site parking spaces. However, street parking is also available.
fields.notes: There is no lift at the property. There are limited on-site parking spaces. However, street parking is also available.
fields.title: Waldorf Drummoyne Serviced Apartments

fields.description: A beautiful private room in a renovated apartment walking distance to Bondi Beach and coastal walk, golf course and shops.
fields.title: Beachside apartment

fields.summary: This house has a beach feel and is only 10 minutes walk from one of the most beautiful Sydney beaches. Most friends who come over comment how it feels like being at club Med. The garden is welcoming, the deck wrapped around the house with daybed, outdoor dining area and outdoor living space. I am French / Australian and speak French, English and Spanish and some Italian. Please note that the smaller room has trundle beds, therefore it is fine for 2 children or for one adult.
fields.description: This house has a beach feel and is only 10 minutes walk from one of the most beautiful Sydney beaches. Most friends who come over comment how it feels like being at club Med. The garden is welcoming, the deck wrapped around the house with daybed, outdoor dining area and outdoor living space. I am French / Australian and speak French, English and Spanish and some Italian. Please note that the smaller room has trundle beds, therefore it is fine for 2 children or for one adult. Beautiful townhouse 10 minutes walk from the beach and shops. 15 minutes drive from the airport 30 minutes to the city by bus off street parking My home is accessible and useful to both tourists wanting to discover Sydney and it's surroundings and to interstate visitors commuting to Sydney during the week or attending a conference.  Welcome to Sydney! Private 3rd floor with 2 lovely rooms and 1 bathroom available in a new, 3 bedrooms, 3 storey town house in Maroubra. The house is light and airy. The rooms comes wit
fields.notes: I have 2 cats, Caramel and Wiluna, they are very friendly and spend most of their time outdoors - they are not allowed in the bedrooms and there is no carpet, only floor boards throughout the house so even people with allergies will be fine (I am actually allergic to cats myself and I am fine).
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Maroubra is one of the best kept secrets of Sydney and locals intend to keep it this way. Across from the street there is a park and the whole area is very green. Maroubra is non pretentious and very friendly.
fields.transit: Maroubra is only 10km from Sydney's CBD and there are many buses walking distance from my house. There is plenty of parking on the street.
fields.title: 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom near Maroubra beach

fields.summary: Our cool and comfortable bedroom (with king sized bed) is ideal for exploring Sydney. Located in  an Eastern suburb hub (Randwick), close to Coogee beach, a cinema, restaurants & shops, with easy transport to the city.

fields.summary: Stay overnight on the most beautiful harbour in the world with a view to the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House on board your very own, completely private, luxury yacht!  We can even take you on a private guided-tour harbour cruise.  No boating experience needed. Thanks to all the wonderful reviews we've received, the yacht is now listed as Airbnb's #1 place to stay anywhere in Sydney and is rated by the Sydney Morning Herald as one of the top three "most amazing" places to stay in Australia.
fields.description: Stay overnight on the most beautiful harbour in the world with a view to the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House on board your very own, completely private, luxury yacht!  We can even take you on a private guided-tour harbour cruise.  No boating experience needed. Thanks to all the wonderful reviews we've received, the yacht is now listed as Airbnb's #1 place to stay anywhere in Sydney and is rated by the Sydney Morning Herald as one of the top three "most amazing" places to stay in Australia. THIS IS HOW IT WORKS At the start of your stay you’ll board the yacht at a jetty in Sydney's east (about ten minutes from the city centre and half an hour from the airport).  We’ll then take you to a mooring in the harbour for the night - either in nearby Elizabeth Bay or at a more sheltered bay, typically the one just next to Taronga Zoo.  If you're staying in the bay next to Taronga Zoo, you'll be surrounded by a National Park, you can enjoy a swim to the nearby beach, and you'll the sun sett
fields.notes: Do please bear in mind that if you want to get off the boat during your stay (other than swimming to the beach!) it needs some organising and may involve a water taxi (see below regarding the 'Neighbourhood' and 'Getting Around'.   I can help you with details - please let me know what you'd like to do and I'll talk you through the easiest way of doing it! Please also remember to bring some food with you for the evening and the following morning.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Sydney Harbour is the most stunning place on earth.  OK.. maybe a slight exaggeration, but it's certainly up there with the best! If you've chosen the TARONGA ZOO option you'll have the whole city skyline laid out in front of you and you'll be less than 100m from a sheltered, sandy beach (you can swim ashore or you can hire the yacht's dinghy).  A five minute walk from there and you're at the ferry wharf where there are half-hourly ferries to whisk you across the harbour to Circular Quay, the centre of town, and the Opera House.  If the wind direction is unfavourable for staying at Taronga, I'll instead take you to different bay that's also surrounded by national park and that'll be beautifully sheltered from the wind. If you've chosen the ELIZABETH BAY option you'll be in a bay that's often exposed to the prevailing wind - that means the boat could bounce up and down a bit during the night.  The boat will be surrounded by other boats that are permanently 'parked' there, there's no vie
fields.transit: If you've chosen the TARONGA option you can hire a 2 person dinghy to take you 50-100m to the nearby beach from where you can catch a ferry into the city (ferries typically depart every half hour).  The cost of the dinghy is $50 for the duration of your stay.  If you've chosen to stay in ELIZABETH BAY the only way to get off the boat, should you want to, is by water taxi.  One way trips from the yacht to a wharf within 1-2kms of the yacht typically cost $120 each way.
fields.title: Luxury Yacht on Sydney Harbour

It is not a surf beach and does not have an undertow or "rip". A ring-of-rocks bathing pool provides safe shark-free.  The location is surrounded by National Parks, beaches and golf courses, It really is a lifestyle location like no other. Although an apartment, the space feels more like a house due to the layout and high ceilings. We have a retro / bohemian theme happening that is cosy. Fab area! We have a retro / bohemian theme happening that is cosy and comfortable. Definitely not a household for a minimalist! The apartment has lots of character - meaning the odd bit of chipped paint - but also boasts wooden floorboards throughout and beautiful pressed tin ceilings.    The available room is situated off the middle of the hallway and is one level above the street. The room gets plenty of sunlight throughout the day and has gorgeous sash windows with Roman blinds, blonde wooden floorboards and a lovely pressed tin ceiling. Towels & 100% cotton 500 thread count sheets are included. I used to work in a linen shop so I have a great selection! We have 1.5 bathrooms - great on a busy morning - and a large lounge & dining room that leads on
fields.notes: Please inquire at least 24 hours prior to wanting to book as I like to have time to prepare the room and let my co-host know your preferred check-in time..
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is lush & green with trees, parks and the harbour just at the end of the street. A peaceful and a lovely place to awake to the sounds of birds. There are lots of fab cafes, a good quality bottle shop and some design & fashion shops up the road.
fields.transit: We are close to three forms of transport: bus, train and there are always lots of taxis lurking at all times of the day! If you feel like a walk into the city it is only 30 - 40 minutes away and Potts Point and Darlinghurst just up the road. We do not have any off street parking.  Catch the train from the airport to Central then change to the Illawarra Line - Platform 24 -  and alight at Kings Cross.  If your baggage is lightweight or you have a good set of wheels attached. Exit onto Darlinghurst Rd and walk towards the fountain at the end of the street. Then walk through the park and down the hill to the roundabout. Then continue down the hill until you hit Ithaca Rd.  We are the second building on the left. Or catch a quick & cheap taxi down the hill.

Well equipped modern kitchen, opening out to sunny and private courtyard. Parking space available.  This house in Newtown is a great base for exploring Sydney. Located on a quiet street and next to a park, it is a few minutes walk from Newtown train station and the buzz of King Street, and within comfortable walking distance from Sydney University and Royal Prince Alfred Hospital. With its many cafes, bars, bookshops, boutiques, and the wonderful Dendy Movie Theatre, Newtown's King Street is a very popular hub for shoppers, foodies and movie fans.  If you can escape Newtown's many attractions, it is very easy to catch buses and taxis downtown or to other Sydney de

fields.transit: The house is very conveniently located for public transport. Newtown train station is a few minutes stroll down the road and close to the many buses that run along King Street. Taxis are readily available too.  The airports can be reached by train. Train to the domestic (approx 25 min) costs $16.40 for adult, $12.50 for child. The trip to the international airport takes only slightly longer.

fields.neighbourhood_overview: What makes the area amazing? Less than 200m from the scenic harbour-side walk which will take you along the beautiful coastline to Manly (which is less than a 20 minute walk).  Take in the sights of Sydney Harbour heads and the local wildlife (you might even see a fairy penguin or two!). If you enjoy a bush walk, we are only 150m from the beautiful Manly to Spit walking track which takes you through one of NSW's most scenic and beautiful national parks, which is in the heart of Sydney. Balgowlah village is just 2 minutes away where you can access beautiful Australian produce as well as enjoying the cosmopolitan aspects of life including cafes and local restaurants. A large Supermarket, 10 restaurants/cafes, pharmacy, butcher, grocer, fish monger and clothing shops all within 5 minutes walk.
fields.transit: A bus directly into the CBD is on the doorstep and the Manly ferry which is the perfect way to see the harbour and get around is a great alternative.

The foosball table is also a mini ping pong and pool table, and I'm always up for a game! Your quiet, comfy and spacious room in my huge, naturally-lit two-bedroom apartment awaits. Enjoy your breakfast on the big wrap-around balcony while taking in a beautiful view of leafy suburbs and Sydney Harbour before soaking up Sydney's famous beach and city lifestyle, ideally situated only 15-20 minutes from both. The apartment is very clean with all the facilities you could need; nice functional kitchen, bbq, outdoor setting, hammock, laundry facilities, wifi and a 55-inch LED TV that makes you feel like you're at the movies. But if you want the real movie experience you're only two minutes away from the nearest cinema, too! Along with all the shops, bars and restaurants that make up the Bondi Junction shopping district, one of Sydney's
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Bondi Junction is the ideal location for Sydney. The beaches are only a walk away and there's a major transit hub nearby with trains and buses that provide easy access to the rest of the city, including the 400 bus that goes to and from the airport for around $5.  Bondi Junction is also a major lifestyle and shopping district with plenty of nearby bars, cafes, restaurants, cinemas and one of Australia's largest Westfield shopping malls, so everything you could want is literally just around the corner.
fields.transit: There is a major transit hub only 5 minutes walk away with trains and buses that will take you anywhere you want to go in Sydney, including the 400 bus that goes to and from the airport for around $5.
fields.title: Sunny apartment awesome views!

fields.description: This comfortable easy living family home, is situated in an ideal location just a 7 minute walk to Bronte Beach, Park and Cafes. All major Sydney sites are only a short drive away and there is a bus just a minute from the front door that links you to a short train trip to Sydney CBD & Harbour or anywhere else in greater Sydney. The famous Bondi beach is also a short bus trip away. You can enjoy the coastal Bronte Beach to Bondi Beach walk to the north, or Bronte to Coogee Beach walk to the south, surf at the local beaches which are great all year round as Sydney winters are quite mild especially to those from the northern hemisphere. Just put on a wetsuit and join the locals in the surf. If you are keen swimmer there is also an ocean lap pool at Bronte beach and a fantastic rock pool for the little ones. July is also Sydney’s Whale Watching season and you can sometimes spot a breaching whale or dolphins during coastal walks.  The house is in a quiet cul-de-sac and also has rear lane ac

Wake up and take a swim in the ocean in less than one minute ! A great place to have an ocean holiday, enjoy coastal walks, local parks, cafes, and Bronte's beautiful beach and sea pools.

Wake up and take a swim in the ocean in less than one minute ! A great place to have an ocean holiday, enjoy coastal walks, local parks, cafes, and Bronte's beautiful beach and sea pools. A two bedroom apartment opposite Bronte Beach. With a lot of living space and overlooking the park and beach. The kitchen and bathroom are renovated and modern, with large bath and shower. Excellent security at the address. Beds and wardrobes are situated in the rooms which are well ventilated. The apartment is on the top floor of a two storey art deco apartment, and across the road from Bronte beach and next to cafes and public transport. A very relaxed atmosphere, and all the comforts of two lounges and lots of space. A q
fields.notes: A private laundry with washing machine and dryer made available. A cleaning cost of $20 per day will be surcharged. Bed linen  and bathroom/beach towels for two person are made available. Toiletries are not supplied.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Safe, clean, friendly, healthy, peaceful and relaxed but never boring. Many cafes, restaurants, parks, beaches, shopping, nightlife. Close to the city centre by bus, train and taxi.
fields.transit: Excellent public transport, with frequent 440 bus to Bondi Junction shopping area, Oxford street Paddington and the City centre - 20 mins to city centre.
fields.title: Vacation by the Sea at Bronte Beach

fields.summary: Situated on quiet and leafy Forbes street, this Darlinghurst apartment is in the perfect spot if you are travelling to Sydney. Literally 10 minutes walk to the CBD!! The open plan kitchen and living area is downstairs while the 2 bedrooms with Queen beds are upstairs. Both bedrooms look out onto leafy Forbes street with City views and a glimpse of the Harbour Bridge. Enjoy the weekly firework displays from the balcony.
fields.description: Situated on quiet and leafy Forbes street, this Darlinghurst apartment is in the perfect spot if you are travelling to Sydney. Literally 10 minutes walk to the CBD!! The open plan kitchen and living area is downstairs while the 2 bedrooms with Queen beds are upstairs. Both bedrooms look out onto leafy Forbes street with City views and a glimpse of the Harbour Bridge. Enjoy the weekly firework displays from the balcony. This 2 bedroom apartment is everything you need for a short or long term stay in Sydney for singles, couples and small families. It's recently renovated and with all the comforts of your own home and more.  We are 10 mins walk into the CBD, right on the doorstep of the cafe, bar and restaurant precincts that are Surry Hills, Darlinghurst and Potts Point and 5 mins to Kings Cross Station. Bondi Beach is just half an hour by public transport and Rushcutters Bay a stroll down the road. The apartment can comfortably accommodate 4 adults and has brand new everything - The kit
fields.notes: Please note we have recently added a glorious 5KW air-conditioner in the lounge/living room to keep you cool on those hot summers days. It works great and will make your stay in Sydney that much better. We have also installed ceiling fans in the bedrooms and they'll keep the air flowing for you!
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The Darlinghurst / Surry Hills area is arguably Sydney's best restaurant/cafe and entertainment precinct! Being on the cusp of the CBD you can be there in 10 mins. Forbes street is one of the quietest streets in Darlinghurst however a 5 min walk will have you in the buzzy part of town!!
fields.transit: Buses and trains are all within walking distance. Kings Cross is the closest train station and is about a 5 min walk away. The CBD is a 10-15 minute walk away from the apartment also.

Smart LCD TV wall-mounted in bedroom.  Ample wardrobe and drawer space for your belongings The apartment has 1 full bathroom which has a separate bath and shower. The toilet is lo
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Kensington is a great suburb..  It is centrally located to the Sydney CBD, Mascot airport, Sydney's Eastern beaches.. Bondi, Bronte, Clovelly, Coogee, Maroubra, Prince of Wales Hospital (and Sydney Children's Hospital and Royal Hospital for Women), UNSW, Centennial Park, Randwick Racecourse, the Sydney Cricket Ground and the Sydney Football Stadium (Aussie Stadium).  Kensington is a very settled (quiet) suburb, with a good mix of apartments and some lovely houses (think large Californian Bungalows, Australian federation style homes).  Kensington is very close to some great eating strips (there are a good mix of local restaurants and take aways within the suburb, but I'd recommend visiting the surrounding foodie havens just one or two suburbs away (Waterloo and Surry Hills are the closest).  There's a nice French style coffee shop less than 50 metres from my apartment that does great coffee,  pastries and ready made baguettes.  Kensington is well serviced by public transport with expres
fields.transit: There are lots of public transport options ( a host of different bus routes) within easy walking distance to get you where you'd like to go!

fields.summary: A modern comfortable 2  bedroom terrace house perfectly situated in a quiet laneway in the heart of Surry Hills. With everything you need at your doorstep from buzzy nightlife to cafe life as well as all public transport.
fields.description: A modern comfortable 2  bedroom terrace house perfectly situated in a quiet laneway in the heart of Surry Hills. With everything you need at your doorstep from buzzy nightlife to cafe life as well as all public transport. Private room in a 2 level renovated terrace located in a quiet leafy lane way with all the necessities at your doorstep.  The room has a comfy queen bed with crisp linen and fresh towels.  Heating provided. Light filled and high ceilings with floor to ceiling glass louvres that open to a leafy Balinese Garden.  The house has it's living area downstairs open plan throughout with sliding doors opening to front and back cozy courtyards. Best suited for a professional who's looking for a comfortable homely environment and a good night sleep that is not a hotel. I am usually working away on deadlines so there will be minimal disturbance, if at all any. Modern kitchen and dining facilities. Laundry room and guest toilet in the back courtyard. Feel free to use. The main bath
fields.notes: For guests that stay longer then 1 month, an extra cleaning fee will be charged. This is to ensure everything is kept tip-top for your staying pleasure and besides who doesn't like fresh linen changed at least once a month.

fields.summary: Whether your looking for a relaxing coastal getaway and/or the convenience of a nearby wedding venue, our cottage is equipped with all the modern creature comforts of a separate and private stand alone beach residence. It's only a five minute drive to either Avalon's diverse range of eateries and shops, or the joy of surfing at  Whale or Palm Beach.  Alternatively, a ferry ride  around Pittwater, or a climb to Palm Beach Lighthouse are all close to  Albert Cottage, leaving memorable experiences.
fields.description: Whether your looking for a relaxing coastal getaway and/or the convenience of a nearby wedding venue, our cottage is equipped with all the modern creature comforts of a separate and private stand alone beach residence. It's only a five minute drive to either Avalon's diverse range of eateries and shops, or the joy of surfing at  Whale or Palm Beach.  Alternatively, a ferry ride  around Pittwater, or a climb to Palm Beach Lighthouse are all close to  Albert Cottage, leaving memorable experiences. Albert Cottage is unique in that it is a free-standing mini-home entirely separate from the main residence and with its own driveway, therefore providing a degree of real privacy.   Located just a short walk (approx. 15  mins) to both Whale Beach and Avalon Beach and village, the cottage is designed to comfortably accommodate 2-4 people (possibly 5).  For guests who have a toddler and provide their own travel cot, there is no extra charge.  For a child occupying a bed, the charge is the same as
fields.notes: Someone will be contactable during your stay if you have any concerns or questions. Please remember to lock all goods inside at night. Although this is a friendly neighborhood, guests are to take responsibility for their own goods.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We love the location where we live; it's walking distance to two fabulous beaches; we have several good restaurants only a few minutes walk away and yet it's a quiet street in a great neighbourhood. Avalon village is a vibrant and interesting shopping precinct with supermarket, cinema, banks, post office, restaurants and boutiques. For those who love a round of golf, Avalon has a very nice 9-hole course right in the village and Palm Beach provides an 9-hole course with an ocean view.
fields.transit: If you don't have your own car, it is a short walk to the main bus route for trips to the city or to Palm Beach. Walking is a great option if you're planning on staying local - or bring a bike. Information on walking trails can be provided.
fields.title: Beautiful "Albert Cottage" In Avalon Beach

fields.description: Located in Sydney's ultra-chic inner east Dalinghurst, this huge 135sqmt oversize warehouse apartment is only mins walk to City Centre Shopping, Harbour Foreshore & Parks or Sydney's celebrated Food & Bar scene. Trains, buses to all of Sydney only 4-5mins walk. Located in an ultra-chic inner east setting, only minutes to the city and next to some of Sydney best parks and dinning suburbs this superb warehouse conversion makes an instant impression with its generous proportions, open space bathed in natural light, soaring ceilings and stylish designer finishes and furnishings. Set on the top level in a boutique security building, this rare home is split over two levels. The upper floor comprises a well appointed master bedroom and generous second bedroom both with with impeccable finishes, built in wardrobes and LCD TVs, as well as an oversize floating loft work space / library which looks out over the lounge with leafy district views.  The lower levels boasts an super spacious lounge, w
fields.notes: The apartment is extremely generous in size at 132 Sq metres and is filled with natural light. Guests staying for periods longer than 7-10 days are obliged to undertake a weekly clean through the owner's cleaners whom they will pay directly.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: There are 7 excellent cafes and x4 top class restaurants within 100metres of the building's front door, not to mention the high reknowed 5 ways and paddington a short 10 minute stroll away.  The magnificent harbour front Rushcutters Bay Park is only 3-4 minutes walk offering a quiet place for relaxation, exercise and socialising.
fields.transit: Many of the buildings occupants walk to the city for walk although proximity to public transport makes getting anywhere in Sydney a breeze from Rushcutters Bay. x2 different train stations are each only 5 mins walk from the apartment. The main aerial bus route from the eastern Suburbs runs from the end of the strew 200 metres from the buildings front door.
fields.title: Designer Warehouse Apartment Sydney (walk to city)

The unit is near harbour foreshore, yacht clubs, Rushcutters Bay, Double Bay and designer shops. ACCOMMODATION The apartment features two oversized bedrooms with built in robes and a separate bathroom with internal laundry.  There are three large living areas, including a sun drenched sitting/ study area, a large lounge/ living and a separate dining room featuring an oversized dining table in an intimate setting.  The kitchen is fully set up with a coffee machine, water filter, top brand large fridge and microwave. TRANSPORT AND PARKING There is every possible transport option available within minutes of this apartment as is Sydney CBD being only 35 min walk into the centre of town.   From the apartment the (Website hidden by Airbnb) Ferry is a 4 minute walk down into Double Bay – Sydney CBD is an 8 min ride (Website hidden by Airbnb) Bus i

fields.summary: A mesmerising view of native bushland invites you to relax in our apartment. Located in a quiet cul-de-sac, you will hear king parrots, lorikeets, and many other birds sing. Public transport available, even on demand all the way to your doorstep. There is also no shortage of free parking. Leave your car, and walk to Avalon's vibrant village or pick one of the Pittwater or Ocean beaches.
fields.description: A mesmerising view of native bushland invites you to relax in our apartment. Located in a quiet cul-de-sac, you will hear king parrots, lorikeets, and many other birds sing. Public transport available, even on demand all the way to your doorstep. There is also no shortage of free parking. Leave your car, and walk to Avalon's vibrant village or pick one of the Pittwater or Ocean beaches. The light filled apartment is spacious (50sqm). The kitchen is fully equipped and even includes a coffee machine. The living room features a comfy sofa and the large TV is hidden away in a cabinet. As we are on the fastest available nbn connection, streaming movies is also not an issue. You will wake up rested on the queen-size bed, which consists of a high quality mattress. The bathroom includes a shower as well as a bath tub. Have breakfast on the balcony (or at the large indoor dining table on those rare occasions of bad weather). The apartment is fully self contained and has private access. Rentals
fields.notes: Special weekly/ monthly rates (single occupancy, no food) are available to local and overseas students (over the age of 18) studying or training at Australian universities or other educational institutions (recognised by the Department of Education). There are plenty of ways to get around Avalon and Clareville  by car or on foot. On foot, you can leverage public paths as short cuts to get quickly from A to B.  Short cut to Clareville Beach on foot (10 min walk): at the cul-de-sac end of Chisholm Avenue, follow short Private Road to the end, and turn right onto steps. Crossing Hilltop Rd, walk uphill for a few metres before you find the next set of steps to the right. Cross one more road, turn right and you find a public path after a few metres starting on the left, leading downhill to the beach. Short cut to buses (5 min walk) and Avalon Beach village (15 min walk): take steps at 29 Chisholm Ave to Avalon Pde. Turn right to village, or turn left to closest bus stop. To return, look for
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Living in a quiet cul-de-sac, overlooking the glorious Angophora Reserve, surrounded by artist studios in the street, you will feel a chilled out neighbourhood.
fields.transit: You can walk comfortably to most local beaches and the village.  Take the car to go shopping and fill the fridge. There are local buses and express buses to the Sydney CBD close by. Keoride is an innovative, inexpensive service that picks you up (and returns you) at your doorstep, just like a taxi, and connects you to the B-Line. The B-Line is the most comfortable express bus along the Northern Beaches and to Sydney's city centre. The cost of a Keoride trip is only $3.10 per person or $1.55 for eligible concession card holders (as of May 2018).
fields.title: Avalon Beach Tree House - walk to beach & village

fields.description: Available Australia Day weekend!  Lovely 2.5 bedroom ground floor apartment in desirable block of four, with shared courtyard. Ideally located in a quiet and leafy street yet only moments to the hustle and bustle of Bondi Beach and all the fabulous cafes and boutique shops the area has to offer. Comfortably sleeps five adults. Perfect for small families or two couples. Features include: Large front bedroom with single bunk beds and single trundle bed Sunroom (off front bedroom) with ample wardrobe space Second bedroom with queen bed  Bathroom with bath and shower, toiletries  Eat in kitchen with 5 hob gas cooker and dishwasher Washing machine and tumble dryer  Leafy shared courtyard  Gas BBQ  Smart flatscreen TV Gas heating  Wifi Wooden floorboards/tiles throughout Linen and towels provided Ornate and high ceilings  Abundance of toys (if needed) Family friendly For long length stays a discount will be offered. It's possible to use the kids toys, kids bikes, a surfboard. We are a stone’
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We are a stone’s throw from the popular Bondi Weekend Markets (Saturday - Farmer’s Market, Sunday - clothing and crafts) and have a multitude of cafes, bakeries, restaurants, shops, play parks and amenities all within short walking distance. For sport enthusiasts there is surfing at Bondi Beach, the local Bondi Beach golf course, the bowling club and tennis courts within walking distance as well as plenty of yoga or Pilates centres. The iconic and famous Icebergs swimming pool and restaurant/bar is a ten minutes stroll, from where you can begin the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk (a must-do whilst in Sydney).  Bondi Beach has so much more to offer depending on the time of your visit with annual activities such as the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition (Oct-Nov), The Festival of the Winds (Sept), the wintery delight of the ice skating rink (July) and an ever-changing programme of arts and culture.
fields.transit: Getting into central Sydney is easy, with two bus routes into the city close by, as well as being only a short drive away from Rose Bay ferry wharf where you can catch a boat to the serene Watson's Bay or Circular Quay (without a doubt, the best and most scenic way to arrive into the city, passing both the Harbour Bridge and Opera House).
fields.title: Lovely 2.5 bdrm apt Bondi Beach

fields.summary: Perfect for longer stays, this quiet, peaceful retreat is in the best neighborhood in Sydney and has everything you need for a wonderful stay for work or pleasure.
fields.description: Perfect for longer stays, this quiet, peaceful retreat is in the best neighborhood in Sydney and has everything you need for a wonderful stay for work or pleasure. This bright, Kirribilli studio is a charming 35 sqm self contained apartment. This home away from home has everything you need to make your stay comfortable.  It has a chiropractic queen-sized bed with memory foam top, a built-in wardrobe with plenty of hangers for your clothes, a 46 inch LCD tv with blu-ray player, 2 seater sofa, small desk and chair, a few books for some reading, a Dyson heater and fan. The studio contains a small bathroom which has a shower, a toilet, a sink and a medicine cabinet with some toiletries for your use.  There is also an iron, ironing board, hair dryer and hair straightener available for your use. The studio has a kitchenette with a 4 burner stove and is fully stocked with high-quality equipment and include:  * Plates  * Silverware  * Electric Stove  * Kettle  * Blender  * Microwave  * Fridge
fields.notes: IMPORTANT: Check in time is from 2pm - 8pm. There is a $50 charge if you need to check in from 7am to 2pm as I will have to block off the night before in order to accommodate your early check in as I normally have guests back to back.   When making an enquiry and reservation, please state your check in and check out times.  Great discounts for longer stays (30 days +)!  FAQ:  Q: Is there parking available?  A: There is no allocated parking available, however there is 2 hr (free) street parking between 8am-6pm, and outside of those hours is unrestricted.  Q: I live close by, can the apartment be viewed beforehand?  A: No, as the apartment is usually occupied by guests and would not like to be disturbed.  Q: What time is check out?  A: We can check out is by 10am however, providing that there is no other bookings right after your stay we can be flexible. Q: How do I get to the apartment?  A: There are a few ways to get to the apartment:  1) The best and easiest way to get to the apartmen
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Kirribilli is a lovely place to live in and very inspiring. It is a community of its own. The Governor General's house as well as the Prime Minister's house are on the corner of the street so it is very safe and is patrolled by police.  It's a great place to exercise and jog around the harbour or do yoga or tai-chi under the bridge as it is by the water and plenty of fresh air.  There are also plenty of restaurants to dine in - thai, italian, seafood, indian, cafes - you name it. There is also a mini supermarket, a convenient store, a liquor store, florist, bakery, groceries, pharmacist, a travel agent, a massage and acupuncture clinic etc. It really is a lovely place to be based in - close enough to the city but also have a sense of peace and quiet.
fields.transit: FERRY: The apartment is 50 metres away from the ferry that takes your directly to Circular Quay (6 mins ferry ride) where a lot of the tourist attractions are - The Opera House, The Harbour Bridge, The Museum of Contemporary Arts and from there you can pretty much get to any of the other attractions - Taronga Zoo, Darling Harbour, Manly Beach etc.  TRAIN: It is 800 metres away from Milsons Point Station if you prefer to catch the train. Sydney's train network is quite good. Milsons Point Station is 1 stop away from the city centre.  WALKING: Kirribilli is the suburb directly across the Sydney Harbour Bridge (the other side being downtown/city centre) and you can walk across the Harbour Bridge too which I do weekly.  DRIVING: You can rent a car also through the car sharing company (Goget) which is parked right outside the building and around the neighbourhood. I suggest signing up prior as they have to send you a card to be able to enter the car. If renting a car through the traditional
fields.title: Sydney skyline studio! Best location!

fields.description: Located in a boutique Art Deco block of 12 in Sydney's Eastern suburb of Bellevue Hill, you'll have the best of both worlds. Just minutes away from Bondi Beach, Rose Bay, a short trip up to Bondi Junction Westfield or down to the boutique Double Bay shops. A bus stop just outside takes you to Bondi Junction Interchange with access to Cityrail trains & buses. Newly renovated modern interiors, timber floor boards, 2 bedrooms with built-in robe in second bedroom, 1 bathroom with shower/bath combined, modern kitchen with built in oven/cooktop, dishwasher, front loader washing machine & fridge all concealed behind joinery.  The apartment enjoys a North East aspect with views out across the immediate tropical gardens and leafy suburb of Bellevue Hill to glimpses of Sydney harbour. Every room enjoys a leafy tropical private outlook. Enjoy the ambiance, comfort and convenience.
fields.title: Art Deco Boutique with a BelleView

fields.description: Located in the heart of one of Sydney’s most prestigious suburbs - this charming one bedroom apartment has rare character and style. Light and sunshine fill’s every room providing an amazing view of Sydney's best. Tastefully furnished with an artistic eclectic flair this apartment offers comfort and beauty.  Situated in a tree-lined street with patisserie, cafes and shops right outside the front door. This apartment would suit executive traveller or short term Sydney visitor as a home away from home with the added advantage of close proximity to Sydney city and iconic Bondi Beach. All amenities and transport are minutes walk away on this main arterial road. Spacious with a queen size bed plus pull out sofa, the apartment can easily sleep three.  Genuinely interested people only. References and Bond required.
fields.title: CHARMING EXECUTIVE APARTMENT

fields.description: Our building is literally 3min walk to Bondi Beach. Even in the dead of winter you can enjoy amazing and breathtaking days! We have two bus stops 5min in either direction. Heaps of shops up the road. Spacious flat with Wifi and access to washer/dryer. Come join us for a visit in the legend of Santa Cruz - our building's namesake. We are a community of warm, interesting and most welcoming people. DESCRIPTION  This lovely and simple apartment is set on the 2nd floor of a hip art deco building circa 1920s. The building is named Santa Cruz - many of the buildings in the area are named after places or cities in California as the builders were trying to capture an exotic American appeal. Bondi has become the epicenter of beach culture in Australia and attracts about 5 million visitors a year. This modest and warm building is at the heart of the Bondi action. *Courtyard patio area for BBQs *Laundry access I won't be home (host) but have a super friendly flatty :-) We're situated in South Bond
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We're situated in South Bondi. Near shops and the main road for ease of access in and out of Bondi. Plenty of activity and friendly people to say hi to in your way to the beach.
fields.transit: Take the 333, 380 or 381 to get in and out of Bondi. Nearest stops are five min walk.
fields.title: 3min to Bondi Beach - literally!

I have 3 children (aged 6,4 and 1) so I have children's toys and items if needed (high chair, cot, cutlery etc) that I can keep out for you to use. As it is my home, it has everyone you will need for your stay and more. The location is amazing - a 5 minute walk to the beach (no steep hill), easy for children, and it is a couple of minutes from the school where there are weekend markets. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and an abundance of cafes too. Woolworths (supermarket) is 5 minutes walk away as well as other food shops including Harris Farms. The bus to Bondi Junction and the city is 2 minutes walk from the flat. It is an art dec
