Not suitable for friends sharing and party groups. Not suitable for

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Potts Point have best of everything.  Top restaurants, friendly local cafes, take away shops, supermarkets, banks... all around corner. fields.transit: To and from Airport :  *Train( metro) - Kings Cross station (change at Central station) then 3 minutes walk. * Taxi - 20-30 minutes Getting around : *Train (metro)  Your station is ''Kings Cross'' Bondi Junction (to beach) - Edgecliff (Rushcutters Bay) - ''Kings Cross'' - Martin Place (city) - Townhall  (city) - Central (main staion, to airport, country links) *Buses : bus stops are 3 minutes walk. 324, 325 to City / Watsons Bay 311 to City / Central station 200 to Bondi  * Walk! : to everywhere!

Clontarf, Middle Harbour yacht club (kyak hire, sailing lessons) Manly dam and Kuringai National Park all very close. Just a 20 minute bike ride to Manly along the bike path.  Reserve great for kids to play in. fields.notes: Please note that the additional charge per person applies to adults only, not for children in a family. Eg if you are a family of 5 and your children are 18 or under, you will not be charged for an extra person. Please make a note in your message to me re the ages of people staying and I will adjust accordingly. Many thanks.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Seaforth is close to Manly on Sydney's Northern Beaches.  Our home is in a fabulous area and our new neighbours are delightful.  The Northern Beaches are stunning. We feel really lucky living in this area. The vibe is relaxed. There are water views everywhere, bush walks galore.  It's hard to believe you are so close to the city in this truly relaxing paradise. Organic Food Markets every Sunday morning at Frenchs Forest (10 minute drive). Organic Food and general market every Friday at Narrabeen (20 minute drive). Stunning location shots early morning walks North Balgowlah, Clontarf, Manly beach and Opera House during Vivid festival.  Taronga zoo and Luna Park both 20 minute drive.
fields.transit: Minutes walk to several bus stops that go to the city, Chatswood, Manly or Palm beach.   Area serviced by the free community hop skip and jump shuttle bus to Balgowlah and Manly.  Excellent grocery shopping at Balgowlah Stocklands fresh fruit and veg etc.  Coles and Woolworths close-by.

Our place is in Fairlig

Fairlight village shops has all the basic conveniences (cafes, chemist, newsagent, bakery, take-away chinese, fire station!) just a few minutes walk away.

fields.summary: We love our brand new family home in North Bondi but are happy to share it! With 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, balconies with ocean and city views and a unique green roof native garden as well as large grassy back garden, it's the perfect place to relax in after a day at the beach or exploring our beautiful city of Sydney.
fields.description: We love our brand new family home in North Bondi but are happy to share it! With 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, balconies with ocean and city views and a unique green roof native garden as well as large grassy back garden, it's the perfect place to relax in after a day at the beach or exploring our beautiful city of Sydney. Located just 15 mins walk from iconic Bondi Beach, on the hillside at North Bondi, this home is a perfect base for exploring the beautiful beachside Eastern suburbs of Sydney.  Conveniently located with corner shop nearby and all the hustle, bustle, markets and cafes of Bondi a short walk or quick drive away. Bus stop 150m to Bondi Junction or Watsons Bay. Nearby Rose Bay ferry for easy transport to the city. Spectacular views of the harbour including New Years Eve fireworks just minutes walk up the road at nearby Dudley Page reserve. Learn to surf at Let's Go Surfing surf school, enjoy the kiddies rock pool at North Bondi or take a few laps of the spectacular Icebergs po
fields.neighbourhood_overview: I love that we are close to the beach and buzz of Bondi, but set back enough that it's not quite so hectic... and you can park! All day! For free!!! Our area is the more family friendly end of Bondi, with more freestanding homes than apartments and is a bit quieter as a result. Apart from the wonderful city and district views, being on the hill is also nice as we get a beautiful seabreeze when it's hot. A couple of minutes walk down the road is a fantastic bakery and cafe which I think serves the best coffee in Bondi, and believe me there is some stiff competition! Also nearby is a bottle shop (handy when you need to re-stock the fridge and don't want to/can't get in the car) and not much further are some local convenience stores. A major supermarket is also only a few minutes drive away.
fields.transit: 389 bus from the bottom of the road goes to Bondi Junction and then the city.
fields.title: Recently completed architect designed family home

Take a leisurely morning stroll along the beach and start the day with an awe inspiring sunrise and a great coffee in one of Avalon's cafes. The home is air-conditioned, spacious, neat and clean with accommodation comprising a large open plan living area, three bedrooms, modern bathroom and internal laundry. The living area features timber floors, gorgeous hand made timber and leather furniture and pool table. The bedrooms have a fun, beachy feel and can sleep up to seven adults. The main bedroom has a queen bed, the second bedroom has a double bed and the third bedroom has double bunks plus a single bed.  Enjoy Cable/Foxtel a Sony Bravia 40'' LCD HD TV.

fields.notes: We offer 24 hour check in from the time the apartment is available. We always offer early check ins or late check outs (or luggage storage) whenever possible. There is also luggage storage available locally.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The apartment is situated right in the heart of Potts Point. The area is home to cutting-edge theatre and comedy, hip bars and cafes, stylish restaurants, food markets and intriguing history.   Within walking distance of the City, Sydney Harbour and the Opera House (approx. 2 kms / 1.2 mi). It’s also very close to public transport. Only 5 to 7 minutes into the city on a train.  Enjoy the best that Sydney has to offer all within easy reach - Bondi beach, the city, harbour, and much more.  The area was once  known for its music halls and grand theatres, it was rapidly transformed after World War II by the influx of troops returning and visiting from the nearby Garden Island naval base. Today, it is a mixed locality offering both services (railway, gyms, supermarket, bakeries) to nearby residents and entertainment venues including bars, restaurants, and nightclubs to visitors.
fields.transit: The apartment is extremely close to everything.  Walking - the apartment is within walking distance to the Opera House, harbour, city, Botanical Gardens museums, and many other attractions (all within 2 to 2.5 kms).  Train – Kings Cross station is only a couple of blocks away. Top up your Opal Card and swipe away.  It’s 3 minutes into the City and 10 minutes to Bondi Junction.   Bus – Catch the tourist hop-on hop-off busses (or the regular bus into the city), from the nearby stops.   Taxi  -- There are many taxis on Macleay st. It’s around $10 to the city / Opera House. Of course, Uber is everywhere too.  Bike hire – It’s easy to hire a bike in Sydney. Download the OBike app and search.   Car Hire - nearby William street is the home to many car rental places.  We recommend Bayswater rentals.
fields.title: Gorgeous retreat. Close to Sydney Opera House.

And great views of Bond Beach, etc. My place is also next door to 2 Coffee shops, the post Office, and drycleaner, .

This bus takes you on the route to the famous Sydney Opera House and Ferry terminals, Botanical Garden,s the Rocks area with many Art galleries & Gifts shops, Pubs, Restaurants, etc.  The townhouse is approximately a 15-20 minute taxi ride from the airport. Alternatively you can take the train from the airport to Bondi Junction and catch the bus 381 . Get off 20m of my house at corner Flatcher St & Dadly St.

fields.summary: Fantastic location. Close to beaches, Sydney CBD & shopping. Quiet & private taking up entire floor of new award winning building. Height of good design and luxury. Complete with new bespoke Italian living room furniture. Comfortable & convenient.
fields.description: Fantastic location. Close to beaches, Sydney CBD & shopping. Quiet & private taking up entire floor of new award winning building. Height of good design and luxury. Complete with new bespoke Italian living room furniture. Comfortable & convenient. This gorgeous, penthouse-style residence in a new, design award winning  block of only 9, whole floor apartments.  This is our home, but we travel so the apartment is available for the school holidays.  Bondi Junction is one of the best locations in Sydney. It is a 5 minute drive to Bondi, Tamarama and Bronte beaches, their fashionable restaurants & cafes and their stunningly beautiful, coastal walks along the sea cliff tops to Clovelly beach. We are a stroll to the fabulous Centennial Parklands and a 10 minute drive to the city, Opera House, Harbour Bridge and ferries to Manly Beach, the zoo and other harbour-side attractions.  The apartment has a great, sunny outlook, and is flooded with natural light and provides spacious open plan living

fields.transit: Bondi Junction is a transport hub. Only a few blocks walk away is a bus station and train station, 3 stops to the city.  By negotiation we can make a secure car park available under our building as parking is very difficult to find and is expensive.

Ann Howard has written for books about the island history and made two short films.  She is happy to give you a talk and walk at your request as part of your memorable stay.  The majority of people come to Ann's place to 'crash' but there are some enthusiastic history buffs!

Some Friday nights there might be a party at the club - if it's noisy, sorry this is out of our control.

Upstairs consists of the master bedroom with queen size bed, en-suite and balcony, large second bedroom and main bathroom (with separate shower and bath). - Please note: the second bedroom is our children's with a set of bunk beds and a cot, which you are also welcome to use. The city center is 1 train stop away and takes about 5 minutes. If you are up for the exercise, you can walk into the city in about 20-30 minutes depending on where you are going. Street parking is readily available in the surrounding streets.

From my place you can walk to some of the best restaurants and cafes in Sydney, cycle one of the many dedicated cycleways into the city, play golf at a great city location, join the city joggers around Centennial Park or make a quick trip to one of the many city beaches nearby. You name your interest and it won't be far away. The apartment is bright, light and airy. It's very well maintained, and is clean and tidy.  The kitchen is fully equipped with loads of gadgets to m

fields.neighbourhood_overview: When I came back from living in NY I wanted to stay in a location that had everything and this area was just beginning to bloom. It literally is 10 minutes from everything, airport, city, shops, beaches, universities, parks. I vowed that I didn't want to drive on weekends and to get around the city but living here I don't have to, so I now catch the bus everywhere. From my place you can walk to cafes and restaurants in Redfern, Waterloo, Surrey Hills and Alexandria or you can use my bike and cycle into Sydney along the dedicates bike way along Bourke Street (see guidebook)
fields.transit: very convenient to public transport with city and beach buses running every 10 minutes and apartment a short walk to green square railway station. Green square station is on the airport rail link convenient to air commuters.

fields.description: Much more than just a bedroom and lounge room with private bathroom in a great location.  You can enjoy an apartment - beautiful, quiet and modern! These  furnished upstairs rooms consist of a bright, sunny and stylish bedroom (lockable) with a comfortable double bed (and the option of a sofa bed in the separate upstairs lounge room)  plus your own bathroom, toilet room and kitchenette and a breakfast/sitting room downstairs.  Please feel free to ask any questions you might have before you try to book it. This accommodation is part of a little private cottage but is separated from my own living space.  This is a modern, architect designed and eco-friendly house which sits in a quiet, leafy street within the inner-city village of Forest Lodge. It is surrounded by heritage houses and parks. You will be staying almost in the heart of the city but with the added benefit of lots of trees and minimal traffic. You even have a private spot to sit out in the garden. A perfect location!    Every
fields.notes: It is easy to get here from the airport by train then a bus (Lilyfield bus 470 from Central Station is easiest). A taxi will cost between $45 and $55 depending on traffic (train/bus is cheapest for one person and taxi or Uber/GoCatch from airport or after train to Central Station is usually cheapest (especially if more than one).  I can send more detailed directions, if you want them, once your booking is completed.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Trees, parks, the harbour and close to transport, the city and lots of cafes and great places to eat.

Many places you will want to go are within walking distance if you like to have exercise. A very short walk will allow you to acces bus routes to many exciting areas of Sydney. Direct bus services (5-20 minute bus ride) go to: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay ferries, China Town, Darling Harbour, Sydney Opera House, Central Station, trendy Balmain, Glebe, Darlinghurst and Newtown areas. There id even a direct bus that take you to Coogee Beach and easy bus combinations to Bondi or Bronte Beach. If you are feeling like some exercise, you can walk to the city centre in about 30-40 minutes and this can be doubly enjoyable if you walk along the harbour foreshore parks and paths via the new Tramsheds restaurant area or the famous Sydney Fish Markets.   Shorter walks will take you to Rozelle Bay, amazing cafes and restaurants (Glebe, Annandale

Belrose is well situated to access the city, Chatswood, Northern Beaches and Manly. A large family house giving privacy to guests. A large pool and barbeque area. You are welcome to use the large pool, which is not heated. I try to help everyone feel welcome and sort any problems if possible. Belrose is a quiet, safe neighbourhood with easy access to various parts of the Northern side of Sydney.  Interesting places to visit are the beaches, especially Manly, Palm Beach as well as an extensive walking track around Narrabeen Lakes and many shopping centres. Some nearby cafes and a hotel for meals. Horse-riding and more meal options at Terrey Hills. Several golf courses nearby, including Bayview, Mona Vale, Warringah, Palm Beach and Terrey Hills. Come and experience Sydney as a local from this lovely apartment. The bedroom has a new Sealy queen bed for your comfort. Sheridan Linen and towels and beach towels are included.  Vaucluse is a nice quiet suburb very close to Watsons Bay & Bondi Beach and not too far to the City. It is very safe and the apartment has glimpses of the ocean. Beautiful ocean cliff walks from the bottom of the street. The kitchen and bathroom are modern and very clean. with a great living room with large TV and a balcony looking out over the ocean. As a guest at the Vaucluse Social Club you will have access to use all the amenities on offer. There is an awesome BBQ on the balcony, large TV with a massive selection of movies and shows, speakers for playing your music, washer/dryer, Nespresso Coffee machine with pods included and local c

Located close to Watsons bay and Bondi beach making it a great place to explore from. The ocean and harbour views make Vaucluse extra special.  My favorite Coffee: Il dolce del Amore: Vaucluse's best coffee and make sure you try a Bacci. Say hi to Rocco.  Shop B, 103 New South Head Road (shop is actually on Laguna Street), Vaucluse Great Bakery: The Grumpy Baker These guys make a lovely sour dough loaf. Also great for breakfast. Shop 6, 767 Old South Head Rd Vaucluse, NSW 2030
fields.transit: There are buses to the city Bondi Beach and  Watsons Bay up the road. The buses will take you to Bondi Beach in 10 minutes, Bondi Junction in 25 minutes and the city, in 40-50 minutes. Come and see Sydney from one of the most beautiful spots in this city. Message me if you would like any more information and I will get back to you as soon as possible.

fields.notes: Famous for it’s wonderful restaurants, cafes and shopping, Newtown is another great spot, a short 10 minute train ride away
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Summer Hill village, Dulwich Hill and Petersham shops are all within a 15 minute walk, affording access to many restaurants and cafes. The area enjoys a great diversity of food cultures, Vietnamese, Greek, Thai, Chinese and Japanese, many of which do takeaway and home delivery The multi-award winning Sideways Cafe, open 8-5 seven-days-a-week is barely 3 minutes away and is location of choice for breakfast and lunch. In fact, we're lucky to have several great cafes, some really good deli's and even a good bookshop in short walking distance
fields.transit: Transport here is excellent, with a 20 minute taxi ride to or from the airport in moderate traffic. Apart from peak hour, it's about the same time in a taxi to the city but more likely, you'd take the bus or the train. There is a new light rail (tram) system that will get you to Central in approx. 35 minutes and the local stop is 2-3 minutes from the house We are close to Sydney's education district with The University of Sydney, University of Technology and Notre Dame University all less than a 30 minute bus-ride away We are situated close to buses that take you to the city centre 8km away. The nearest bus stop is a short 5-7 minute walk away (depending on how quickly you want to walk!) Summer Hill train station s a 10 minute walk away, as is Lewisham station. Dulwich Hill station (offering another train service into the city) is a 15 min walk away

Centrally located, you can expect a very comfortable stay close to the city, 10 mins from the airport, central transport links and a short walk into the trendy areas of Surry Hills, Redfern and Danks St in Waterloo. fields.summary: Balmain is well known for its heritage and village like atmosphere, perfect place to really get the feel of Sydney. The house is spacious and light, exposed brickwork, high ceilings and views of the harbour. Is just the perfect location.
fields.description: Balmain is well known for its heritage and village like atmosphere, perfect place to really get the feel of Sydney. The house is spacious and light, exposed brickwork, high ceilings and views of the harbour. Is just the perfect location. The house is semi-detached built in 1848. Most of the living space is located on the ground floor, with large tv, fire place and dining area. Towards the back of the house is a modern kitchen and small bathroom (no bath) but functional and modern. Heaps of hot water. Upstairs are the two bedrooms, one queen size bed and one double. Rear room has lovely views down to the harbour and Mort Bay. There is an additional bedroom on the third level (Attic style) which can also be utilised, it has a double futon style bed. Out the back there is a covered verandah area perfect for that morning coffee and also a paved back yard with table and bbq. The laundry is located out here also. Front loader no dryer. We get plenty of sunshine. The house is in a very quiet
fields.notes: Please respect that we have neighbours, and it's actually someone's home.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The heritage, the people, the streets are full of character.
fields.transit: Bus and ferry within 5 min walk...

Easy to buy food if you eat  in, supermarket, cafes and interesting shops  just across the park and a large variety of restaurants to choose from if you eat out. A car spot is provided.  Easy access to the apartment, just 5 steps up from ground level.  Very secure and safe. Keys provided of course and contacts if any problems. Great community feel, secure and safe and beautiful. fields.description: My two bedroom art deco apartment is set on the ground floor of a small block of four on a quiet street.  A short walk (5 minutes) will have you in the heart Crows Nest and its many restaurants and cafes and 5 minutes walk in the other direction will have you in the heart of Cammeray. There are superb restaurants, supermarkets/ grocery stores, homeware stores, hairdressers/beauty salons in both villages. In peak hour you can be in the heart of Sydney CBD in seven minutes by taking an express bus from Cammeray, the rest of the day it takes about 15 minutes by public transport or 5 to seven minutes by car. The eat-in kitchen is fully appointed with gas oven and (website hidden) and DVD player in the sitting room and gas heating for winter time! Queen sized bed in the main bedroom.  Shower over the bath (with hand rail) and instant gas hot water. Washing machine in external laundry. Shared backyard with a BBQ and a gate which takes you into a secret garden if you need more space to run ar
fields.title: Cosy and quiet 2 bedroom apartment

fields.summary: A large & cosy room with large window overlooking the garden in this homely eclectic & character filled Inner Sydney terrace, minutes walk from foody heaven, local markets and scenic harbourside walks, & a short  5min bus ride across ANZAC bridge to the heart of the city.
fields.description: A large & cosy room with large window overlooking the garden in this homely eclectic & character filled Inner Sydney terrace, minutes walk from foody heaven, local markets and scenic harbourside walks, & a short  5min bus ride across ANZAC bridge to the heart of the city. The house is bright, airy and homely with open living and dining spaces and high ceilings. Its full of character with its kooky windy staircase, art filled walls and big open fire places.  The room is Spacious and bright with an adjoining sunroom overlooking the garden through wide south facing windows. The room has lots of storage including a walk in robe, and is furnished with double bed, personal TV, chest of drawers, bedside and 2 comfy reading chairs. The kitchen is well equipped and has gas cooking, the bathroom is modern and clean with a powerful gas heated shower. There is a big digital Plasma TV and a huge collection of DVDs and books if youre after a quiet night in.   You can sun yourself in the sun filled g
fields.notes: Relax and make yourself at home and dont hesitate to yell if you need anything :)   Early morning arrival/ checkin possible for a modest additional fee on request at time of booking.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Sitting on Sydney Harbours Balmain peninsular, there are great harbourside parks and walks in all directions. Wander Leafy village streets with two centuries of Sydney architecture,  from convict era sandstone buildings alongside Victorian terraces and early 20th century working class cottages, and take in Rozelle's famous weekend markets after a coffee on cafe lined Darling St.  Stroll around the ghostly relics of Sydney's harbourside industrial past in Rozelle and Blackwattle bay, past the cruiseships and continue through the leafy bird filled parks around the Balmain peninsular to postcard views of Sydney harbour and the Bridge in all its glory. Or Alternately follow the Blackwattle bay side walk through historic Glebe to the fish markets for lunch, before continuing harbourside around Pyrmont to Darling harbour and onwards to Barangaroo and The Rocks and finish with a beer or 3 in one of the dozen great pubs in The Rocks, before hopping on a bus home. The best part of the location
fields.transit: It is 2 Mins walk to the Bus stop on Victoria Rd for a 7 min Bus into the heart of the city, or you can walk (30 mins) or bus across to Birchgrove or  East Balmain to catch the ferry around Sydney harbour. There is easy, free street parking outside the house.
fields.title: Bright Cosy room in eclectic Inner Sydney Terrace.

fields.summary: Our light and airy apartment is just 10 minutes walk from beautiful Bondi Beach – close enough to get there quickly, far enough away to afford some peace and quiet. We have views of the ocean on one side and a harbour view on the other.
fields.description: Our light and airy apartment is just 10 minutes walk from beautiful Bondi Beach – close enough to get there quickly, far enough away to afford some peace and quiet. We have views of the ocean on one side and a harbour view on the other. With wide views out to Bondi Beach and the ocean on the eastern side and a view of Sydney Harbour to the north-west, our sixth-floor apartment is light and airy and has everything we (and presumably you!) need. Just 10 minutes walk from Australia's most popular beach, it is far enough away to be relatively quiet yet close to a vibrant stretch of cafés, restaurants, a healthfood shop, a fish monger, 'fruitologist'... and a chocolate shop. While it is classified as having two bedrooms, we use one as a study and one as the main bedroom. The study has an extensive library and is furnished with two desks, plenty of cupboard space and a sofa bed for guests. The newly installed kitchen is fully equipped with cookware, utensils, crockery and glasses (everything
fields.notes: We will leave a list of suggested eateries and outings in the near neighbourhood as well as public transport details to help you get around.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: This is a very hip neighbourhood with a great variety of excellent eateries. One of our favourites is the Corner House just a short walk up Denham Street from the apartment and on the opposite corner of Bondi Road. We go there for the 'Ben Buckler' pizza which has a thin crust, prawns and anchovies. Otherwise, nearby is Sefa Kitchen, specialising in Middle Eastern cuisine, or, down on the corner of Campbell Parade and Sir Thomas Mitchell Street, the Bondi Trattoria is very good. For general grocery shopping, the Health Emporium on Bondi Road is the place to buy Iggy's sourdough loaves, healthfoods and organic produce. The Bondi Growers Market on Saturday mornings in the school grounds at the northern end of Campbell Parade is a real treat. Go there for brunch after you have had a walk or run and a swim.
fields.transit: While there are plenty of regular buses going from Bondi to the city along Bondi Road nearby, they can become full of beachgoers leaving the beach during summer and by the time they reach our nearest stop, just after Denham Street on Bondi Road, they sometimes don't have room for more passengers. The main thing to know here is to avoid peak times and to leave plenty of time in case one or two buses pass you by. Or just walk to Bondi Junction, about 20-25 minutes away, and catch a train. At these peak times, taxis can be full too, so it's best to book one well in advance. If you would like to use our car space, the fee is an extra $60 per week.
fields.title: Bondi Beach Apartment for Summer

fields.summary: Our house combines period elegance and contemporary comfort! It has a large eat-in kitchen, open-plan living and a great sunny courtyard (with parking). Location is fabulous – less than a minute's walk to the boutiques, bars and cafes on Crown Street. Easy walk to the SCG and Oxford Street. Plenty of buses to the city and beaches. Ten minutes walk to Central Station. Park with playground at top of the street. NOTE! This is a clean and tidy family home – not a dedicated rental. All welcome!
fields.description: Our house combines period elegance and contemporary comfort! It has a large eat-in kitchen, open-plan living and a great sunny courtyard (with parking). Location is fabulous – less than a minute's walk to the boutiques, bars and cafes on Crown Street. Easy walk to the SCG and Oxford Street. Plenty of buses to the city and beaches. Ten minutes walk to Central Station. Park with playground at top of the street. NOTE! This is a clean and tidy family home – not a dedicated rental. All welcome! Three bedroom house. One large double with balcony to street, one double at rear and one child's room, two bathrooms, kitchen and lounge through dining. Off street parking in large courtyard with deck. All usual mod cons - W/M, dryer, microwave, dishwasher. Beautifully presented. No central heating so bring a jumper in winter! Lovely park at the top of the road. The house is brilliantly located in a quiet street off Crown street with its trendy shops, bars, cafes and restaurants. Buses to the city or
fields.notes: Dear prospective guests! Our house is clean and tidy and is regularly 'bombed' to stop unwanted pests joining your visit. But Sydney is a coastal, sub tropical city and little critters such as spiders (some quite big!), moths and even cockroaches are a part of daily life. If you spot more than one or two, please get in touch immediately so we can rectify.
fields.transit: There is off-street parking for one car. Buses on the doorstep to everywhere. 10 minute walk to Central station (downhill!). Hail a cab at the end of the street.
fields.title: Spacious Victorian terrace in Surry Hills

fields.summary: PRESTIGE HARBOUR SIDE LIFESTYLE. You will feel pampered staying at this large contemporary apartment, awash with natural light and showcasing breathtaking un-interrupted iconic views across the Harbour to the soaring city skyline and Harbour Bridge.
fields.description: PRESTIGE HARBOUR SIDE LIFESTYLE. You will feel pampered staying at this large contemporary apartment, awash with natural light and showcasing breathtaking un-interrupted iconic views across the Harbour to the soaring city skyline and Harbour Bridge. Imagine waking up to beautiful view of Sydney Harbour from your bed in this spacious apartment. Whether you are sipping wine on our waterfront balconies, or relaxing in the spacious bedrooms, you will enjoy 270° uninterrupted view of colourful sky and sparkling Sydney Harbour and its world known landmarks from sunrise to sunset. At sunset, watch its colourful reflection on the city skyscrapers as they lit up and sparkle before night falls.  Stunning 270° uninterrupted million dollar view of Sydney Harbour Bridge, Anzac Bridge, Centre Point, Barangaroo, Luna Park, White Bay, Sydney City & landmarks. Exclusive waterfront village, resort facilities, centrally and peacefully located. Moments to renowned Darling Harbour, theatres, restaurants, c
fields.notes: Additional cleaning during your stay can be arranged - our standard cleaning fee of $280 applies.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: With a cosy village feel, Pyrmont is actually located in the City of Sydney. Walking distance to Sydney CBD, Darling Harbour and major attractions. Our neighbourhood is surrounded by waterfront parks, BBQ, playgrounds, shops, restaurant and cafes. Conveniently located yet quiet and tranquil.
fields.transit: * 400 m / 5 minutes walk to bus & light rail  * 400 m / 5 minutes walk to restaurants & cafes, convenient stores  * 600 m / 7 minutes walk to The Star, Darling Harbour, Fish Market * 600 m / 7 minutes walk to supermarket  * 1.2 km / 15 minutes walk to the city centre  (Based on g00gle map distance and ACTUAL walking time)

fields.summary: Three bedroom terrace with large bathroom, backyard and lots of living space. Located just off Crown St it is a quiet abode in the centre of the Surry Hills village. A real home away from home and available entirely for you!
fields.description: Three bedroom terrace with large bathroom, backyard and lots of living space. Located just off Crown St it is a quiet abode in the centre of the Surry Hills village. A real home away from home and available entirely for you! With the equivalent of three large bedrooms you will be spoilt with space. We don't use two of the bedrooms so one is used as an office while the other is used as a dining a roo. The kitchen is connected to the living room and there is backyard out the back complete with herb garden, outdoor dining table and of course a BBQ. Sadly we won't be there but we want you to make yourselves feel right at home! Surry Hills has a real village atmosphere with no shortage of dining and drinking options. It is close to everything and is very much the heart of Sydney's social scene.  Our favourite to do's include: - Saturday morning Brunch at Gnome or FourAteFive  - Catching the live music outside the library while tucking into the incredible ice-cream/ gelato from Messina (a re
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Surry Hills has a real village atmosphere with no shortage of dining and drinking options. It is close to everything and is very much the heart of Sydney's social scene.  Our favourite to do's include: - Saturday morning Brunch at Gnome or FourAteFive  - Catching the live music outside the library while tucking into the incredible ice-cream/ gelato from Messina (a real Sydney must) - Browsing the Surry Hills markets (once a month) which has an amazing arrange of curious and vintage items - Watching people walk-by as the sunsets from the upstairs verandah bar at the Clock - Checking out all the new bars and restaurants (there seems to be a new one everyday)
fields.transit: Being just of Crown St, there are plenty of public transport options. Buses to the CBD and Bondi are only 100 metres away and there is no shortages of taxi's. If you are going further afield and need to get the train, Central Station is only a 5-10 minute walk. From there you can get almost anywhere (including the Airport).
fields.title: Home away from home in Surry Hills

The unit is fully equipped with a kitchen, bathroom with shower and furnished with a double bed, built-in wardrobe, couch with pull out sofa bed, DVD & TV with Foxtel. There is also a WiFi device available during your stay. Kitchen facilities include stove, oven, fridge, microwave, toaster & kettle. Linen for both the double & sofa bed is provided along with towels for 2 people. There is a communal laundry in the complex , a convenience store next door and limited stree

fields.summary: Stay in a hotel... sleep on the beach... or another AirBNB. But stay here and you get an exhibition for free! Close to the city and amenities, our home is filled with things from the 80's > today!! Always rearranging so each experience is unique!
fields.description: Stay in a hotel... sleep on the beach... or another AirBNB. But stay here and you get an exhibition for free! Close to the city and amenities, our home is filled with things from the 80's > today!! Always rearranging so each experience is unique! The apartment is a 1 bedroom, plus study, situated on the 9th floor of an apartment block in the bustling Waterloo area, just 2km from the city centre.  It features an open plan design, fully integrated modern kitchen with floor to ceiling windows overlooking a balcony and part city views.  There is both a shower and a bath for those who like to clean at the same time ;) We live here so our clothes, furniture and personal effects will be in the apartment while you stay, but we have made space for you to store your belongings in the wardrobe and study. The swipe pass allows you up and down the elevator at both 2 and 4 Lachlan Street entries. You’ll have access to level 9, level 2 (for the visitor car park and where the recycling bins are locate
fields.notes: Fresh towels and sheets, soap and toilet paper provided. Large 55 inch flat screen TV with Blu-ray player and HDMI/wi-fi port. Ducted Air Conditioning (Sometimes ‘FAULT’ displays on the thermostat and prevents the unit from working. This is a problem we’re in the process of sorting out… please use the two portable fans instead). Washer/Dryer (please follow the care instructions on the left under the shelves). Weber Q (Switch the gas off after use). Pool/Gym located outside the building on Crystal Street. Bring your own towel and use the swipe pass to enter. Please take care of the equipment. You’re staying in a green building where corridor lights have been replaced with LED and recycling (inc. e-waste and clothing bins) options available on level 2. They’re easy to find walking through to the car park. The garage chute is to the left when you exit the elevator on level 9.  Please do not shove large items down the chute or leave trash in hat room. Please take it down to level 2.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: There are 2x Coles Supermarkets less than five minutes walk both north and south of the apartment: Danks Street is the closest, but the East Village Shopping Centre has more variety. There are a variety of cafes, pubs and restaurants in both areas… explore and enjoy!  A plethora of convenience stores, cellars, medical and dental centres, etc also exist within walking distance.
fields.transit: Car: Parking in the Waterloo area is not ideal. Most spaces are non-ticketed 2 hour allocations and after hours can mean you are faced with residents snapping these up quick smart.  Bus: The (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) (blue buses) and M20 (red buses) are conveniently located on Bourke Street. They will run you into the CBD and Circular Quay going north, and eventually to Mascot (airport area) if you head south. Bus tickets or Opal passes are available from the convenience store on Potter Street.  Train: If you walk directly south on Bourke Street for 10-15 minutes you will reach Green Square train station. The buses all pass Central station on their way into the city.   Bike: A cycleway exists all the way up Bourke Street to Oxford Street. Taxis: Failing that, taxis can be hailed with ease from Bourke Street.
fields.title: Retro/POP! haven in Waterloo

fields.summary: Our home is close to exciting King Street, Newtown with lots of restaurants, bars and music. You’ll love my place because of the newly renovated kitchen, the cosiness, the high ceilings, and the location. Our place is good for  solo adventurers, and business travellers.
fields.description: Our home is close to exciting King Street, Newtown with lots of restaurants, bars and music. You’ll love my place because of the newly renovated kitchen, the cosiness, the high ceilings, and the location. Our place is good for  solo adventurers, and business travellers. We have lived in Sydney all our lives and can give you good information about transport and the best things to see and do around our beautiful city.  The bedroom available has two king size single beds and is a beautifully ornate room. A third bed is available in an adjoining room. We have a large garden which you have access to as well as a gas barbecue. We enjoy hosting guests and will give as much assistance as we can so that you're stay is an enjoyable one. Our area is unique in Sydney. King Street Newtown has many popular restaurants, bars and music venues. It is considered a very bohemian area. We are situated between two railway stations, Newtown and Stanmore, just 10 minutes walk to either, then just a 10 minute
fields.notes: We have a small cross Shiatsu/miniature poodle cross dog.

fields.description: Newly renovated (in 2017), 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom house with sunny garden. Our house is a semi in a popular residential area of North Bondi, just a short walk from numerous cafes, wine bars, bakeries and restaurants.  This house is actually our home & we Airbnb it while we are away, while it’s a 4 bedroom house there are only 3 bedrooms available as we do not rent out the bedroom we use (too much to clean up!) our house was fully renovated in 2017. The living/dining/kitchen is open plan & the photos best describe the space. The living area has 3 sofas, the dining room table seats 8 & there is also another seating area at the back of the house/ outside next to the bi-fold doors - which can be opened fully into the garden. There is no separate laundry - the washing machine is underneath the kitchen bench, there is also a dishwasher. There is a back garden with BBQ, outdoor furniture and hammock.  The 3 bedrooms: Bedroom 1: downstairs, with queen bed, built in wardrobe & sunroom Bedroom 2:

fields.description: The Wharf in Woolloomooloo is an award winning apartment complex perfectly located on Sydney Harbour and enjoys spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour's foreshore, city sky line and the Royal Botanical Gardens.  Also located along the wharf promenade are some of Sydney leading restaurants and The Central Business / Shopping District, Sydney Opera House and the Royal Botanical Gardens are all within easy walking distance from the apartment. Bondi Beach is only a 10 minute drive.  The luxury apartment has 2 x big bedrooms, 2 x bathrooms, a waterfront balcony, a modern kitchen, a combined lounge and dining area, internal laundry, reverse cycle air-conditioning and 24 hour security onsite.  There is also a swimming pool, state of the art gym, sun bathing area and a coffee shop all within the complex.  There is a bus stop and taxi station out the front of the building and a train station close by.  Guests will enjoy all of what Sydney has to offer by staying in the heart of the city and in
fields.title: The Wharf Apartments, Woolloomooloo

fields.description: The House This is a brand new modern home with 4 bedrooms and three bathrooms. The house features an open plan living and dining room with comfortable couches and TV. Also featured are modern amenities and bathrooms. Room#2 has a queen size bed, two bedside tables and lamps, HDTV and DVD player and a built-in robe. Continental breakfast (cereal,toast bread, coffee, tea) and dinner can be arranged for a minimal cost. Linen and towel can be provided at no cost. Studio has own entrance, fully equipped kitchen & bathroom, both newly renovated, and a lovely large lounge/bedroom/dining area with queen size bed. Please do not ask for a discount as the rate is weekly rate already discounted. Thanks! I renovated this self-contained studio in 2013 with guests in mind, and it's as cosy and comfortable as possible. It's located at the back of my property, so it's set back from the street where it's very quiet and private.  There is a single trundle bed for an extra guest if necessary, though the space is not suitable for small children. Guests can have a completely self-contained experience if desired, but also welcome to have a cuppa and a chat. You're welcome to use the laundry and the outdoor dining area if you wish. I'm around most days and will sometimes work in the sewing room which is adjacent to the studio but has a separate entrance. I travel frequently and am always inter
fields.notes: I provide light breakfast supplies to get you started - tea, coffee, milk butter, jam, bread. There is salt, pepper and spices, cooking oil, and various other supplies in the cupboards.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Hurlstone Park is a quiet, family-oriented neighbourhood just on the edge of the trendy inner suburbs of Sydney, in easy reach of most areas of the city -  two train stops takes you to Marrickville, which has a vibrant multicultural community and a huge range of eateries.  Though small, Hurlstone Park shopping centre  has everything you need - grocery store, cafes, bakery, post office, hairdresser and newsagent. For bigger (and cheaper) shopping requirements there is an Aldi Supermarket 1 train station away at Canterbury. The location is close to the Cooks River, which has plenty of green space and native wildlife - very popular for walking, running and cycling.  Canterbury Racecourse 1 suburb away, so anyone travelling for a day at the races can get there easily.
fields.transit: Hurlstone Park station is a two minute walk away with frequent trains into the city and suburbs. A new light rail system has recently opened at Dulwich Hill and is a 10 minute walk. It offers a different route into the city and makes more suburbs easily accessible. There are several bus stops nearby as well. Guests are welcome to park their car in the driveway. There is also free parking available on the street. If arriving from Sydney Airport, you can catch a train to Central Station and change to the Bankstown Line for Hurlstone Park. However, be aware that a full fare is $16.40, so if there is more than one traveller, it will often be cheaper (and much quicker) to get a taxi - it's approximately 15-20 minutes in good traffic, and will usually cost $25-$40.

Feel free to chill out in the living area and read a book from the bookshelves.  And you'll have your own key to come and go as you please. We are a young couple who have grown up in Sydney. The living room and dining table is a naturally sociable and welcoming environment, and we like that guests can feel at home here. fields.summary: Wake up to the sun peeking through the bay window blinds at this charming Federation cottage. Enjoy morning coffee in the tree-lined yard soaking up the peace and quiet of this hideaway in the heart of the vibrant village of Crows Nest.
fields.description: Wake up to the sun peeking through the bay window blinds at this charming Federation cottage. Enjoy morning coffee in the tree-lined yard soaking up the peace and quiet of this hideaway in the heart of the vibrant village of Crows Nest.
fields.notes: Please note that there are six steps from the driveway to the front door. The front part of the house is a traditional Federation-style cottage in keeping with the rest of the street, and we have no mobility aids installed to help bypass the steps. This means that access from the street to the room is not practical for wheelchairs.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Recently voted Sydney's most liveable suburb, Crows Nest is unpretentious, charming, and very safe. It's famous for its cafes, restaurants, and small bars. North Sydney is just down the hill, and it's a pleasant 30-minute stroll to Harbour Bridge.
fields.transit: There are several bus stops within 5 minutes' walk in all directions: whether heading over the Harbour  to sample the charms of the city or venturing further afield in any direction, Crows Nest is central to everything. Buses to the city, railway stations or the Northern Beaches run every few minutes from the top of our street or just around the corner on Falcon Street. Please note that you will need to purchase an Opal Card before you jump on a bus, train or ferry. Start with $20-30 credit and you can always top up online or at newsagents or convenience stores.  The 343 bus leaves from the top of Burlington Street (out front of the dry cleaners opposite Xenos) and will take you all the way through the CBD and Surry Hills. They leave roughly every 10-15 minutes on weekdays, slightly less often on weekends. North Sydney, Waverton and St. Leonards railway stations are each roughly a 15-20 minute walk or a short bus trip away. Taxi is by far the fastest and most convenient way of getting
fields.title: Explore Lively Crows Nest at a Restful, Airy Home

fields.summary: This gorgeous one bedroom, two-story studio - situated in the heart of Sydney - is the perfect space for a couple: large,open plan kitchen & living room, lots of natural light and a lovely native garden! Just a 5-10 minute walk to many gourmet cafes and restaurants, local grocers and bars.
fields.description: This gorgeous one bedroom, two-story studio - situated in the heart of Sydney - is the perfect space for a couple: large,open plan kitchen & living room, lots of natural light and a lovely native garden! Just a 5-10 minute walk to many gourmet cafes and restaurants, local grocers and bars. Perfect for both short and longer stays.  The studio it was built to be a part of 170 Albion St, although for practical reasons there is a gate between the two places but if two families wanted to share the whole house that would be a great option. You could open the gate and have the whole house to use.  The studio has an independent entrance which opens directly onto a busy wide commercial lane. Little noise is heard in the Studio so it is peaceful which makes it a real contrast to the Lane. The lighting in the Lane is good and many neighbours with children use the Lane as their main entrance but it is not a leafy normal entrance as it directly opens into the spacious main room.   The studio is a 3
fields.notes: CLEANING FEE NOTE: Please take note that our cleaning fee includes professional cleaning after each guest along with the restocking of essentials such as toilet paper, soap, conditioner etc. The sheets and towels that we use are high quality hotel standard linens which is guaranteed to be clean, fresh and pressed. If you have any problems with the cleanliness of the house when you arrive please let us know AS SOON AS YOU ARRIVE so that we can send the cleaners back to complete the job.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Annandale is leafy established inner west suburb that is close to the city and central harbour. A great walk is at the end of Johnson St, where you can walk by the waterside to Glebe and have a early morning coffee at Blackwattle Bay. The delights of being near the water and living in a city. Cafes I recommend the delicious cafe and Italian deli, Locantro for the best pastries and pies which are perfect for breakfast and lunch, and they make great coffee.  The Cafe Sienna in Annandale St is more relaxed and peaceful where it is really pleasant to sit outside and is only a few minutes away. Also there is Trafalgar St Espresso, 18A Trafalgar St, Annandale closeby too which is more contemporary and has good coffee. It has a cosy groovier atmosphere with a younger crowd so definitely worth a the effort. Restaurants Only 1 minute away is Surjits, a good Indian Tandoori in Parramatta Rd.  There is a sustainable fish restaurant called Fish & Co, in 41 Booth St, Annandale, which I enjoyed and
fields.transit: The apartment is very close to public transport - buses to the city every few minutes and it is very easy to get a taxi. You will need an opal card which you can buy at a newsagent. If you use the Tripview app. that will help you find your way. Central Station is about 10mins by bus and form there you can go anywhere. Stanmore is the nearest train station and about a 10min walk and probably the best way to Town Hall at the moment because of the building works that is happening in the city. Maybe try the buses first. Also the light rail in Annandale, directly north of here is another good alternative.

fields.description: This family home with a wonderful tropical garden is a hidden gem, close to all the fun life of Manly. Relax and enjoy your holiday in this beautiful early 1900 renovated Federation House.! You'll feel at ease in this "home from home". The leafy suburb of Fairlight is conveniently located. We're a 2 min walk to the City buses, 1 min walk to the free community shuttle that will take you to the heart of Manly. If you prefer, an easy walk will also get you there in 20 min. From Manly Wharf, it's a scenic 30 min ride by ferry across the Harbour to Sydney. Manly swimming pool is also within 15 min walking distance, as are free harbour and sea pools. You'll find great local shopping in Manly, fine dining & casual restaurants, lots of fabulous coffee hangouts. A multitude of outdoor activities awaits you: amazing coastal and bush walks, kayaking, diving, beachvolleyball, cycling and of course, surfing@ Manly's iconic break. There are 3 golf courses nearby. For your daily supplies, you're also
fields.notes: no
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We are close to busy Manly, but just far away enough to enjoy a peaceful holiday.
fields.transit: There is a free community shuttle at the end of our street that will get you to Manly ( 7am-6pm week days, 9am-6pm on weekend). RTA buses can be caught from Sydney rd, to Manly or to the city. From Manly you can catch the scenic ferry into town.

Choc full of gorgeous buildings, green trees, gorgeous parks, yummy cafes and a 10 minute ride by public transport into the city centre. Our place is good for solo adventurers and business travellers.

fields.summary: Allawah Cottage is a sunny, clean, cosy self contained 3 bedroom cottage right in the hub of things in vibrant Newtown, it sits opposite a beautiful park and is only a short walk to Sydney Uni and RPA. Small, well behaved dog/s welcome. FREE wifi.
fields.description: Allawah Cottage is a sunny, clean, cosy self contained 3 bedroom cottage right in the hub of things in vibrant Newtown, it sits opposite a beautiful park and is only a short walk to Sydney Uni and RPA. Small, well behaved dog/s welcome. FREE wifi. Allawah Cottage features: 1st Bedroom: - Double bed - Lovely view of the park 2nd Bedroom: - Queen sized bed 3rd Bedroom (the loft): - Large, air-conditioned loft bedroom with twin beds Sitting Room: - Comfortably furnished sitting room with gas heating - Flatscreen TV with and DVD player Kitchen: - Fully equipped kitchen with gas stove - Dishwasher Bathroom: - A bathroom with a shower and a bathtub and hot water that never runs out! Laundry: - Washing Machine - Clothes dryer Situation: Allawah Cottage is located at 66 Lennox Street, Newtown  Our other cottage Carinya Cottage is right next door and is also listed on airbnb: https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1571117 If your group consists of more than 6 people, you might like to also book our st
fields.notes: FREE wifi
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Right in the heart of funky Newtown. There are hundreds of great bars, restaurants and cafes right at your doorstep. There's also a shopping strip (King St and Enmore Rd) with supermarkets, convenience stores, fashion, homewares and quirky shops. From this location you can walk to 7 theatres. The Cottage located only a short walk from Sydney University and Royal Prince Alfred Hospital. It's also walking distance to the The Carriageworks' arts/theatre centre which is where many Sydney Festival events are held, and on Saturday mornings the 'Eveleigh Farmers Markets' (Sydney’s best gourmet market) are held here selling fresh produce and bread, coffee, flowers, cheeses etc. They also hold an arts/craft market once a month.
fields.transit: Only five minutes walk to Newtown train station. Newtown station (only three stops to Central and the City) is on a direct line into the City and Circular Quay, where you will find the Sydney Opera House, the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the historic The Rocks precinct. It's possible to walk to the southern end of the city and Darling Harbour in about 30 minutes. There are also direct buses at the end of the street that take you to the City, Bondi, Coogee Beach and other areas. It's only about 15 minutes in a taxi to/from the airport (about $25 taxi fare) or take the airport line train to/from central connecting to/from Newtown. Newtown scores 99/100 on walk score and is defined as a "walker's paradise". The area is a walk everywhere lifestyle.

fields.description: This is a truly unique opportunity to stay in one of the most sought after apartments in Manly.  This two bedroom light and spacious apartment in the beautiful 'Dungowen' building has a superb beach front location and is close to the ferry terminal. You will have your own room and private bathroom. The open lounge and dining room has an LED flat screen TV, two comfortable sofas and large dining table. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishwasher, microwave and oven. A front loader washing machine is available in the apartment if you need to do a spot of laundry. The apartment is within easy access of everything that Manly offers including its many cafes, restaurants and bars and it is only a 5 minute walk to Manly wharf for those wishing to take a short ferry ride to the Opera House and downtown Sydney. Both slow (30 mins) and fast (15 mins) ferries to the city leave at multiple times every hour.  The Manly area also offers beautiful Shelly Beach and secluded harbour beaches where swi
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Surf culture and cafe culture coalesce in Manly, Sydney's favourite northern suburb and famous destination for weekend getaways.  When the sun's up, activity thrives along its long stretch of sand and frolics in its rolling sets.  When the sun sleeps, Manly stays awake at the casual pubs, bars, and restaurants that its residents call their homes away from home. It is safe, friendly family orientated and has an enthusiasm for all things sport related.
fields.transit: My apartment is an easy 5-10 minute walk to the Manly ferry terminal. It is also close to all major bus routes.
fields.title: Stunning Beach Front Apartment in Manly!

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Rockdale has a mixture of residential, commercial and light industrial areas. The main shopping strip runs along the Princes Highway, on the eastern side of Rockdale railway station. The commercial centre spreads out into surrounding streets and on the western side of the railway line. King Street has developed into a cosy strip of cafes and grocery shops. Commercial developments run along the length of the parts of Bay Street and West Botany Street. The light industrial areas are located around West Botany Street.

You'll hear them discussing everything from chakras to Che Guevara in its casual eateries, bookstores and pocket-sized bars."

Its also just a ten minute walk to Kensington St Central Park and Sydney light rail and about 20 minutes walk to the Sydney Fish Markets and Darling Harbour.

fields.summary: This gorgeous 3-bedroom apartment is directly across the road from the beach. It's very light, beautifully decorated and all within minutes of Bondi, Bronte, restaurants, shops and buses to the CBD. Watch the waves as you have a drink on the balcony.
fields.description: This gorgeous 3-bedroom apartment is directly across the road from the beach. It's very light, beautifully decorated and all within minutes of Bondi, Bronte, restaurants, shops and buses to the CBD. Watch the waves as you have a drink on the balcony. Here are a few of the highlights of The BEACHFRONT Apartment: THE APARTMENT The building only has 7 apartments in total. Your new neighbours are lovely. They all enjoy spending time at the beach and they are mature enough to avoid late nights and loud parties so you won't be disturbed. THE BALCONY It wraps around the front of the building and gives you a huge entertaining space. From the balcony you stare straight at the water and out to the horizon. It's stunning! INTERNALLY We have furnished the apartment using light and bright colours to capture all of the sun that pours into the rooms throughout the day. There are three different eating areas - the dining table, the breakfast bar with views out to the beach and an outdoor table and cha
fields.notes: FREE BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE We want you to have a great time when you stay at our place. We like the idea of you sitting out on the balcony celebrating something and admiring the view. So, anyone that books for 3 nights or more will find a bottle of Veuve Cliquot in the fridge upon arrival. SAVING LIVES We are really thankful to live by the beach and it's a stunning beach. One of the things that makes this beach a great place to swim and have fun in summer are the lifesavers who volunteer their time to look after the people who use the beach. Chances are that you've chosen our place partly because of the beach out the front. So to thank the guys that look after the beach for us, 10% of everything that you pay to us will be given to them as a donation. It's the least we can do for the guys that keep the beach safe. We'll send you a copy of the receipt and any comments that we get from them in thanks.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Tamarama is the younger, arguably prettier, sister to Bondi Beach. It's a relatively quiet beach where locals spend hours bathing in the sun. There is a park here with BBQs, toilets, changing rooms and a large grassy area to make a picnic. GREAT OCEAN WALK While you're in the area, you must take the Great Ocean Walk. It's a pathway that hugs the coast line all the way from Bondi to Coogee beach. Thankfully, it crosses your doorstep. Just join the throngs of people making the pilgrimage every day. SCULPTURES BY THE SEA Every year artists erect a series of sculptures along the Great Ocean Walk. It's a magical display set against the ocean views along the walk and it attracts thousands of local people and others from around the world. This year it is happening from 24 October - 10 November.
fields.transit: BUSES The local area is serviced by buses that will take you to other transport hubs that will take you anywhere you need to go or you can catch a local bus directly to the CBD and be there in about 15 minutes. You'll have access to the internet from the computer set up for you in the apartment. Just either call 131500 and ask them for help or search 131500 on a search engine and you'll find a website showing all the timetables. You're not too far from anywhere!
fields.title: Bondi-Tamarama BEACHFRONT Apartment
