fields.description: Modern art deco apartment, conveniently located. Two minute walk to Potts Point cafes and restaurants, and 20 mins walk to the Art Gallery of NSW, the Botanical Garden, Opera House & the CBD. Ten minute walk to transport to Bondi, and beyond. Enjoy! Nestled in a tranquil cul-de-sac, in the Parisienne-end of Potts Point, this bright top-floor apartment, offers open space and versatility. Just two minutes walk to your morning coffee! The apartment is in a classic red brick 1930s art deco apartment block in Sydney's highly-desirable Potts Point. It features original sash windows, timber floors and a superb floor-plan lending itself to open plan living and dining-as well as an oversized bedroom and adjoining art deco bathroom, complete with a deep bath and shower.  The apartment is in excellent condition, is extremely comfortable and offers executive style living.  I'll supply plenty of local information to ensure you have your perfect Sydney visit. The entire apartment, 1 bedroom, combine
fields.notes: Sydney is a great city to visit. It has all the things cities offer and more. The building is a well maintained and much loved art deco building with many of its original features well maintained including its wide and deep staircase, bannister and windows. As there are only three floors the building does not have a lift. No parking is available. The nearest secure parking is at Kings Cross - a ten minute walk away:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Urban and cosmopolitan, yet has a vibrant village feel.  Walking distance to the Botanic Gardens, NSW Art Gallery, CBD, Opera House and the harbor foreshores, as well a short stroll up to the best cafe' and restaurant scene in  Sydney. Easy access to public transport to Bondi Beach, Bronte, and beyond.
fields.transit: 2 minute stroll up to cafes, a 20 minute walk to CBD or two minute walk to bus stop to CBD. Ten minute walk to Kings Cross Metro Station and for buses to Bondi.
fields.title: Stylish light 1 bed Potts Point

fields.summary: Welcome to my beautiful home only 5 mins stroll to the beach.  My home reflects a lifetime of travel, a love of art and my profession as a designer.  It is bright, colourful, full of sunshine and light, with high ceilings and large, open-plan spaces. The house sits in a large, tranquil, leafy garden; a peaceful haven perfect for a relaxed and easy going lifestyle and would suit a single person or couple.
fields.description: Welcome to my beautiful home only 5 mins stroll to the beach.  My home reflects a lifetime of travel, a love of art and my profession as a designer.  It is bright, colourful, full of sunshine and light, with high ceilings and large, open-plan spaces. The house sits in a large, tranquil, leafy garden; a peaceful haven perfect for a relaxed and easy going lifestyle and would suit a single person or couple. Hidden from the street, down a flight of stairs, the house is on a split-level block. So when inside, it looks out over a large leafy garden and canopy of trees. A 5 minute stroll down the street, through a semi-tropical park, with a waterfall and stream, meanders towards one of the most beautiful beaches in Sydney.  The house features a large modern open-plan kitchen and dining room with timber floors throughout. A wall of sliding glass doors leads onto a balcony with BBQ, overlooking a leafy garden. The kitchen is new, and has a French Provincial feel, complete with large refectory t
fields.notes: This is a quiet, peaceful haven. I have a lovely tenant living in an apartment downstairs, so please be aware of the noise level. For this reason, the house is suitable for adults only. There is limited internet download, so it can be used for email access and searches only. No streaming of movies or it will quickly run out.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Bronte is a beautiful seaside village and the prettiest of the coastal communities. It's proximity to both the city, Sydney Harbour and one of the most beautiful coastal walks in the world, make it a perfect location with which to explore this wonderful city. Each November the coastal walk hosts the famous "Sculptures by the Sea".  There are plenty of options for local wining and dining or simply to sit and sip coffee while gazing out at the ocean.  Bondi Junction, only 10 mins away by bus, is a major shopping hub. Other activities include bike riding at Centennial park, outdoor cinemas in the summer (and indoor at Bondi Junction). There's even an ice rink on Bondi Beach in the Winter Festival! Bronte is hard to beat. Bronte Beach has everything - a large, leafy park with BBQ facilities, a kids' playground, enclosed pool, cafes as well as the beach itself. Walk along the famous Bondi to Bronte coastal walk, and you will arrive at Bondi Beach in only 20 minutes. If you go in the other d
fields.transit: Bronte is perfectly situated to enjoy the wonderful sights Sydney has to offer. It’s only 15 minutes drive or 20 mins by bus from the heart of the city or 10 minutes by bus from Bondi Junction. The trains from the city to Bondi Junction run frequently and take 7 minutes. It is 20 mins by taxi from both the domestic and international airports to Bronte and about 30 mins by bus. There is also a train from the airport to the city.
fields.title: Bronte Beach House

fields.summary: Recently renovated, our worker’s cottage has been transformed into a chic retreat designed for hassle-free living. Dual level, bright open plan living areas. Gourmet gas kitchen and quality appliances. Located on peaceful street. Beach, transport and lively village shops and cafés are moments away.
fields.description: Recently renovated, our worker’s cottage has been transformed into a chic retreat designed for hassle-free living. Dual level, bright open plan living areas. Gourmet gas kitchen and quality appliances. Located on peaceful street. Beach, transport and lively village shops and cafés are moments away.
fields.title: Bronte Beachside Cottage, Sydney

fields.summary: Prestige, multi million dollar property in stunning location. Expansive Ocean views. Direct beach access to Gordon's Bay. Stroll to Coogee Beach with its many cafes and restaurants. Located on Coogee to Bondi Coastal Walkway. Exclusive location. Gardens and ocean views. Period features with Modern convenience. Quiet and spacious but close to public transport and access to all that Sydney has to offer plus proximity to the city centre.
fields.description: Prestige, multi million dollar property in stunning location. Expansive Ocean views. Direct beach access to Gordon's Bay. Stroll to Coogee Beach with its many cafes and restaurants. Located on Coogee to Bondi Coastal Walkway. Exclusive location. Gardens and ocean views. Period features with Modern convenience. Quiet and spacious but close to public transport and access to all that Sydney has to offer plus proximity to the city centre. Dress circle position above Gordons Bay,Coogee with unencumbered ocean views. On the famous Bondi-to-Coogee coastal walk. The Coastal Walkway is ranked as #2 of 274 attractions – second only to Sydney Harbour – by TripAdvisor. Our ocean front, cul-de-sac home commands stunning panoramic postcard-perfect views of the Pacific ocean and the entire magnificence of the coastal walkway as it hugs Gordons bay's sweep of sand, surf and striking coastline.  MOST RECENT REVIEW  "Excellent property! It is amazing, the house is beautiful and with a wonderful sea view
fields.notes: A truly memorable stay in a world class setting. 7 nights minimum stay 18 December- 5 January;  4 nights minimum stay at other times.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Amazing views. Secluded and exclusive location. Peaceful aspect in a residential cul de sac with multi million dollar homes and spectacular waterfront views. Close to Coogee Beach and city. Many tourists have heard about Bondi and this is close to where we live but we  live near the best beach in Sydney -Coogee beach. But we are even closer to one of the most special places in Sydney - Gordon's Bay, nestled 5 minutes between Coogee beach and Clovelly beach. It is a little piece of paradise which we are lucky enough to get to view every day. We have travelled often and have stayed in other people's houses and apartments, so we know and appreciate the other side of staying in a great location and home. But one of the best places to live in this world has to be Coogee, Sydney and I consider myself extremely lucky  and am sure our guests will feel that also. I love the fact that when people first walk into our home they are astounded by the beauty of our view. It has the wow factor! The ph
fields.transit: Excellent public transport options. 15 minutes from Sydney airport; 15 minutes to CBD; 5 minutes walk to Coogee beach. Excellent public transport facilities to and from Coogee Beach eg Bus to city 25-30 minutes; bus to Bondi Junction train station 10-12 minutes
fields.title: Sydney Beachfront Near Coogee& City

fields.summary: Live like a local while exploring iconic sights of Sydney. Charming cosy apartment inspired by a mix of midcentury modern and Scandinavian lines, awesome company guaranteed. Set in a quaint tree-lined lower north shore village, 5mins walk to the train station, 10mins train to the cbd, easy access to a variety of neighbourhoods (from the hip & trendy to the casual family-friendly types), cafe scenes, beaches, scenic walks & bushland. You'll love coming back here to relax, a home away from home.
fields.description: Live like a local while exploring iconic sights of Sydney. Charming cosy apartment inspired by a mix of midcentury modern and Scandinavian lines, awesome company guaranteed. Set in a quaint tree-lined lower north shore village, 5mins walk to the train station, 10mins train to the cbd, easy access to a variety of neighbourhoods (from the hip & trendy to the casual family-friendly types), cafe scenes, beaches, scenic walks & bushland. You'll love coming back here to relax, a home away from home. ABOUT MY FLAT  Relax and chill out in your own private sanctuary - a bedroom complete with a comfortable double bed, mirrored wardrobes, and a gorgeous green leafy outlook. Put your feet up, make yourself at home and enjoy my spacious, light-filled apartment. Inspired by Scandinavian style meets mid-century modern, I've lovingly decorated my living & dining area with a mix of beautifully restored original 1960s pieces and Scandinavian lines.  The sun drenched balcony is my little piece of oasis a
fields.notes: I tend to be out and about, especially during the work week, but generally, I'll go with the flow, and will happily socialise, depending on what works for my guests.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: THE NEIGHBOURHOOD  Waverton is a leafy area within walking distance to Balls Head Reserve, a bushland oasis with stunning views of the Harbour Bridge, City Skyline and Goat Island. Surrounded by greenery, you will be surprised that you are only 10 mins train ride from the city. Waverton Village - 5 mins walk  Quaint village with a supermarket, newsagent, bottle shop, chemist, restaurants, cafes, bakery, hairdresser, drycleaners, health practitioners, Waverton station - everything you need, really! Crows Nest - 15 mins walk  Central shopping village with interesting shops, cosy cafes and loads of restaurants Kirribilli/Milson's Point/Mcmahon's Point  Trendy cafes, pretty tree-lined streets, local pubs, Luna Park, and parks under the Sydney Harbour Bridge pylons - with full frontal views of Sydney Opera House. Catch a scenic ferry ride to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour or Balmain from Milson's Point.
fields.transit: GETTING AROUND  **Walk**  20 mins walk to Sydney Harbour Bridge, where you can take a memorable 1.1km stroll across the Bridge to historic The Rocks and the city  **Train**  5 mins walk to Waverton Train Station  From Waverton Train Station, 3 stops (10mins) to the City  **Bus**  7 mins walk to Pacific Highway bus stop.  From bus stop, 10 mins to the CIty  Easy access to direct buses to Manly & Balmoral Beach Covered car spot available, at additional cost GoGet Cars right on doorstep **To/From Sydney Airport (International & Domestic)**  Taxi: 17km | 30 mins | $60 approx Uber: You can now also catch an Uber from the airport - download the Uber app, and follow the signs at the airport - cheaper than a regular taxi Train: 60 mins door-to-door | $17 one way - you will need to get an Opal card at the train station - follow signs to train station at the airport
fields.title: Charming flat in idyllic Waverton, close to CBD

fields.summary: Our recently renovated garden apartment is very conveniently located, with multiple beaches, cafes and grocers all within walking distance. It's but a 10 minute stroll to Bondi Beach, just far enough to avoid the tourists and party-goers. If you fancy a quiet night in, there is a well-equipped kitchen and 65" TV for some Netflix & chill, as well as air-conditioning throughout. The kitchen backs on to a paved area and yard, great for a barbecue, sundowners or for the kids to hang out.
fields.description: Our recently renovated garden apartment is very conveniently located, with multiple beaches, cafes and grocers all within walking distance. It's but a 10 minute stroll to Bondi Beach, just far enough to avoid the tourists and party-goers. If you fancy a quiet night in, there is a well-equipped kitchen and 65" TV for some Netflix & chill, as well as air-conditioning throughout. The kitchen backs on to a paved area and yard, great for a barbecue, sundowners or for the kids to hang out. Although technically an apartment, our home has the feel of a house, as it opens on to a garden and is one of only four in the block. High ceilings and wooden flooring throughout give it a spacious and natural feel. Guests will have access to the entire apartment, which includes a large open plan kitchen and living area, a bathroom with bath/shower, and 2 double bedrooms, one of which has an ensuite with shower. We will not be around, but will leave instructions detailing everything you require. We will be
fields.neighbourhood_overview: There are many great cafes & eateries within walking distance, we are happy to advise on our favourites!
fields.transit: There are bus stops on O'Brien St right outside the apartment, which will take you to & from Bondi Junction in 10 minutes, from where you can catch trains all over. Although there are some free street parking spots available, a visitors parking permit can be arranged upon request at a cost of $47, which will allow you to find a park more easily, especially during the holiday season.
fields.title: Bondi boutique garden apartment

fields.summary: Well equipped and comfortable, this home will find you minutes away from the university, hospital, beach, racecourse and great restaurants & only a short bus ride to the city and SCG. An enjoyable and relaxing stay for 2 couples or couples with kids.
fields.description: Well equipped and comfortable, this home will find you minutes away from the university, hospital, beach, racecourse and great restaurants & only a short bus ride to the city and SCG. An enjoyable and relaxing stay for 2 couples or couples with kids. This secure and well equipped two-bedroom apartment is ideally located in a sunny and quiet location of Kingsford.  It is within walking distance to the university (UNSW), NIDA, hospital (Prince of Wales/Sydney Children's/Royal Hospital for Women), a sports club with facilities including gym and pool (South Juniors) and a diverse range of restaurants to tantalise the taste-buds (along Anzac Parade).  Even better, you will find yourself just a 5 minute drive from Coogee beach and very close to other beautiful beaches of the Eastern Suburbs such as Bronte, Maroubra and Bondi beach.   From this location it is also just one short bus ride to the city, airport, Bondi Junction, Westfield and to tourist attractions such as the Randwick Racecourse
fields.title: Modern, convenient & child friendly

fields.summary: The ocean view from the living area of this 1 bedroom apartment with balcony is just brilliant. Air cond, high-speed internet, 42” TV, and separate bedroom with a queen bed make this the perfect holiday abode. There is an ensuite bathroom and linen and bath towels are provided for your stay.  Cafes and restaurants are just metres from your front doorstep. The full sized modern kitchen also provides the option to eat in and enjoy the view from the dining area or the balcony.  Come and enjoy!
fields.description: The ocean view from the living area of this 1 bedroom apartment with balcony is just brilliant. Air cond, high-speed internet, 42” TV, and separate bedroom with a queen bed make this the perfect holiday abode. There is an ensuite bathroom and linen and bath towels are provided for your stay.  Cafes and restaurants are just metres from your front doorstep. The full sized modern kitchen also provides the option to eat in and enjoy the view from the dining area or the balcony.  Come and enjoy! Being on the top (ninth) floor, the apartment is quiet and offers an ocean facing balcony and the separate bedroom faces the inner harbour and city.  There are 8 stairs leading down from the bedroom to the living area.  Enjoy natural sunlight in both the living area and the bedroom, plus there are beautiful flow-through breezes.  The queen size bed has a luxurious pillow top mattress to ensure the perfect night's sleep, and with ample storage space and a built-in wardrobe, you don't need to live out
fields.notes: Manly’s waterfront is lined with cafes and restaurants where you can enjoy the sea breeze or take a stroll, jog or bike ride along the famous beachfront promenade.  If you need to stay connected while you are away, there is high speed internet available at no charge. If not ... kick back and enjoy the view :-)
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Manly's attractions include:     - 100 metres from the sand ... enjoy the sunrise over the ocean, a morning run or a surf     - Go for a bushwalk ... there are a number of popular scenic walking routes that link the beaches with the national parks     - Learn to surf with Manly Surf School      - Swim with the sharks at Manly Sea Life Sanctuary (formerly Oceanworld Manly)     - Get up close and personal to the migrating whale population     - Take a ferry and visit Sydney’s famous Taronga Park Zoo      - Kayak scenic waterways to secluded beaches     - Rent a bike and ride the dedicated bike track to Fairy Bower, or explore hidden trails on a bike tour with Manly Bike Tours     - Snorkel or scuba the Manly Marine Reserve      - Sail the harbour on a skippered cruise      - Learn to dig, spike and dive with Sydney Beach Volleyball School     - Have a swing at one of the golf courses in the Manly area     - Visit Q station for the spectacular views or book a history, ghost or paranormal
fields.transit: You are only 100 metres to the ferry terminal for a fun trip across Sydney Harbour to Circular Quay and Sydney’s CBD, reaching Sydney attractions such as a vast array of restaurants at Circular Quay, the historic "Rocks" area, the Harbour Bridge or the Opera House in only 15 minutes.
fields.title: Manly Seaside Bliss

fields.summary: Ultra 5 is a two-bedroom, first floor holiday apartment, fully self contained, light filled with a large balcony. Just a few minutes walk to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital, Sydney Uni & King Street's famous foodie strip.  Rail and bus links to the city are but minutes from your front door.
fields.description: Ultra 5 is a two-bedroom, first floor holiday apartment, fully self contained, light filled with a large balcony. Just a few minutes walk to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital, Sydney Uni & King Street's famous foodie strip.  Rail and bus links to the city are but minutes from your front door. This classic Newtown apartment is a two bedroom, first floor unit filled with natural light, fine parquetry flooring, and a large, secluded balcony.  Fully self-contained Unit 5 is a perfect boutique rental suitable for short breaks or extended stays. The apartment offers two bedrooms.  The main bedroom has a king size bed, which can be split to form two king singles and the second bedroom offers a queen size bed.  Quality linen is supplied and beds are of hotel standard and extremely comfortable.  The fully tiled bathroom offers separate shower recess and a bath tub. This fully furnished accommodation includes an open-plan kitchen with lounge and dining area – all fully equipped and tastefully decorat
fields.transit: Rail and bus links to the city are but minutes from your front door.
fields.title: Unit 5, 2 Bedroom Apartment

Big lounge area, super 4K television for those who love Netflix. 2 gardens, bathroom, and access to my 2 cats (not that you could avoid that one if you tried given they ar
fields.notes: Aircon, heating throughout. Two very fluffy but adorable Persian cats on premise so those with allergies need to think twice. But I am constantly vacuuming and have a cleaning lady so it stays clean.

fields.title: Fabulous Beach House

fields.summary: Our recently renovated designer apartment is centrally located in the very fashionable harbourside precinct of Potts Point.  Access to Sydney’s best cafes, restaurants, shops & bars from your doorstep. Once inside, you’ll welcome the peace and quiet of this spacious high-rise apartment and the tranquillity of the sweeping city + harbour view. Stunning furnishings, modern conveniences and walking distance to the CBD make this perfect for a couple on holiday or a business traveller.
fields.description: Our recently renovated designer apartment is centrally located in the very fashionable harbourside precinct of Potts Point.  Access to Sydney’s best cafes, restaurants, shops & bars from your doorstep. Once inside, you’ll welcome the peace and quiet of this spacious high-rise apartment and the tranquillity of the sweeping city + harbour view. Stunning furnishings, modern conveniences and walking distance to the CBD make this perfect for a couple on holiday or a business traveller. Our spacious 1 bedroom apartment is drenched in natural sunlight due to it’s highly desirable North aspect. Inside, it’s very quiet and you’ll never tire of the expansive panoramic views of the CBD, Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the expansive balcony, lounge room, bedroom and even the shower!  With Kings Cross train station just moments away, you can be in the city in 2 minutes, work from the oversized kitchen island, or on a sunny day, on the balcony overlooking trendy Potts Point and beyond. Other ame
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Potts Point has become one of the most desirable places to live around Sydney. The neighbourhood is vibrant and rich with culture and history. It’s situated within Sydney City, just a short 20-minute walk to the CBD. All public transport options (train, bus, taxi and Uber) are in the immediate vicinity. All within easy walking distances...Victoria Street and Macleay Street are full of eateries for all tastes. For those who seek the nightlife, Kings Cross and Darlinghurst Road offer lots of nightclubs, bars and theatres. Or for the more subdued, there are plenty of parks, museums and bayside charm in the neighbouring suburbs of Woolloomooloo, Elizabeth Bay and Darlinghurst close by. Check out the map below for our tips and recommendations.
fields.transit: Kings Cross train station is right beneath you and can take you to Bondi Junction or into the CBD.  Uber is a great choice and taxis are available all around the area and are easy to hail anytime of the day or night. Car rentals are nearby as well as GoGet car sharing which charges by the hour. Within walking distance are many of Sydney’s main tourist attractions including Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Botanical Gardens, Art Gallery of NSW, and Finger Wharf at Woolloomooloo. The area is full of leading cafes and restaurants including Cho Cho San, The Apollo, Billy Kwong, Monopole, Ms G’s, ABC, Acme, and Fratelli Paradiso. Check out the map below for more great recommendations. From the airport, taxis cost about $40-$45 and take about 20 mins. You can also catch the train to Kings Cross station (about $16).
fields.title: Luxury Potts Point apartment w/ Harbour views

fields.summary: Domain is an air conditioned apartment within a security building with a private courtyard garden located in Fitzgerald Street, Newtown just minutes from Sydney University RPA Hospital and King Streets' multi cultural restaurants, cafes,  shops and transport
fields.description: Domain is an air conditioned apartment within a security building with a private courtyard garden located in Fitzgerald Street, Newtown just minutes from Sydney University RPA Hospital and King Streets' multi cultural restaurants, cafes,  shops and transport There is a fully equipped kitchen with cook top oven, microwave and dishwasher. There is a queen size bed, built in robe, flat screen TV and built in DVD. The bathroom has a walk-in shower and fully equipped laundry with washer and dryer, plus undercover clothes line. This studio has its own outdoor space with covered balcony and garden. The apartment and its private outdoor area and use of Newtown Square gardens Private studio apartment within a security building Newtown is a lively area - open until late. There is always a convenience store restaurant or café open to grab last minute supplies or enjoy a meal. The area is relaxed and comfortable and there are plenty of pubs and venues in the area to visit several parks within walk
fields.notes: Access to ADSL2 internet is available at an extra charge and needs to be pre-arranged. We can provide parking at $15 per night  however this is subject to availability and as this facility is shared with another apartment. Please note the garage has a standard roller door with a height restriction of 1.8m. If you have a larger vehicle this space may not be suitable.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Newtown is a lively area - open until late. There is always a convenience store restaurant or café open to grab last minute supplies or enjoy a meal. The area is relaxed and comfortable and there are plenty of pubs and venues in the area to visit several parks within walking distance. Sydney University, RPA Hospital, Brain and Mind Institute, Moore College, Enmore  and Seymour theatres are nearby.
fields.transit: Buses just 5 minute walk away on King Street  and train station 12-15 minute walk from Domain apartment.
fields.title: Your Domain for Two  in Newtown

fields.summary: A quiet location, just a short distance from the vibrant day and night life of Manly. We have buses at the end of Innes Rd to take you to the city of Sydney and beyond. Ferries in Manly can take you across Sydney Harbour with views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. We have parks, beaches, a community garden and native bird life. There is something for everyone here  in Manly Vale.  Please note Queenscliff Beach and Manly is a 15-20 min walk or a shorter 5 min drive away.
fields.description: A quiet location, just a short distance from the vibrant day and night life of Manly. We have buses at the end of Innes Rd to take you to the city of Sydney and beyond. Ferries in Manly can take you across Sydney Harbour with views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. We have parks, beaches, a community garden and native bird life. There is something for everyone here  in Manly Vale.  Please note Queenscliff Beach and Manly is a 15-20 min walk or a shorter 5 min drive away. Manly Vale, close to, but not in the heart of Manly, is very well situated. Only a 15-20 min walk or 5 min drive to Manly's beaches, parks, cafes, bars, shops, golf and more or bus ride, at the top end of our street, to the Sydney CBD and beyond or a ferry ride from Manly with views of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and many harbour beaches. The Self-Contained studio apartment is on the lower level of a house with private entry, kitchen, brand new bathroom, living area with all amenities, very comfortable que
fields.notes: Water is precious please be mindful of water consumption. We realise some guests love to steam up the bathroom, but running water to overflow in the bathroom and beyond could result in plumbing costs. Please note the laundry is a shared space. Washing machine usage once during a short stay to maximum every 3 days for longer stay. Bath towels, hand towels, t-towels, facecloths and bed linen are supplied weekly for long stays.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is very family orientated and has parks, a community garden in our street, as well as 2 large sport fields, an aquatic centre with indoor and outdoor pools, skateboard ramp, children's playground and a golf course. It is close to walks to the Queenscliff Lagoon and beaches, playgrounds, shops, supermarkets and cafes and bars as well as the great night life of Manly just a few minutes away by car or a 15- 20 minute walk.
fields.transit: Drive, cycle, walk or buses with plenty of on street parking if you have a car. There are public buses to the city and further at the end of our street, walking to parks and beaches is easy and very enjoyable with even a public gym to workout on in the Queenscliff Lagoon Park area. We also have bicycles on request. Just ask if they are available and directions to various locations.
fields.title: Manly/Manly Vale: Peaceful Self-Contained Studio

fields.summary: This lovely central one bedroom apartment is SUPER close to the CBD (30 minute walk) and located within the vibrant Surry Hills neighbourhood, we are also lucky to have quiet neighbours!
fields.description: This lovely central one bedroom apartment is SUPER close to the CBD (30 minute walk) and located within the vibrant Surry Hills neighbourhood, we are also lucky to have quiet neighbours! Ideally located at a 5 minute walking distance from Central Station and prince Alfred Park (with a 50 meter outdoor pool - the nicest place to be in summer!), it's also only 30 minutes away from the CBD and the famous opera house. We also have a king size bed, a small balcony, wifi and Netflix on our TV (which you'll have access to - duh!) The unit will be vacated during your entire stay as we will be away on holidays. Note there are a few flights of stairs to access the unit, so this might not be the best place if you have disabilities.  You can use everything in the unit, including groceries such as sugar and flour, and also everything you need in the bathroom, such as shampoo and sunscreen. We won't be there but we will stay in touch via this website or messages. We will leave you two sets of keys i
fields.notes: Note we do not ask for a cleaning fee, so please clean up after yourselves and leave the unit as you found it.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The unit is located within the vibrant Surry Hills neighbourhood, famous for its cafes and restaurants. However our complex is very quiet. We're also 5 minutes away from a big supermarket and liquor store (Coles on Cleveland street).
fields.transit: Central Station is at a walking distance of 5 minutes. From there, you can take buses or trains to basically anywhere in and out of Sydney! We also have buses nearby going straight to Coogee beach and Maroubra Beach.
fields.title: Surry Hills - Huge 1 Bedroom Apartment!

fields.summary: Relax in our beautiful early 1900 renovated Federation House.! You'll feel at ease in this "home away from home". The large double  bedroom has a bathroom next to it. Manly Beach is a 15 min walk away. Free shuttle at the end of  street.

You'll feel at ease in this "home from home".  The leafy suburb of Fairlight is conveniently located. We're a 2 min walk to the City buses, 1 min walk to the free community shuttle that will take you to the heart of Manly. If you prefer,an easy walk will also get you there in 20 min.  From Manly Wharf, it's a scenic 30 min ride by ferry across the Harbour to Sydney.  Manly swimming pool is also within 15 min walking distance, as are free harbour and sea pools.  You'll find great local shopping in Manly, fine dining & casual restaurants, lots of fabulous coffee hangouts.  A multitude of outdoor activities awaits you: amazing coastal and bush walks, kayaking, diving, b

It is located in a handy location, which is close to all public transport. - Main bedroom with Queen size bed and ensuite with shower & deep bath - Second bedroom with 2 single beds - Main bathroom with shower and another deep bath - Decent size study with printer and office supplies, excellent workspace with views of Sydney tower and Rushcutters Bay marina - fully equipped kitchen with everything you need, including essential cooking items - selection of cook books, olive oil, herbs, salt & pepper, tea, coffee, sugar etc. - Separate internal laundry with washing machine and dryer - large balcony with table seating for 4 - dining room with table for 8 - all linen and towels provided - hair dryer, iron and ironing board - free unlimited high speed internet access - local phone with unlimited local calls - underground securi
fields.neighbourhood_overview: - Close to the Sydney Cruising Yacht club - home to the famous Sydney to Hobart yacht race.  Perfect for an afternoon drink or a relaxed bite to eat! - Rushcutters Bay park - also a good cafe for coffee and snacks - convenience store and cafe - 5min walk - walking distance to Potts Point, Darlinghurst & Double Bay
fields.transit: - Bus stop is located directly across the road - approx. 15mins to the centre of Sydney & 10mins to Edgecliff Station and local shops - Ferry stop is Darling Point Wharf - 5min walk, this will take you to Circular Quay, The Rocks & City - 10mins by ferry - from here you can travel to Manly and the Zoo - Train stop is Edgecliff station - approx 20min walk with large shopping centre
fields.title: Light Sydney apt with amazing views

fields.summary: Our comfortable colourful home is on a quiet street in the bustling inner-city neighbourhood of Birchgrove-Balmain. The house is a sunny, relaxed oasis, with restaurants, cafes and shops a stroll away. The nearby bus or ferry will take you to the city, Circular Quay, art galleries and theatres. We are away from the 18th of December until the 18 of January and would like to do a long term rental. We are willing to offer a reduced rate for a long term rental.
fields.description: Our comfortable colourful home is on a quiet street in the bustling inner-city neighbourhood of Birchgrove-Balmain. The house is a sunny, relaxed oasis, with restaurants, cafes and shops a stroll away. The nearby bus or ferry will take you to the city, Circular Quay, art galleries and theatres. We are away from the 18th of December until the 18 of January and would like to do a long term rental. We are willing to offer a reduced rate for a long term rental. Our home is big and comfortable, with a large backyard, including a frangipani tree to read under or climb, a spacious sun-filled veranda to relax on, and a small deck for breakfast and dinner. The house has been decorated with a mix of designer and collectible furnishings, which we hope you will enjoy. There is a flat screen which we only use to watch Apple TV and Netflix and a good stereo. The main bed is king size with a comfortable tempurpedic (memory foam) mattress. The single bed is a latex and wool mattress. And the lounge in
fields.notes: We have a gorgeous Burmese cat called Edith. Our house is an old Balmainer and has an odd layout, with the kitchen coming off the veranda. We find this useful, as people can be up chatting in the kitchen and others can be sleeping peacefully in the bedrooms. There is a piano in the hallway which makes it narrow, but there is an alternative way into the main bedroom and house with luggage which is not narrow. Please see the house plan in the photos section. Our home is charming and comfortable and easy to live in but may not suit people who want the mod cons. There is a good laundry just around the corner.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Our home is a five minute stroll to Balmain, which is known for its bars, restaurants, pubs, cafes, and shopping. There are art and craft markets on the weekend in Balmain and second hand markets in nearby Rozelle (10 minute walk). There is an excellent cafe and a well-stocked convenience store around the corner. Woolworths and About Life (large organic supermarket) are a short drive or ten minute walk away. Birchgrove is one of Sydney's premier locations for viewing the fireworks on New Years Eve. Our home is three minutes away from a waterfront park with great views of the Harbour Bridge. Our home is a good base for the Sydney festival, being a short bus or ferry ride to most main venues. For kids and park lovers, there are many harbour-side parks a short walk away, including Ballast Point Park and Elkington Park with the Dawn Fraser Swimming Baths.
fields.transit: We are very lucky to be one block away from the 441 bus, which takes you to the city, the Art Gallery of New South Wales and the Boy-Charlton swimming pool, and a short walk to 2 ferry wharves, where you can catch a ferry to Circular Quay (the Opera House and the Museum of Modern Art) and Cockatoo Island (well worth a day visit). The ferries go to many other places besides.
fields.title: Charming, comfy, eclectic home in amazing location

fields.summary: A double bedroom in a two bedroom, modern, split level flat is available in Croydon Park.
fields.description: A double bedroom in a two bedroom, modern, split level flat is available in Croydon Park. The available bedroom is a reasonable sized double room, with wardrobe space and a small furnished balcony with pleasant leafy suburban views. There is a flyscreen on the balcony door and a fan provided for a cool nights sleep during summer bookings. Bedding and towels are provided.   The shared bathroom upstairs is fitted with a spa bath and separate shower, I have a hairdryer for guest use. A second toilet is located downstairs off the laundry room.  My large open plan living area is air conditioned and also contains a very effective Rinnai gas heater so a pleasant temperature can be maintained no matter what the outside conditions are.  Off the main living area is a modern kitchen, with dishwasher, gas hob, oven and microwave. You will have full use of a selection of cooking utensils and crockery.  The laundry room contains a modern washing machine and dryer, powder is provided. I also provide
fields.notes: Please do take the time to add a photo, description and several verifications to your profile, it makes a massive difference from a host’s points of view and will make your airbnb experience far easier. We are sharing our homes for the most part so it’s essential to know a little bit about who we are sharing them with!
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Croydon Park itself will cater to most tastes should you not feel like wandering too far for dinner. Adjoining suburbs in the inner west have more to offer so you don't have far to go for a huge amount of local choice.
fields.transit: Access to the city is via trains from either Croydon or Ashfield stations, each approximately 25 minutes walk away, alternatively a bus that goes to Ashfield stops right outside the apartment. You can also get a bus all the way into the city but its pretty slow.
fields.title: Double room in Sydney's inner west

It's super close to cafes, transport & the hustle & bustle of central Bondi.  Perfect for 2 friends, a romantic couple get away or a small family with 1 child.

fields.summary: The cottage is located in our leafy garden, with pool, spa and Cooks River  walking/cycling track at back gate. We are in a quiet neighbourhood and close to public transport to get to Newtown and the city. Marrickville and cafes closeby. There is plenty of free street parking. Bikes available.
fields.description: The cottage is located in our leafy garden, with pool, spa and Cooks River  walking/cycling track at back gate. We are in a quiet neighbourhood and close to public transport to get to Newtown and the city. Marrickville and cafes closeby. There is plenty of free street parking. Bikes available. There is plenty to do when you stay here. You can relax by the pool, stroll or ride along the river, or walk to local cafes, restaurants and bars.  You can view the river from your bed. Glass double doors open to your own table setting under a large shady tree. The cottage is located in a natural garden setting next to a river so is suitable for nature lovers who are happy and relaxed with the outdoors. The cottage is a cosy single room with queen bed that comfortably fits two people. We can accommodate groups of up to 6 as we have two cottages and another large room. We only ever take one booking at a time so the accommodation will be solely for your own use.  The bathroom and shower are attache
fields.notes: You can access the cottage via a separate entrance down the side of the main house or from the river and there is plenty of free street parking.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We are situated on the border between Earlwood and Marrickville in Sydney's eclectic inner west. Both suburbs have a mix of interesting people and this is reflected in the restaurants and food stores of the area, including many great (and affordable) Vietnamese restaurants.  Marrickville is a lively Sydney suburb with a growing number of cafes, wine bars and local music venues.  All the attractions of Sydney - great live entertainment, markets, shopping, national parks, harbour and beaches - are within reach by public transport.
fields.transit: The bus to the city (423 via Newtown) is 5 minutes from our door or train stations (Marrickville, Tempe or Dulwich Hill) are a 15-20 minute walk away. A new light rail service now also runs from Dulwich Hill and will take you to Glebe, the Fish Markets, the Casino, Darling Harbour and Chinatown. You can borrow the bikes to ride along the river to the train and light rail stations or to the local supermarket. The domestic and international airports are a quick 15 minute taxi ride away.

fields.neighbourhood_overview: The house is within walking distance to shops, cafes, restaurants, supermarkets and Sydney harbour ferry. 5 min drive to bondi beach or take the bus from the top of the street. Rose Bay is a Harbourside, eastern suburb of Sydney, in the state of New South Wales, Australia. Rose Bay is located seven kilometres east of the Sydney central business district, in the local government areas of Waverley Municipal Council (east of Old South Head Road) and Woollahra Council (on its western side towards the bay). Rose Bay has views of both the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge together. Lyne Park abuts Sydney Harbour on its west. Shark Island is located in Sydney Harbour, just north of Rose Bay.
fields.transit: Great public transport at end of the street (100 metres) Cafes and supermarket 5 min walk  20 min walk to bondi beach If your feeling adventurous you can catch a seaplane from the local park (Lyne Park) to see all the sights from air.  (URL HIDDEN)

You can also enjoy city views and your own private bbq from the apartment balcony.  At 82 sq meters, the apartment is larger than many 3 bedroom apartments. Brand new renov

Private courtyard + veranda, 2 double bedrooms, brand new designer kitchen and bathroom. Self-contained laundry. Spacious fully-furnished 2 double bedroom apartment with sunny courtyard and veranda in inner Eastern Sydney. The apartment is in a friendly block of six apartments, and is private and quiet. Minutes walk to trendy Five Ways pub and eateries, Rush Cutters Bay harbousrside park, and doors along from Trumper park with beautiful bushland and duck pond, children's play ground and cricket oval. Many art galleries are in the surrounding streets.  Just as close to Edgecliff Centre  -  with the railway station 1 stop to Bondi Junction and Kings Cross, and two stops to the city. The Edgecliff centre has two supermarkets, a bus interchange, cafes, chemists, florists, banks. It's a 20 to twenty-five minute walk to the city. The apartment is spacious and
fields.notes: Trumper park and oval are literally doors along from the apartment and have a children's play area, as well as walks through the park to a secluded duck pond, and access to the tennis and lawn bowling clubs at the top of the park.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Leafy, old suburb of Sydney with Australian heritage architecture, galleries, cafes, restaurants and pubs to enjoy. The proximity to the city and to transport makes it a very convenient base.
fields.transit: Trains and buses minutes from the apartment. Edgecliff station is two stops from the heart of the city or one stop to Bondi Junction. There are also a number of buses that run along New South Head road.

Comfortable accommodation for up to 6 guests. 1 bathroom, a well-equipped kitchen, a living area with pull out dining table and a cozy & sun-lit third bedroom. This apartment is very well-maintained and those who intend on treating it like their own, are welcome! Respect shown t

fields.summary: My 34 sqm studio is quietly tucked away yet in the middle of everything. There are a gazillion cafes/bars/supermarkets right downstairs and weekend markets across the road. A pleasant walk by the water takes you to the art gallery, botanic gardens and opera house.
fields.description: My 34 sqm studio is quietly tucked away yet in the middle of everything. There are a gazillion cafes/bars/supermarkets right downstairs and weekend markets across the road. A pleasant walk by the water takes you to the art gallery, botanic gardens and opera house. The apartment is on the border between the red-light district (home to some hard characters, weekend party-goers and backpackers) and the gentrified part of the neighbourhood (the 'Paris end' of Potts Point). The 1937 building, originally nurses quarters, definitely needs a facelift but retains its period charm. My flat is renovated so feels fresh. The bathroom has been brightly painted since the photos but the shower temperature is tricky to get right so I often took baths living there, and the bath is nice and deep. Nestled between other apartments overlooking the high street and rear laneway, my flat is on the first floor and faces into a lightwell. This means there is no grand vista but also no street noise, and it's temp
fields.notes: I provide instructions on how to treat spills like red wine, coffee etc. as I have a light-coloured rug and couch that I quite like. Taking the rubbish out involves going down a rather dingy back-of-house restaurant passage but you do pop out into the rear laneway where folk in their tortious-shell sunglasses perch on small furniture sipping coffee. The wi-fi provided does the basics but is only 4G, not a landline modem. For higher speed service there are late night places just downstairs - cafes, Kings Cross library and backpacker travel booking spots with free computer use.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: I love the harbour-side walk to the Andrew Boy Charlton swimming pool, across the water from the strangely beautiful naval base. The Saturday food markets have a great vibe (I recommend The Butchers Table stall sandwiches and the Vietnamese salads and pho) and the patisserie right next door does amazing chocolate mousse cake and croissants. If you exit the back door of the building you open it onto a tiny hole-in-the-wall cafe called Room 10 which does excellent, and marvellously convenient, coffee. Bourke Street Bakery has underground seating which is warm in winter and cool in summer. The walk to Beare Park on the water takes you through residential streets with nice art deco architecture and past the historic Elizabeth Bay House, which itself has a lovely public garden across the road - both good spots for a picnic. Rushcutter's Bay is a more expansive park, good for jogging, frizbee, playgrounds etc. For brekky I go to a cafe behind my building called Petrol (terrible name, slow se
fields.transit: FROM THE AIRPORT Shuttle bus - When you exit the airport doors, go all the way to your right, to the shuttle-bus area, and ask for a bus to the corner of Macleay and Orwell Streets, Potts Point - or to the Kings Cross Fountain. You don't need to book. There are a few independent operators of the service and their prices are competitive with the train (around $21 for an adult - don't worry, most train rides cost less!) Train - You need to change to platform 24 at Central Station and continue on to Kings Cross Station - it is then a 3 minute walk.  Taxi - around $60-$70 I believe PUBLIC TRANSPORT FROM THE FLAT Visit the transportnsw website to plan journeys. Buy an opal card with, perhaps, $20 credit from a train station or newsagent. Use this card to tap-on and tap-off train, bus and ferry journeys. Maximum charge is $15/day and $2.50 on Sundays.  The neighborhood is very convenient and central in terms of public transport. Mostly, I would start a journey by catching the train from King

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Right in the heart of funky Newtown. There are hundreds of great bars, restaurants and cafes right at your doorstep. There's also a shopping strip (King St and Enmore Rd) with supermarkets, convenience stores, fashion, homewares and quirky shops. From this location you can walk to 7 theatres. The Cottage located only a short walk from Sydney University and Royal Prince Alfred Hospital. It's also walking distance to the The Carriageworks' arts/theatre centre which is where many Sydney Festival events are held, and on Saturday mornings the 'Eveleigh Farmers Markets' (Sydney’s best gourmet market) are held here selling fresh produce and bread, coffee, flowers, cheeses etc. They also hold an arts/craft market once a month.
fields.transit: Only five minutes walk to Newtown train station. Newtown station (only three stops to Central and the City) is on a direct line into the City and Circular Quay, where you will find the Sydney Opera House, the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the historic The Rocks precinct. It's possible to walk to the southern end of the city and Darling Harbour in about 30 minutes. There are also direct buses at the end of the street that take you to the City, Bondi, Coogee Beach and other areas. It's only about 15 minutes in a taxi to/from the airport (about $35 taxi fare) or take the airport line train to/from central connecting to/from Newtown. Newtown scores 99/100 on walk score and is defined as a "walker's paradise". The area is a walk everywhere lifestyle.
fields.title: 3 bedroom cottage near city

fields.neighbourhood_overview: What better way to spend your time in Sydney than in the inner-west, with some of the best coffee shops, restaurants, markets and cafes that Sydney has to offer - not to mention the iconic Enmore Theatre being just around the corner.  The area is well priced - and well known!  In fact, the gelato shop just one minute away won the most recent 'worlds best gelato' beating Italy! This area is vibrant and welcoming and we love calling it home.
fields.transit: Enmore Rd (the main street) is less than a minutes walk away where you will find several buses (just 50 metres from our door) to take you all over Sydney.  Direct buses run to the city, Surry Hills and Bondi to name a few areas. Newtown train station is a 5 minute walk away and Central station is just 5-8 mins (4km) by train.  A couple more stops from Central will take you to Circular Quay where the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and The Rocks district are located. Parking is available on our street, however it is limited to one hour in the evenings.  Alternatively unrestricted street parking is just a five minute walk away. If you want to simply soak up the inner-west atmosphere, you can see a lot by foot!
fields.title: Big room w/ en-suite in inner city

The 2nd bedroom has a double loft-style bed and the 3rd bedroom a queen bed.There is one open-plan bathroom inside the main home, a 2nd bathroom in the studio and a 3rd outdoor hot "beach shower" plus separate WC. A large open plan living / dining area opens out to the sunny north facing large deck and neat grassy back yard.  Perfect for a summer BBQ! A family friendly home with toys and children's beds, all the cooking essentials, flat screen TV and free wifi access. Three bedrooms with all pillows and linen included: 1 king bed  1 brand new double / queen sofa bed (in 3rd bedroom) 1 set of bunk beds with a trundle bed (= 3 beds) We will be overseas however always contactable via email /sms / (website hidden) We live in one of the most beautiful cities in the world and we'd love to assist
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We live in one of the most beautiful cities in the world and we'd love to assist you to make the most of your stay. Bondi Beach is a short 10 minute stroll from home. You'll pass our favourite organic bakery on the way, as well as trendy cafes and shops. On Saturday's enjoy the local growers markets with fresh food stores and fruit and vegetable vendors, and on Sunday stroll through the famous Bondi Markets to pick up an original gift for yourself or someone you love. Bondi is filled with great bars, cafes and restaurants. The inner-harbour foreshore is a 15-20minute walk to Rose Bay where you can jump on a ferry into the CBD and experience the beauty of Sydney Harbour. A short 10 minute bus ride will take you to one of Sydney's newest shopping centres - Bondi Junction - with groceries, boutiques, and department stores, restaurants, food courts and cinemas. There is also a train from "The Junction" which will take you anywhere in Sydney. Want to know anything else? Please ask :-)
fields.transit: There are several busses close to our home, within a 2-5 minute walk. They take you directly to Bondi Junction shopping precinct / train station, or you can stay on the bus all the way into the City - meandering through lovely suburbs such as Woollahra and Paddington on the way. The train station is a 10 minute bus ride away. The beach is an easy 8-10 minute walk.

fields.summary: Glen Mervyn was built in the first few years of the 20th Century. This grand terrace has high ceilings, generous rooms, four fireplaces, formal lounge and dining rooms and a modern extension that includes indoor/outdoor living and dining. Three large bedrooms and two bathrooms will comfortably accommodate six people. It is located a few minutes walk from Bondi Junction station in a quiet residential street.

This grand terrace has high ceilings, generous rooms, four fireplaces, formal lounge and dining rooms and a modern extension that includes indoor/outdoor living and dining. Three large bedrooms and two bathrooms will comfortably accommodate six people. It is located a few minutes walk from Bondi Junction station in a quiet residential street. Bondi Junction is the hub of Sydney's Eastern Suburbs.  Great shops.  Major train and bus interchange. Close to Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee beaches. Our home is only a few minutes walk to the centre of Bondi Junction, but is in a charming 19th Century streetscape.  Eastern Sydney at its best! The entire house is yours to enjoy.  This is our home, not a sterile rental. It is equipped with everything you'll need at a very high standard, including a gas BBQ and wifi. Our adult daughter lives nearby and will welcome you and handle any questions or problems. Denison St is three bl
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Denison St is three blocks from Centennial Park, hundreds of acres of lakes, paths, bike tracks, gardens and open space.  It is also three blocks from Bondi Junction interchange, where the buses and trains intersect right next to a great pedestrian mall and the enormous Westfield shopping centre.  In between are great pubs, cheap eats, lots of services and Australia's biggest municipal library. Turn right and you're headed to the urban buzz.  Turn left and you'll see people riding horses and hear the kookaburras and cockatoos.  You choose.
fields.transit: Bondi Junction is one of Sydney's transport hubs.  Trains run to and from the city every few minutes.  Buses connect to Bondi, Bronte, Tamarama, Clovelly and Coogee beaches. The nearest bus stop is about 200 metres away on Oxford Street.

I enjoy warm lively conversation over a glass of wine or a cup of morning coffee and love hearing about the day's adventures as Sydney is explored! I don't intrude past hello if you don't look like you want to chat. Often I'm just running out the door, running late to the next thing. We have ADSL2+ wifi internet access. fields.notes: Come and stay in wonderful Petersham! This amazing and large terrace house is located only minutes from the train and buses that will have you in the heart of the city within 15 minutes.  The room is a extremely large and sunny queen size room, located on the first floor of a renovated terrace overlooking the street. You will have a private and relaxed stay. The room is perfect for a couple or single and is easily accessible to the shared bathroom. We are very close to public transport (and even a pub next door) but it is quiet and relaxed so no need to worry about noisy trains waking you up at night!). We are a short walk away from Leichhardt which is Sydney's amazing Italian dinning and entertainment precinct. On the other side of the railway line is Petersham's famous Portuguese dining strip. Glebe, Balmain and Rozelle markets are a short bus trip away. This is a lovely and safe area to walk around at any time of day or night. The streets are quintessentially Sydney with a real mix

fields.notes: Lulu and Smoochie (the cats) have the run of the house excluding guest bedrooms. Lulu spends a lot of time over at the neighbours. She is very sweet, a bit of a chatterbox however she does not liked to be picked up.  She will sometimes try and curl up with you in bed or on the couch if you put a pillow down for her. Please shut the bedroom door if you are not comfortable with her being on the bed. Smoochie is very affectionate but shy.  She does not like loud noise.  She loves a scratch under the chin.   Two barred windows are left ajar for them to enter and exit the house.

fields.summary: Be our guest and enjoy the unique Manly beach vibe which makes this place so special. Our sunny flat with 2 bedrooms offers everything you need and we are looking forward to share our lovely home with you to make your Sydney visit a memorable experience.
fields.description: Be our guest and enjoy the unique Manly beach vibe which makes this place so special. Our sunny flat with 2 bedrooms offers everything you need and we are looking forward to share our lovely home with you to make your Sydney visit a memorable experience. Welcome to Manly, Be our guest and enjoy the unique Manly beach vibe which makes this place so special. Our sunny room offers everything you need and we are looking forward to share our lovely home with you to make your Sydney visit a memorable experience.   Our home is your home:  You will have a fully furnished room with a double bed, wardrobe and desk. We provide fresh sheets and towels. Our home has a big open-space livingroom area and a sunny balcony which you are welcome to enjoy and share with us. Feel free to use our kitchen and washing machine/dryer. Location:  We live in a quiet neighbourhood and are just a couple of minutes walk away from the beach and the center of Manly with a blast of nice coffee places, restaurants, bars
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We live in a quiet neighbourhood, only a minutes walk away from the beach and the center of Manly with a blast of nice coffee shops, restaurants, bars and stores. Things to do:  Manly offers everything for a good holiday experience. At the beach you can swim, surf, snorkel or sunbath. There are beautiful walking trecks in the North Head National Park and along the Beaches to the North.
fields.transit: Public transport and ferries will take you to Sydney downtown within 20min or up north to even more beautiful beaches.

fields.neighbourhood_overview: - Bronte is an amazing sea side suburb with one of Sydney's best beaches - Short 5 minute walk to the Bronte beach through rainforest gully, and famous coastal walks to Bondi and Coogee -Beach living, but with access to downtown Sydney in approx 20 minutes on public transport. A continental breakfast is included. Your large room is fashionably decorated with a double bed, desk and wardrobe and lounge chair. It is air conditioned and next door to a full bathroom.  There is a heated inground swimming pool on a lower level, which is completely private. The wonderful thing about the proximity of this property is that it is a 5 minute walk to some of the best shopping in Sydney. The choice of restaurants are endless, not to mention some great Boutique Pubs. We have wonderful foreshore walks, which you will enjoy.  They cover an extensive shoreline, an experience you will remember forever.    You'll have access to our lounge, gourmet kitchen, alfresco outside dining and BBQ area. Make use of our WiFi and laundry.

fields.description: Beautiful house in a quiet street just 9 klms from the Sydney CBD. Close to public transport routes, shops and the Cooks River. Renovated house with large kitchen and living area and sunny backyard. You'll feel at home here.  The city is a short 20 min train ride away (Hurlstone Park stn) and Newtown is a 10-15 min bus ride. The bus stop is 5 mins walk and the train about 8 minutes walk. It is a big double room, very light and breezy with 3 windows with blinds for privacy and sleep. The floors are polished boards, there is hanging and drawer space and a very comfortable queen size bed. There is space in the pantry for your food if you want to cook and great cafes and restaurants within walking distance. A 10-15 minute bus ride (or drive) takes you to Newtown, where there are abundant restaurants, cafes, bars, pubs, music and people. Hi, I am Rohan's flatmate, and this is my room. I will be staying not too far away during this period, Rohan will be here and there is one other person (gu

fields.summary: Our cosy 2 bedroom apartment in Rose Bay is walking distance to shops, transport, Bondi Beach, Rose Bay wharf and more..
fields.description: Our cosy 2 bedroom apartment in Rose Bay is walking distance to shops, transport, Bondi Beach, Rose Bay wharf and more.. Hello! Our bright large north- facing two bedrooms apartment is located in the exclusive suburb Rose Bay, 20-25 minutes walk to Sydney's famous Bondi Beach. Our fully furnished apartment is perfect for short stay accomodation in Sydney, offering all the comfort that you need to make it feel like home.. Perfect for couples or families, it is 1 of 3 units sharing the front entrance of the building with sunlight coming in from sunrise to sunset.  The main bedroom is bright,  fully furnished with an old style wardrobe, queen size bed, chest of drawers and a bedside table. The second bedroom has 2  King Single beds and cot or toddler bed if required. The chest of drawers works as a changing table too.  The double- entry kitchen is fully equipped for cooking lovers and connects the dinning room with a vibrant living room that exits to a good sized balcony.  The bathroom ha
fields.notes: We have a cot available if you are travelling with a baby.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Rose Bay is a peacefull neighbourhood located on the border of North Bondi. We love walking around the suburb, going to the Shops in Rose Bay, taking the ferry to the city and walking to Bondi Beach day and night.
fields.transit: The bust top is just around the corner, with buses that go every 10 minutes to Bondi Junction. There is a bus that goes to the city 900 metres from home. We love walking 15 minutes to the Rose Bay wharf to take a 10 minutes ferry to Circular Quay in the city. Direct buses to the city are 10 min walking from home. There is off street parking for free.
fields.title: Sunny 2B apart. near Bondi Beach

fields.summary: Cosy and bright apartment separate from rest of house.  Privacy, security, own entrance, free on-street parking. Close to harbour and ferries. Wonderful walks.  On business? - quick commute to CBD by ferry.  Check out our reviews for the views of previous guests. INTERESTED IN A LONG-TERM STAY?  ASK FOR A SUPER-DUPER RATE (AFTER FEBRUARY).
fields.description: Cosy and bright apartment separate from rest of house.  Privacy, security, own entrance, free on-street parking. Close to harbour and ferries. Wonderful walks.  On business? - quick commute to CBD by ferry.  Check out our reviews for the views of previous guests. INTERESTED IN A LONG-TERM STAY?  ASK FOR A SUPER-DUPER RATE (AFTER FEBRUARY). The spacious 4-room apartment (57 sq m) comprises bedroom, lounge, bathroom and utility room. There is a second toilet just outside the apartment. Enjoy free wifi internet access and TV. Power point adapter available for overseas visitors.  The house is nearly 100 years old and listed by the National Trust.  It is set in a large landscaped block with a private garden off the apartment. We provide supplies to get you started - cereal, muesli, eggs, milk, bread, juice, tea/coffee, biscuits, fruit, butter and jam. Linen changed weekly for longer stays. The suite has private entrances to both the bedroom and lounge from a private garden which is for the
fields.notes: Maximum two guests.  The apartment is really not suitable for children or for those with mobility challenges. Please note that the apartment does not have a full kitchen  (no stove).  Cafes/restaurants are walking distance and Menulog lists many restaurants that home deliver. The apartment is connected to the central air-conditioning but it cannot be controlled from the apartment. There is a new AC in the bedroom and thermostatically controlled electric heaters in the lounge.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Blue ribbon street in Sydney. Cremorne Point harbour-side walk around the corner (with harbour swimming pool). Ten minute walk to ferries. Ferry runs half-hourly and just 2 stops to the city. Plenty of space and security. Unrestricted on-street parking readily available.  Shops, restaurants, banks, cinema, etc. on Military Road is about a 15 minute walk but uphill.  A few shops including convenience store, two restaurants, daytime café (Thelma and Louise - try it for a coffee or breakfast overlooking the water) and a hairdresser are at Neutral Bay wharf.
fields.transit: The ferry into the city is nearby (wharves at Kurraba Point, Neutral Bay).  The bus stops a short walk away.  From the airport options are (a) take a taxi; (b) take the train to Circular Quay and ferry to Neutral Bay if you have little luggage as it is a 10 minute walk or (c) take the train to Central, change to the North Shore line and take the train to Milsons Pt station where there is a taxi rank. We advise guests to buy Opal cards to enable ticket-less (and cheaper) travel on public transport with daily and weekly caps on fares.

This two story, two bedroom historic terrace home with an amazing outdoor patio sanctuary, updated kitchen and bathroom, gives quick access to all of Sydney's culture within walking distance to Central Station. Guests have access to: * washer/dryer * TV, xbox, apple tv, wireless internet  * gourmet kitchen * beach stuff - surf board, snorkel gear, boogie board etc * bed linen and towels We will greet you upon arrival, and we would then like to visit one day during your stay. fields.neighbourhood_overview: Great quiet, wide street. Great neighbours. Great local food. A quick walk to the famous Iggy's bakery regarded by many as the best in Sydney. A few doors down is fantastic restaurant Three Blue Ducks. Get there early on a weekend for one of the best breakfasts you'll find anywhere. The dinner menu is also fantastic. Whilst the immediate beaches are nice and close it is a pleasant walk all the way up the coast to Bondi Beach via Bronte, Tamarama and Mackenzies Bay. Walking south via Clovelly and Gordon's Bay it's easy to get to Coogee surf beach.
fields.transit: The closest beaches (Bronte or Clovelly) are a 7 minute walk in either direction. Getting into the city is easy. Transport is only 2 streets away. Regular buses run down McPherson Street to the city, passing Bondi Junction for convenient shopping, or transfer to the trains. A local taxi rank outside the RSL ensures that there is always a cab close by.

Near transport, shops, cafes, everything! Feel the sea breeze and listen to the sounds of the ocean from this summery beach pad. Ocean glimpses and glorious sunrises can be seen from the sunroom so you can check if the surf's up before you run down to jump in the water. Cafes with great coffee and breakfast 30 seconds from the front door. Fully renovated, this is a beautiful apartment from where you can make the most of one of the world's most sought after locations. Modern fully equipped kitchen with entertaining space and Bondi Beach on your doorstep. Washer/dryer, linen, towels, TV, WIFI provided. The space is entirely yours for the duration of your stay. fields.description: Ripples is a lovely, modern one bedroom garden flat situated between Avalon and Whale Beach. Perfectly suited fork two people, this charming and comfortable flat is fully self contained.  There is  a small living/dining/kitchen area and the kitchen is equipped with microwave, gas stove and all essential utilities. The bedroom has a double bed with plenty of shelving and space for clothes.  There is a small bathroom with shower and a small deck.   Included in your stay are the staples - good tea and coffee and other basics. Close to some of the most beautiful beaches and close to the beautiful waters of Pittwater.   Ripples is a 15 minute walk to Avalon, which has a lovely village atmosphere and great cafes. A five minute drive and you could be eating at The Boathouse, Jonah's or Barrenjoey House -all sensational restaurants at Palm Beach. The garden flat is at the front of our house, but with totally separate entrance.

fields.description: Architecturally renovated quirky 3 bedroom terrace in the heart of vibrant Surry Hills. Walking distance to Central Station and the city. All the best restaurants, cafes, bars, art galleries and parks just around the corner. We are LGBTQI friendly. This unique terrace house is situated right in the heart of vibrant Surry Hills. It is a big house with quirky features which has been architectually renovated. There are 3 good size bedrooms. The master or largest bedroom has 1 queen bed, the middle bedroom has 1 double bed and the back room has 1 queen bed. There is an upstairs bathroom/shower with toilet and another toilet hidden under the stairs. All rooms have clothes racks and drawers for your personal use. The double lounge/living area has a large modular lounge and OLED TV with Wii, Netflix, Stan and Foxtel. There is also a good sound system and large private music collection.  The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans, atomic coffee machine, blender, Global chopping knives, gas
fields.notes: There is a strict no party policy at our home.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Surry Hills is one of Sydney's most artistic and vibrant neighbourhoods, located just minutes from the City and Chinatown. Explore art galleries, boutiques and bars. There is a thriving mix of cafes, restaurants and pubs. Find a gem at Surry Hills markets, the first Saturday of every month, at Shannon Reserve on Crown St. Catch a play at Belvoir Street Theatre just around the corner. Jump on a bus and be at the beach within 15-20 minutes or walk down to Prince Alfred Park pool within 5 minutes. Close to major Universities like Sydney Uni, UTS and The University of NSW, as well as key hospitals such as Sydney Hospital, Royal Prince Alfred and The Royal Hospital for Women. The convenience to everything, the choices are endless and the proximity to a hub of cultural delights is why we love living where we do.
fields.transit: It is very easy to get to, from and around Surry Hills. From the airport it is 20 minutes by taxi or take the train to Central Station and walk 5 minutes up the hill. Jump on a bus and be at the beach within 20 -30 minutes. Walk 30 mins to the city & Art Gallery of New South Wales, 35 mins to Circular Quay, ferries, Opera House, and Museum of Contemporary Art. If you can't walk it, there are trains, light rail, buses and cabs a plenty which go to/from the city, our beautiful beaches and other sites.
fields.title: Unique sunny terrace in Surry Hills

Kareela Golf & Kirrawee Bowling clubs are walking distance as are Hazelhurst regional art gallery and  numerous cafes ,delicious bakeries, and restaurants . Cronulla beach and  its seaside atmosphere mall, Miranda Westfield(one of the largest if you like shopping!) are a short drive, or can be accessed by public transport.   However our spot is peaceful and quiet, ideal if you are visiting family or friends locally. We have native animal visitors (possums and many birds) and a friendly Burmese cat sometimes.
fields.transit: Easy to find by car-only one minute off the main(Princes) highway.3 train stations are a flat 20-30 minute walk. Gymea, Kirawee, Sutherland- or a 5-10 min ride in a taxi to us from one of these stations,there is also a local bus service

The Council must sight your hire-car agreement, ( I will take it to them,) and US$40 cash payment is required.  If it is me who is welcoming you, (true in most cases,) I can go to the council and acquire a permit within the hour if it is a week-day.  I am happy to do this.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Bondi Beach is a vibrant precinct where scores of different languages can be heard on the beach, on streets, in shops and restaurants.  Choice of cafes, restaurants and bars is overwhelming, and it will not take long for you to find your favourites. The Coastal Walk, from Bondi Beach to Bronte Beach and back is a world-class attraction - showcasing our glorious Australian coastline. You are also a 5 minute bus-ride, or 20 minute-walk from Bondi Junction, and the Westfield complex, for an array of stylish shopping.
fields.transit: It's an easy trip into the CBD by Bus - either to Central Railway, (trains to anywhere,) or to Circular Quay, (ferries to anywhere).

fields.summary: This sandstone cottage is one of the original cottages on Mackerel Beach. Set on the absolute beach front, North East facing and receiving sun all day long, this gorgeous property has a main house and separate studio with 3 bedrooms comfortably accommodating 8 people. It is just 10 metres from the water and 60 minutes from Sydney CBD.
fields.description: This sandstone cottage is one of the original cottages on Mackerel Beach. Set on the absolute beach front, North East facing and receiving sun all day long, this gorgeous property has a main house and separate studio with 3 bedrooms comfortably accommodating 8 people. It is just 10 metres from the water and 60 minutes from Sydney CBD. The house has a prime beach front location and is situated on a double section enjoying uninterrupted views of the Pittwater, Lion Island, Barrenjoey Heads and Palm Beach. The main bedroom is the house has a queen size bed and large window that looks out over Pittwater - you go to sleep listening to the waves of the ocean and wake up to the most spectacular sunrises over Barrenjoey Heads. There is also a bunk room with 2 sets of bunks which is perfect for the kids (and even the adults). The Tree House, which is a separate studio from the main house, has a queen bed, single bed, its own bathroom and sliding doors onto a private balcony. The house is perfec
fields.notes: There are no shops on Mackerel Beach so you will need to bring up your own food and beverages. As noted above, there are pantry goods like oils, condiments, salt, pepper, tea and coffee which you are welcome to use.  All sheets and bath towels are provided for your stay.  Unfortunately no cats are to be bought onto Mackerel Beach and if you wish to bring your dog, it must be secured within the property on a lead at ALL times. The dog can be exercised off lead on the Northern end of the beach before 9am and after 5pm.  The house is run off water tanks, so it would be great if you can use the water sparingly. We would appreciate you using the black tub in the sink to rinse your dishes and then throwing it on the plants when it gets full.
fields.transit: You will need to catch the ferry or book a water taxi/ barge in order to get across to Mackerel Beach.  The ferry leaves on the hour from Palm Beach Wharf on Barrenjoey Rd, returning on the half an hour from Mackerel. Check the timetable as the occasional ferry goes direct to Mackerel, rather than via Coasters, the Basin etc...  To order a water taxi call the number listed in the information sheet that we will send to you. Bookings are essential ahead of time. You will want to bring your walking shoes as there are some divine bush walks through the national park and down the valley.
fields.title: Sandstone Cottage, Great Mackerel Beach

fields.description: EASTER WEEKEND SPECIAL! 4 nights for $799 + AirBNB & cleaning fees. Shoot through a booking enquiry for the deal.  In quiet, leafy Annandale my bright & modern art-filled house is only 3kms to the Sydney CBD & all of inner Sydney's spectacular offerings. Welcome to my home in the heart of Sydney's Inner West - Annandale - which has recently tied Sydney's fifth most liveable suburb in the Urban Living Index. The house is located in quiet, leafy Annandale, 3kms to the Sydney CBD - convenient to all the amazing restaurants, shopping areas and entertainment & cultural centres Sydney's Inner West has to offer.  Everything you will need for a weekend, week or month of Sydney living is provided, including a fully stocked kitchen with dishwasher, secure parking, high speed wireless broadband and all the entertainment options you might need.  There is a large home-office area with ergonomic chair if you happen to be travelling on business.  The house is a free-standing, modern double brick hous
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Annnandale is close to Sydney's central business district, yet is also a quiet and leafy oasis in the heart of the Inner West. A quick walk up the lane takes you to restaurants, wine bars, cafes, supermarkets, bottle shops, pubs and shopping options. Five minutes in the other direction and you will arrive at a beautiful waterside park featuring views of the Harbour and Anzac Bridges. The park offers great views of Sydney's famous fireworks displays, without having to head in to the CBD. A visit to the Tramsheds is a must - it's a 10 minute walk from the house and offers a variety of gourmet dining options, a supermarket, bottleshops and a variety of other services. Newtown, Glebe, Leichhardt, Balmain and many other iconic Sydney suburbs, known for great food, shopping and culture, are all within easy walking and/or public transport distance.
fields.transit: Annandale is well serviced by public transport - the 470 bus is very regular and gets you in to the CBD in 30 minutes tops. The 370 takes travellers to Coogee Beach via Newtown, the University of NSW and other interesting suburbs. The light rail is another way to travel quickly and easily in to the CBD. The nearest stop (Jubilee Park) is a five minute walk away.
fields.title: Bright, modern house in Annandale
