fields.summary: Stay in one of Sydney's best kept secret locations, right on Paradise Beach. Overlooking beautiful Pittwater, this lovely Northern Beaches cottage, The Paradise Beach House, is only 1 hour from the harbourside city of Sydney and International Airport.
fields.description: Stay in one of Sydney's best kept secret locations, right on Paradise Beach. Overlooking beautiful Pittwater, this lovely Northern Beaches cottage, The Paradise Beach House, is only 1 hour from the harbourside city of Sydney and International Airport. AVALON: Nestled in the quaint coastal town of Avalon, The Paradise Beach House offers the best of both world's. The Northern Beaches of Sydney are a unique place, where ocean surf beaches meet the calm waterways of Pittwater. Measuring a mere 1km across in most places, the Peninsular is a haven for watersports and recreational pursuits. The quiet towns of Avalon, Whale Beach and Palm Beach are high on the 'to-do' list for weekenders when this sleepy out-reach becomes a colourful playground for locals and visitors alike. THE HOUSE: The house itself is an original, single storey, early 1900's fishing cottage at the foot of the hills right on beautiful Paradise Beach. The vista from every room is spectacular. Uninterrupted views of stunning
fields.notes: Due to the hidden location of Paradise Beach, Mobile and 4G coverage is limited and unreliable.  Unlimited WI-FI is available for an additional charge of $7.00 per day. This fee is included in the quoted tariff.  If you do not require Wi-Fi access, please mention this in your booking request and the amount will be deducted from your total.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Paradise Beach is quiet and secluded. It is not signposted and is not populated by tourists or day trippers.  Only the true locals know it exists, so it is never busy.  Located on the Eastern shores of Pittwater, facing West across the water to the Beautiful green hills of Ku-ring-gai Chase National Park and the setting sun.  Paradise Beach offers flat, tidal, salt water with no rough waves or dangerous rips.  White sandy beaches.  A netted swimming enclosure and all day sun.   The perfect beach for families with small children. Relax knowing you and your children can swim and play in safety without rough water or overcrowded pools.
fields.transit: Avalon is located on the Pittwater Peninsular, on Sydney's Northern beaches. It is a simple 1 hour bus trip into the Sydney CBD and multiple buses run every few minutes. Avalon Village is a 20 minute walk from the house and is the perfect distance if you are into your exercise. Clareville Beach is approx. 10-15min walk and is a very scenic route with views over Pittwater along the stunning streets.
fields.title: Absolute Beachfront in Avalon

Third bedroom: downstairs, with double bed and desk with computer.  Living/dining: the apartment has a beautifully appointed bright and sunny open plan living and dining area. Kitchen: fully stocked, with Nespresso machine and gas stove.  Bathroom: in addition to the master bedroom's ensuite, there is a bathroom downstairs with a shower over bath.  Air conditioning: there are AC units in both upstairs bedrooms which also cool the living area.  Laundry: a washing machine and dryer are available for you
fields.notes: Parents: please do not leave young children unattended downstairs, as the windows in the living area, bathroom and bedroom swing open and there is a risk they could climb out and fall. There are safety latches on the ones above the sofa.  Please note it is a two-storey apartment is on the second floor. There are stairs to the front entrance and internal stairs.  Occasionally ants do visit the bathrooms during the night - they are completely harmless and disappear in the morning.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Bondi is one of the great beachside neighbourhoods of the world and our place is in the heart of the action. You’ll be 10 minutes walk from superb swimming and surfing, great walks along the coast, playgrounds and excellent people watching. Take a picnic or BBQ by the beach. Sample Australia’s famous brunch culture at cafes like Porch and Parlour, Bill’s or Lox Stock & Barrel. Browse the boutique stores on Gould Street and find your favourite flavour at Gelato Messina on Hall Street. Our big and bright apartment will make a comfortable base for you to explore Bondi and beyond and we’re looking forward to helping you wind down and enjoy the area like locals do.
fields.transit: Our place is an flat 10 minute walk to the beach, cafes and shops. You’re welcome to use our bike too - it’s a two minute cycle to the beach. Bondi Junction is the nearest train station, and from there it’s a 10-20 minute bus ride to our place in Bondi Beach. We have no off-street parking, and parking on our street is limited to two hours, but there is untimed parking on Warners Avenue and in adjoining streets that we can direct you to. If you're coming from the airport, you can buy an Opal card and catch a train to Central Station, then change to a train to Bondi Junction ($18.50, about 30 minutes). From there you can either catch the 389 bus (about $3, 15 minutes) or taxi (about $20, 10 minutes) to our place. A taxi from the airport will take around 30 minutes and cost about $60.
fields.title: Bright and spacious apartment at Bondi Beach

fields.summary: Exclusive Sydney harbour location. One bedroom + study, sun-filled modern apartment. Panoramic views of Sydney harbour.  Luxury king size bed. Full equipped kitchen. Walk across road to secluded Lady Martins beach. Short walk to public transport
fields.description: Exclusive Sydney harbour location. One bedroom + study, sun-filled modern apartment. Panoramic views of Sydney harbour.  Luxury king size bed. Full equipped kitchen. Walk across road to secluded Lady Martins beach. Short walk to public transport The modern apartment is situated in a quiet residential street, overlooking Sydney harbour. There is plenty of free on-street parking right in front of the apartment. Light and spacious. Bath tub, separate shower. Coastal breeze. Fully equipped kitchen. Gas stove top. Dishwasher. Microwave. Juicer. Blender. Free unlimited wi-fi. Piano. Freshly painted. New carpet. New couch. New bed. Washing machine and dryer located downstairs in common laundry, clothes line also located downstairs. Public transport is a short stroll away. Catch the bus ( (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ) to the city, or to Watson's Bay. The closest bus stop is 600 metres away.  The Sydney Explorer sight-seeing bus also stops there, allowing you to explore Bondi, or the city.
fields.title: Spacious w panoramic harbour views.

fields.description: Charming art deco apartment just two blocks from Bondi Beach, in chilled North Bondi. A spacious, comfortable one bedder on a quiet street, decorated with a stylish mid-century vibe, with vintage pieces by the likes of Pilastro, Nils Johnson and Svend Langkilde.  A spacious and character laden apartment - wooden floorboards, high ceilings with beautiful ceiling roses, stylishly furnished with a mid-century aesthetic and quality vintage pieces as well as artwork.  The kitchen is decked out with a dishwasher, washing machine and large fridge you can use. There's a queen-sized bed and the apartment accommodates two comfortably. Plus the location really rocks! Aesop products are provided in the bathroom and kitchen. The apartment is my home, and you'll find it perfect for a Bondi visit. This apartment is on a quiet residential street in a small block of 8, in a character-filled art deco building. The beach is just two blocks away, so an easy stroll for a surf, swim or to visit the Bondi sh
fields.notes: Oodles of restaurants, cafes, bars, bus stop and the beach just minutes walk away. Submerge yourself in the amazing Bondi lifestyle!
fields.neighbourhood_overview: North Bondi is delightfully quieter than other parts of Bondi, but just a super short walk to all the action. There are a great set of restaurants and bars up the top end of the street, as well as a 9 hole golf course and North Bondi RSL. Every weekend on either Saturday or Sunday the Bondi Markets/Farmers Markets are held just two blocks away at the primary school.
fields.transit: There's no permanent parking (which goes for most apartment blocks in the Bondi area), but there is paid parking two blocks away on Campbell Parade if you need it. The bus stop for heading into Bondi Junction for the train, or continuing into the city is just two minutes walk away on Campbell Parade. Super easy. Three buses operate on this route which starts nearby, so you'll always get a seat and there are plenty of buses coming along - #380, #381 and #333, the latter being pre-pay only. Taxis/Ubers are generally pretty quick to arrive if you call for one too. From the airport take the train into Central station and switch to the Eastern suburbs train to Bondi Junction on Platform 24. Then take the bus (380, 381 or 333) to Campbell Parade and get off at the stop in front of the Primary School, one stop after the Hungry Jacks stop. The stop (No. 23) is on the bend in the road. Then it's just a two block walk up the rise past Camilla's store and head across the road from the Ambulance s
fields.title: Mid-century styled 1BD - 2 min walk to beach

fields.summary: Location, location, location! It doesn't get much better than this. Enjoy ocean views throughout the apartment &be footsteps away from Shelly Beach and Manly Beach. It feels like being on holiday every day of the year. Long stay special for 1 week+
fields.description: Location, location, location! It doesn't get much better than this. Enjoy ocean views throughout the apartment &be footsteps away from Shelly Beach and Manly Beach. It feels like being on holiday every day of the year. Long stay special for 1 week+ WHAT'S THE APARTMENT LIKE? There's three bedrooms in the apartment, one of which is available for Airbnb. The apartment has great beach views – nice to wake up to! Your room comes with a super comfortable Queen size bed with memory foam mattress. It also has a desk and comfortable desk chair for you to work at, mirrors, and a TV with Apple TV and DVD player that you can use. Watching TV in bed :) Pictures of the bedroom itself still to come in the next few days, sorry, only just put this ad up. The apartment also features a very spacious bathroom, marble tiles, with separate bathtub and walk in shower. A very spacious living and dining area with the world’s comfiest couch, large plasma TV, lots of DVDs, and a spacious kitchen with dishwasher
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The neighbourhood is easily the nicest and best location in Manly – we’re only footsteps away from the Manly – Shelly Beach walk, you can go for a run, swim, surf, snorkel or kayak in the morning, have coffee on the beachfront (lots of cute little cafes), and are only minutes away from bars / restaurants like Manly Wine or Havana Beach. Our neighbourhood (Bower Street/Fairy Bower) is absolutely lovely. We're only steps away from the main beach in Manly and some of the nicest cafés and restaurants, as well as right above the Manly to Shelly waterfront beach walk, which is one of my favourite activities in the mornings. Walk a little further, and you're right at the North Head National Park, full of amazing walks and fantastic view points.  Every morning, you can watch surfers and ocean swimmers at Fairy Bower, a great surf spot. The marine reserve just below is a wonderful spot for diving and snorkeling or stand up paddle boarding.  The neighbourhood is also a very friendly and safe one
fields.transit: Transport is super convenient. Don't be fooled by the location on the map - manly is very easily accessible by ferry (between 18 and 30 minutes fast/slow ferry) directly from circular quay (the opera house and harbour bridge). This is actually one of the most scenic ferry rides ever, I recommend it to all visitors!  Getting here from the airport is easy too: hop on the airport link (train) to circular quay, then catch a ferry. From the ferry, it's a nice 8-10 minute walk to our building. Furthermore, within Manly, there's a free hop on hop off bus taking you around. The bus stop is just around the corner!
fields.title: Gorgeous Room in funky Beach Pad - On Special!

fields.summary: Stylish cottage with three double bedrooms each with their own bathroom. Located on a quiet street with a ten minute walk to the Avalon village and beach.
fields.description: Stylish cottage with three double bedrooms each with their own bathroom. Located on a quiet street with a ten minute walk to the Avalon village and beach.    Contemporary open plan three bedroom house overlooking Avalon golf course & the ocean beyond. Experience serenity & privacy with expansive views over the Avalon golf course & Pacific ocean beyond.  This charming two storey cottage style house extends into a contemporary open plan design. The house has a flat access with a carport that can accommodate two vehicles. The front & rear gardens are fully fenced and suitable for pets.  GROUND FLOOR LEVEL: There are two living rooms separated by an open plan kitchen; the 'cook' can interact with friends & family in both areas while also enjoying a beautiful view of lush green scenery overlooking the Avalon golf course.  The East facing living room has two separate decks - one with an eight seater alfresco dining setting, a gas BBQ & shade awning. The  second deck has a four seater alfresc
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Views from two decks to the Avalon golf cluband the distance ocean.
fields.transit: The L90 bus into Sydney CBD is a short walk from the the house.
fields.title: Avalon Haven

fields.summary: A family friendly home located a few minutes walk to Bronte Beach.
fields.description: A family friendly home located a few minutes walk to Bronte Beach. This 1880s Victorian house has four big bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, formal living & dining rooms, an entertainers open-plan kitchen and a children's rumpus room which is adjacent to a large family living area that flows onto a private level garden. The single-level home has large rooms with 14 foot ceilings. Features include  - The kitchen / family area has bi fold doors which open up to a level backyard (partially paved and partially grassed) Table, chairs and a gas BBQ are perfect for alfresco dining.  - The grassy backyard features a children's cubby house and toys for playing. - A newly built modern kitchen has gas stove, oven, Nespresso coffee machine, microwave, and dishwasher. - Off the kitchen is a children's playroom where you will find the 3rd bathroom and laundry with washer and dryer. - The kitchen / family space features a large flat screen tv with Foxtel and Apple TV.  - Bus stop 5 mins away.  - Lovely Bronte B
fields.neighbourhood_overview: We are close to local shops (Charing Cross and Bondi Junction), the beach and public transport. It's a great  neighbourhood and a great spot to use as a base to explore Sydney.
fields.transit: Public transport is around the corner. There is both on and off street parking available.
fields.title: 4 bed luxury family home near Bronte beach

Offers charming and eclectic antique surroundings for a unique home away from home stay. Conveniently located near Paddington's finest restaurants + bars.  Driveway parking + backyard pool, a rarity. Minutes walk from buzzing Oxford St or Centennial Park. Bus rides to city + Bondi Beach. Available for Photo+Film Shoots, see The Paddington Estate on insta for portfolio. Longer stays welcome!!

It is special in that it is relatively larger than most Paddington terraces .....  a timeless old-world haven complete with outdoor pool, also a rare feature in Paddington. Whole house stay – 3 bedrooms Includes cot in master bedroom. House keeps its natural co

fields.neighbourhood_overview: You will experience the essence of Paddington lifestyle - central to an abundance of cafes, restaurants, art galleries, pubs, parks, boutique shopping and Paddington markets. We are walking distance to Five Ways village, Centennial Park and Woollahra. By bus, we are minutes to Bondi Beach and the city centre. Paddington boasts a number of stylish pubs and wine bars including The London Tavern and The Grand National Hotel, both a stone throw away. Your stay could not get more central and special than this.
fields.transit: Getting around On Oxford street, a 5 minute walk from our home are buses that take you to the city or the beaches. When arriving, the destination is: William Street, Paddington Bus Stop / Paddington  Inn Hotel (then 5 minute walk) Buses on Oxford Street include:   380 (from city to Bondi Beach via Paddington)  333 (express service as above -limited stops) 352 (to Redfern, Newtown and Marrickville) M40 (from city to Bondi via Paddington) 440 (from Central station to Bronte Beach via Paddington and Bondi Junction) From airport: Catch taxi (between $40 -$50) or Uber (around $25 to $30) OR  Catch train to -   1. Central station, then  catch 440 bus to Paddington (see above information on 'destination') 2. Museum and catch 380 or 333 to Paddington (off Elizabeth Street) We are very well located. Some of our guests walk into the city via Oxford Street (30 to 40 minute walk).
fields.title: The Paddington Estate: Pool+Parking

fields.description: Beautifully stylish & modern 4 bed house located two minutes walk from the gorgeous Clovelly beach. Close to everything but far from the madding crowd. walking distance to beautiful Maroubra and Coogee beach  Across the road from the Coogee to Bondi coastal walk

We are suitable for a family of 5 or 2 couples and we can supply an extra mattress for another child.   There is a lounge/dining room with two double electric lounge chairs. All rooms have air-conditioning or if you prefer fans. Foxtel cable TV is available in the lounge room and there is WIFI Internet. Entire 3 bedroom apartment with its own separate staircase entrance. We will let you know where the keys are once you book. Onc
fields.notes: We are in a great location and close to numerous coastal beaches/outdoor sea pools, cinemas, shopping malls, cafes and restaurants and the awesome coastal walk to Bondi. The bus stop to the city is immediately outside the front door.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Coogee is a lively suburb with a beautiful beach and sea pool. It has numerous bars and restaurants and a vibrant night life. It has become a mecca for backpackers and tourists alike. The nearby Randwick Spot has numerous cafes and restaurants.    We live minutes to a beautiful coastal walk from Coogee to Bondi or down the coast the other way to Maroubra.  We like to say that we are far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Coogee but we are a mere 10 minute walk to Coogee Beach or minutes by bus.
fields.transit: There are 2 bus stops immediately in front of the house which take you either up or down the Eastern Suburbs and the city is about 25 minutes by bus.
fields.title: Smashing summer in Coogee in a 3 bedroom apartment

You will be spoiled for choice when it comes to great cafes, bars and restaurants. If you prefer to cook, grocery shops are at walking distance and the apartment has a fully equipped kitchen.  Walk to the city or hop on a train or bus and be at the Opera House in minutes. Stay here for easy access to all of Sydney beauties whilst living like a local.

fields.notes: To get to our apartment from the Airport the 2 easiest options are: Train - AU$17 per person. It comes every 5 to 10 minutes and it takes about 10-15 minutes into Redfern or Central, then you have to walk for about 10 minutes to the apartment. Taxi - the easiest option and most cost effective if there is more than 1 of you. It costs between $25-$40 and it takes about 20 minutes (allow a little more time to get into and from the International Airport).
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Chippendale is a small suburb in Sydney, and it is quickly becoming one of the coolest, most underground, creative and funky suburbs in town with all it's cafes, art galleries, award winning restaurants, bars, parks and it's big sustainable community, which keeps verge gardens full of fruit, vegetables and herbs for all to share!
fields.transit: My favourite way to get around is by bike, or simply by foot (note it is a 20-50 minute walk into the city depending on where you are going). There are 2 train stations walking distance from the apartment, Central Station (+or- 12 min walk) or Redfern Station (+or- 8 min walk), There are also buses all around. Street Parking is available, it is free, but time restricted to 1 hour during the day. At night it is free and unlimited.

The inside is also extremely comfortable with leather couch, futon day bed / couch, Thai cushions and a steel dinning setting that seats 4. fields.neighbourhood_overview: Located on Danks St, one of Sydney's cool inner city gems with cafes, art galleries, restaurants, organic food and super markets on the door step. It's a short walk to the CBD and: • Airport ($20 cab) • Surry Hills (5 min walk) • Central & Redfern Train Stations (15 min walk) • Oxford Street & Crown Street (15 min walk) • The city (Sydney CBD - 35 min walk) • Darling Harbour & China Town (15 min taxi / 40 min walk) • Opera House & Harbour Bridge (40 min walk) • Kings Cross & Woolloomooloo Harbour (30 min walk) • Bondi Beach / Bronte / Cronulla (20 min bus/cab) • Newtown (20 min walk) • Centennial Park & Fox Studios Entertainment Quarter (10 min walk)
fields.transit: Although you can walk most places, there is every sort of public transport at the doorstep:  Trains Both Central Station and Redfern Station are 15 min walk away.  Bus Busses leave for the city and Bondi from right out the front of the building every 20 minutes. Both journeys take about 15-20 mins Taxi cabs As the apartment is on the route from the airport to the city catching a taxi is easy from the street outside the building. The fare from the airport is usually about $20AUD and takes about 20 mins.

We are conveniently located in lovely Queens Pk, close to shops and beach

It's a short walk to Newtown  train station and buses to Sydney Suitable for 1-3 guests with queen and double sofa beds Fully equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances including a microwave, dishwasher, full oven and cook top.  combined lounge and dining area with a table for 4 persons  lounge with sofa bed, TV and sound system  the bedroom contains a queen size bed, built in wardrobe  bathroom with walk in shower  fully equipped internal laundry with a washer and dryer. Towels and linen provided. There is 2 steps to the front porch and one step from the porch into the apartment. The guests have access to whole apartment,  and gardens in Newtown Square. The apartment is for the exclusive use of guests. Self contained 1 bedroom apartment with private en
fields.notes: If you have young children there are several parks nearby. Camperdown park is very popular with the locals. Please note:- the unit is hooked up for internet access. Parking in a separate lock up garage at $15 per night  - this needs to be pre-booked as the parking is shared with other units. Parking is at a premium in Newtown with time restricted or metered parking. The garage has a standard roller door and height restriction of 1.8m. If you have a large vehicle this space may not be suitable. Please advise if you are 2 single guests and  require the sofa bed as we do not make up this bed unless requested. We are able to supply a portable cot and high chair if required, however charges may apply if portacot  has to be hired. Please request a quote.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Newtown has a relaxed atmosphere and is open to late. You can always grab something to eat no matter what the time of the day is. There are quirky shops, theatres, pubs, heaps of cafes and access to just about anywhere is fairly easy from this area. Newtown  is a melting pot of different cultures, ages and types of people.  Carillon Avenue is a busy road as it leads to RPA Hospital, Sydney University and King Street Newtown.
fields.transit: It is easy to walk to the shops and the bus to the city from just near by, approximately 5 minutes' walk and the train station is approximately a 12 minutes' walk.

The kitchen is fully equipped with dishwasher, fridge, microwave, oven and gas cook top, as well as a separate laundry with  washer and dryer. Suitable for up to five guests. A FREE shuttle called HOP SKIP JUMP runs in a loop through Manly and surrounding suburbs and when getting on at Manly Wharf - look for the Hop Skip Jump bus-sign near the snail-sculpture by the wharf and ask to get off at the second stop (Woods Pde) by the roundabout.

This gorgeous 2 bedroom home is located in the most sought after neighbourhood in Sydney, only minutes walk to your choice of three spectacular beaches – Bondi, Tamarama and Bronte. This spacious home includes two bedrooms (one with cots), one newly renovated bathroom, an open living and kitchen area, an undercover BBQ area and large backyard. This house is ideal for a couple or a small family with 1-2 little ones who would like a holiday near Sydney’s iconic beaches. Our house is 5 minute walk to Bondi Rd. Bondi Rd has buses up to Bondi Junction (shopping district), the City and a variety of other places. fields.neighbourhood_overview: Manly is a beautiful beachside suburb of Sydney. A most popular seaside destination for tourists and Sydneysiders alike. Its cosmopolitan atmosphere is relaxed and eclectic. There are many accessible beaches for swimming, surfing, kayaking, snorkeling and scuba diving. Paved cycling and walking tracks surround Manly and beyond and lengthy coastal walks can be enjoyed from here. Manly has a wide range of eating venues, from casual takeaways, cafes and beer gardens to fine dining establishments. Manly art gallery and museum are within walking distance as is the Sea Life Sanctuary.
fields.transit: 2 minute walk to the Manly ferry. Bus stop across the road. Everything within short walking distance. West Promenade is opposite the Corso.
fields.title: One minute to Manly Beach & Ferry

fields.description: Come to Marrickville, and go back in time. To the 1960s and 70s (though those Wassily chairs admittedly were designed in 1925. They're originals, too, not cheap copies). Marrickville has become very groovy of late - it's now so cool that I'm going to have to start dressing better when I walk down the street. First it was the café scene that exploded, now it's small bars. Have a look at my other listing to find out a bit more about Marrickville. This listing is a large, one bedroom flat in a building around the corner from where we live. It's in one of those classic 1970s buildings that Sydney has lots of. The apartment is on the third floor, and there are stairs. The building has intercom entry and the apartment is very private. This is a dedicated Airbnb apartment - it's not one of those places where somebody lives and then scurries back to mum and dad's when they have a booking leaving their underwear and toothbrush and stuff like that hanging around. fields.notes: Please note that the property immediately next door is building a new house.  During the period of available rental from 23rd December 2015 to 2nd January 2016 there are 5 days that are normal working days.  The builder may choose to work these days, however, it is traditional for most builders not to work over this holiday period.  In the event the builders do work, hours are between 7am and 3pm only.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Bondi Beach is well known for its busy day and night life.  The beach and local shops and restaurants are world class.  The centre of Bondi - just 10-15 minutes walk or a short bus ride away - offers a wide variety of restaurants, cafes, banking and retail shopping. The Christmas - New Year period includes many people accessing the Bondi cliff tops to view the start of the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race on 26th December.  Properties on the cliff often host parties and barbecues on the day to get a view.  For those not wanting to trek into the city to see the New Year's Eve Fireworks, a reasonably good view is available from the public golf course which is 2 minutes walk from the house.
fields.transit: Nearly everything you can think of will be within 3 to 15 minutes away on foot.  There is a bus terminal at the end of the block offering many options for exploring Sydney in all directions.  The local news agency sells tickets for buses.

fields.description: Cliff Hall, is a beautiful grand 4 bedroom apartment in one of Sydney's best suburbs. She has a view from Manly to Bondi and her own pool and Garden. She is Close to the city and beaches. She maintains most of her original features and is eclectically and artistically decorated. It is a very warm family home filled with love and laughter and all that goes with it it is not just  a rental apartment.  My home is an eco friendly home.  We are solar powered and toxic chemical free.  Please don't expect a hermaticaly sealed and souless sterile environment.  Cliff Hall is an elegant home built  in 1916. She was divided into two apartments in the 1950s and one of these is my home . She has retained all her beautiful woodwork and  extremally  high ornate ceilings covered in fabulous plaster reliefs. All the rooms are really spacious approximately 5m x 5m and furnished with a combination of antiques found objects and art.  I have lived in the eastern suburbs of Sydney for nearly 50 yrs and have

Our house delights all who visit it. Its has so many different areas where one can sit, chat, read, eat, play ( if you're a kid) contemplate and enjoy the warm days and barmy evenings. There's a very privat
fields.notes: Rozelle is possibly the hottest property spot in Sydney right now.It seems everyone wants to move here and yet its charm is being preserved and enhanced. The locals care passionately about every aspect and it shows. We are also ideally located to reach many local vantage points and the Opera House to witness Sydney's amazing New Years Eve fireworks.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Rozelle is an inner city suburb 5 k's to the west of the city centre. Adjacent to historic Balmain, there are many restaurants, pubs, bars and places to hang out. Or if a picnic takes your fancy harbourside parks abound with electronic bbq's to cook on. Great food shopping at the weekend farmer's market, at the many supermarkets and smaller providores and the famous Sydney fish markets all 5 minutes from our house. There are indigenous art galleries, several cinemas and many good book shops for you enjoyment. I love to cycle and there is mostly car free cycling around the bay run. Walks by the harbour are also a joy, especially at sunset.
fields.transit: There's exceptionally good public transport to and from Rozelle by bus and light rail. And if you have a car, there are plenty of spaces right outside the house. A 15 minute drive will have you at famous Bondi Beach for a surf! If you fancy a walk, you can stroll over the Anzac Bridge and you be in Darling Harbour and the city in 25 minutes.
fields.title: Charming sandstone and timber house

fields.neighbourhood_overview: This is a gentrified, fashionable, coffee-shop suburb that offers the ultimate inner-city Sydney experience.  There are lots of : - small bars, restaurants and boutique shopping within walking distance.  - waterside parks with great views across the harbour. (This suburb is one of the prime spots for New Year fireworks). - children's parks with play equipment  - buses to the city and main railway station It is also a pleasant walk to 1920s heritage harbourside "Dawn Fraser" pool (open in Summer). For walkers, joggers and cyclists it's 10 min to waterside 'Bay Run' which goes through historic Callan Park with its old sandstone buidlings, forgotten gardens and expansive waterviews.  EVERYWHERE in this suburb is easy to get to - a pleasant and interesting walk or short drive.
fields.transit: A bus to the centre of Sydney centre of the city and all it's attractions is a 15 min trip and the bus stop is at the end of the street. The bus stops at a main transport hub in the city - Queen Victoria Building (QVB). From here there are buses and trains to anywhere in the Sydney surrounds and attractions slightly further afield such as Bondi Beach. The QVB itself is a beautiful old sandstone building, now full of shops, coffee shops, food court etc. The energetic could even walk to the city in 45 mins and enjoy the city and water views from the Iron Cove bridge The airport is a 30 min taxi ride.
fields.title: CLASSIC URBAN HOME CLOSE TO CITY & HARBOUR

fields.neighbourhood_overview: The apartment is located on the border of Elizabeth and Potts Point. It's within walking distance to Macleay Street (2 mins). There you'll find excellent restaurants and bars, including The Fish Shop, Monopole, Apollo, Fratelli Fresh and many more.  There's a great market on Saturdays and Sundays, selling organic fresh vegetables, baked goods and secondhand books (and much more). It's located about a minute walk from the apartment. Harris Farm, a small supermarket that's well priced is located about a 2 minute walk. Woolworths is just down the street too.  One of the best things about this area is its proximity to Beare Park, Rushcutters Bay Park and Arthur McElhone Reserve. They are all about a 3-5 min walk from the apartment. If you feel like swimming, you can use the building pool or you can catch a bus to Shark Bay (25 mins) or a train and bus (approx 30 mins) to Bondi Beach and Bronte Beach. There's also the ABC Pool in Woolloomooloo, about a 25-30 min walk from the apartment.
fields.transit: There are many buses in the area which travel to Bondi Junction, Rose Bay, Nielson Park, Surry Hills and the city just to name a few destinations. Kings Cross train station is a short 5 minute walk and connects to Central and travels toward Redfern and Cronulla Beach amongst many other places.

fields.neighbourhood_overview: Manly is a holiday destination that caters to many different needs. Manly Corso has developed a reputation for providing meals and drinks for all levels of taste and budget. A number of bars, pubs and clubs cater to many different scenes, with options for live entertainment and enjoying a night out. And if you can't find exactly what you are looking for, Sydney CBD is only 30 minutes away by ferry. Manly caters for sports people, adventure seekers and adrenalin junkies as well. Choose from Surfing, Stand-Up Paddle Boarding, Skateboarding, Rollerblading, Cycling, Mountain Biking, Snorkeling and SCUBA diving, Beach Volleyball, Kayaking, Para-sailing, Whale Watching (Seasonal), Bush Walking, Running, Pool and Ocean Swimming and more. If you are traveling light, most of the equipment needed to enjoy all Manly has to offer is available for hire. Day spas, massage, hairdressers, etc. are all on offer if you wish to relax and indulge. With so much on offer, the hardest part can be choosing wh
fields.transit: All that Manly has to offer is a short walk away. Manly Wharf is a central transport hub with buses, taxis, a ferry and fast boat to Sydney CBD and is a short 15 minute walk from the apartment along Manly Beachfront and through Manly Corso. For international travelers arriving at Sydney airport there are taxis, shuttles, and hire cars are available. A taxi from Sydney airport to the accommodation typically costs around $80-$100. For groups traveling together, shuttle buses are also available and a convenient option. Alternatively you can catch the airport train from Sydney Airport to Circular Quay and enjoy the picturesque view of Sydney Harbour, the Harbour Bridge, and the iconic Opera House while taking the Ferry to Manly Wharf. There is 1 car space available at the front of the property. Everything Manly has to offer is a short walk along Manly Beachfront, lined with Norfolk Pine trees. Cycling is a fantastic option in Manly with cycle paths throughout the area and bicycles availabl

fields.description: Perfect for NYE fireworks this private ground floor apartment opens onto an outdoor eating area buzzing with sounds of the harbour. Sitting on the Balmain Peninsular overlooking Illoura reserve and Sydney Harbour this place is suitable for 2 adults + 2 kids  or one couple It's situated close to the water, it's a quiet hideaway yet it's close to the city by ferry or bus. Our rustic apartment is homely and full of character, its a quirky space thats comfortable and relaxed. It's kid friendly but the king size bed in the main room makes it a nice space for couples. The apartment has a its own private entrance and you don't have to cross paths with anyone except perhaps when you put the bins out. you'll be pretty much left to your own devices. There is a tenant that lives in a separate dwelling upstairs who uses the pool about once a year. Otherwise you wont see anyone other than perhaps the pool man or the gardener who comes once a fortnight. Of course we want you to ring us for all your
fields.notes: It's quite tricky to find so please ask for the directions if They haven't been sent to you.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Well this is my very bias view but just for starters, We have an internationally famous rock musician that chooses to live just up the road when he's in Australia. You might just see a few other Aussie celebs in the area. Balmain was a real workers area in the early 1900's, in fact it's the birth place of the Labour party. It's also home to the first game of Rugby League in Australia. We have one of the original 'Neighbours' stars teaching at one of the local primary schools. That says it all. Balmain knows it's a hidden Gem but she's not pretentious......not yet anyway. The residents of Balmain work hard to keep the sense of community spirit alive and we really like to keep it real, I think that's why so many people feel at home here. They know they're somewhere special but they don't feel out of place.
fields.transit: No cash is accepted on public transport in Sydney so you'll need to Order an opal card online from The Opal website or from NSW transport info. You'll need to do this in advance.  Once you have your opal card  Public transport is fantastic with the choice of three buses and two ferries. The walks around Balmain are a bit hilly but very interesting.
fields.title: Harbourside Inner city pad Balmain east

Walk to trails for Manly Dam's fantastic bushwalking/mountain biking/picnics, down to huge Warringah Shopping Mall with cinemaplex. Many golf couses nearby, tennis courts, swimming centre, sailing clubs etc. Allambie Heights is a suburb of northern Sydney, in the state of New South Wales, Australia 17 kilometres north-east of the Sydney central business district in the local government area of Warringah Council. It is part of the Northern Beaches region. History Allambie is an Aboriginal word that means "peaceful place". An estate by that name was subdivided and auctioned in 1918. A "goat track" that roughly follows the existing Allambie Road today, was most likely used by the Aboriginal people to access the ocean beaches at nearby Manly. The suburb was developed in the late 1940s and early 1950s. Allambie Heights Post Office opened on 1 February 1961.[3] Many of the streets in Allambie Heights are n

fields.description: Lovely 3 bedroom house with garden available for Christmas and New Year in Sydneys Eastern Suburbs. 10 mins walk to Bronte Beach, 2 minutes to Queens Park and 5 minutes to Westfield Shopping Centre. If guests prefer the beaches Bronte beach is a short 10 minute walk down hill or a short bus ride from the busstop at the doorstep. For shopping and eating out there are a variety of restaurants at Bondi Junction. For locally run eateries there are some excellent choices just a few minutes walk away. There are some lively pubs which are convenient but not too close. There are some world class shops available at Bondi Junction. Bondi beach is just 1.5km away. The city of Sydney is only 25 minutes by bus and Sydney airport is also just 10 km away.

fields.description: Sunny garden pad above the best part of Bondi Beach My beautiful home has 2 bedrooms (one queen bed and one double loft style bed). There is a sun drenched open plan living room and kitchen that opens with sliding wooden doors onto a delightful north facing garden. It has a full bath and shower, is extremely quiet and has a lovely peaceful energy. It's literally just above the famous North Bondi Beach and a 1 minute stroll to the whale watching point of Ben Buckler. Amazing cafes and restaurants are just 2 minutes the other way. There's even a bus stop at the end of our street - where you can jump on and off the Sydney Explorer Bus and a fantastic yoga school.  I live here with my son so one of the bedrooms has teenage things in it, like a TV and computer and small lounge bed. My room has a super comfortable deluxe latex queenbed and non-sound proofed Japanese silk doors that open to the lounge - giving it an expansive studio feel. I am a yogi and lover of all things bohemian, organic
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Snorkelling from the ramp of North Bondi is amazing. Surfing lessons with Lets Go Surfing. Eating dinner on Monday or Tuesday (cheap nights) at The Hill around the corner. Or having world famous fish n chips from Bondi's Best. The best chicken burgers are at Ollies and the best Italian just down the road! So many great places to eat in Bondi it's hard to know what to pick each night.

Coastal walks, snorkelling, swimming, surfing and golf are a just a few of the activities available right at your doorstep.

The unit is quite large with a nice open living room, large balcony with bbq, recently renovated kitchen, and a bathroom with separate shower and bath. It is up one flight of stairs, and there isn't a lift, unfortunately - but its not too bad... The neighbourhood is leafy, great for walkers. Berry island is a short walk down the hill, and from there you can see the top of the bridge and the city skyline. 15 mins up the hill is busy Crows Nest with plenty of pubs, bars and restaurants featuring many different cuisines from Thai, Japanese, Italian, French and ev

fields.summary: One Bedroom apartment centrally located in the heart of the city and central to Darling Harbour / Chinatown precinct.
fields.description: One Bedroom apartment centrally located in the heart of the city and central to Darling Harbour / Chinatown precinct. Our one bedroom apartment is located in one of the best locations around Darling Harbour and Chinatown. You can walk to anywhere around central Sydney City from here!    The apartment is located inside a serviced hotel but independently operated and not serviced daily for those enjoy a home like experience in the city. There is a ensuite bathroom with a shower, toilet and bathtub. In the living room, there is a new leather double sofa bed for those extra guests. The fully equipped kitchen and dining is separate from the living area and has a washer/dryer included. Free wireless Internet is included for your convenience. There are buses, light rail and trains all very close if you do not wish to walk too far. Parking can be arranged within the complex at an additional cost but capped if validated by the front desk. Strictly a non-smoking apartment. Please note that check
fields.notes: Most of Sydney's Tourist Attractions in Darling Harbour such as Sydney Sea Life Aquarium and Wildlife as well as Madam Tausade's as well as IMAX, The Star Casino are all less than 10 minutes walk from the apartment.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: The neighbourhood surrounding the apartment stretches from Sydney's Chinatown directly viewed from your lounge window with the daily ques outside the famous Mamak Malaysian Restaurant to Paddys Market & Market City at the end of the street.  Whilst the apartment borders Darling Harbour and Chinatown you will have the touch choices of many varieties of Restaurants. Walk 150 metres to the left takes you to the main street of Sydney (George Street) and World Square. To the left of the building, the rooftop overlooks the whole of Darling Harbour and Chinatown Gardens and the newly constructed Exhibition Centres to the beautiful waterways of Darling Harbour into Sydney Harbour. Diagonally located to the apartment is the demolished site of the Sydney Entertainment Centre. It's virtually central to everywhere in the city of Sydney.
fields.transit: Getting around in the area has all types of transportation facilities at your fingertips. Outside the building is the Taxi Cab Rank. Walk 150 metres to George Street gives you access to all the Sydney bus routes. Trams are also a short walk outside Market City.  Most travellers don't mind a short stroll around the city.

Quiet, private yet very central.
fields.description: Unique garden apartment at the edge of Sydney Harbour set in a quiet, green leafy garden which leads directly onto Cremorne Point Harbourside Reserve, only a 2 minute walk to catch a ferry into central Sydney just a short 7 minute trip across Sydney Harbour. Quiet, private yet very central. Our apartment is quintessentially "Sydney". Equipped with all you will need for a comfortable stay.  Positioned across the water from the famous Taronga Park Zoo. We are on a peninsular in Sydney Harbour.  Watch ferries and sail boats passing by from the garden, take a lazy stroll or energetic jog along the harbourside  path at the bottom of the garden. Our apartment is very comfortable for 2 guests.  Coffee pod machine, dishwasher, microwave, i-everything docking station,wifi broadband, TV, bottle of bubbly, fluffy towels, French soap, fresh flowers and initial breakfast provisons - we want you to be happy. You will also have access to shared garden area, shared laundry facilities (washing machine,
fields.notes: In addition to the wonderful foreshore walk right around Cremorne Point there is also McCallum Swimming Pool 7 minutes walk away.  Its set right on the edge of the harbour - so swim and enjoy views of the Opera House at the same time.  There are great Picnic areas in Cremorne Reserve, plenty of benches to sit and admire the views or read a book.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Its very special to be so close to the city of Sydney yet with the feeling you're miles away in a secret leafy enclave.  In reality it only takes a 7 minute ferry trip from our Wharf to take advantage of The Opera House, The Botanic Gardens, The Art Gallery, central shopping districts they are all just a walk away once you've landed at Circular Quay. Or just enjoy a short walk to sit at our Ferry Wharf enjoying a coffee from the little cafe there.
fields.transit: Getting around is so easy from here, take a ferry into central Sydney where you can choose ferries to take you to Manly Beach, to Watsons Bay for lunch, or to visit Taronga Zoo.   Otherwise catch the 225 bus which will take you up the road to cafe's, supermarkets, boutiques and transport connections to other places.
fields.title: Harbourside garden aptmt.  Sydney

fields.summary: Manly is the ideal gateway to Sydney - by the beach yet close to the city. And this house has it all - proximity, views, pool, elegance, lots of bedrooms and lots of entertaining space. Ideal for families.
fields.description: Manly is the ideal gateway to Sydney - by the beach yet close to the city. And this house has it all - proximity, views, pool, elegance, lots of bedrooms and lots of entertaining space. Ideal for families. Beautifully renovated high quality, spacious family home with pool, immaculate garden and views across Manly Bay.  The house is just 3 minutes walk from the beach and 5 minutes walk from the Ferry terminal and the Corso. Available year round for minimum of 4  nights stay. This three level family home accommodates 10 - 11 people in 5 bedrooms and has 4 different zones for entertaining - the pool area, the front verandah (with balcony), the formal dining area at the front and the family room at the rear of the home. This is an ideal home for a large family grouping. As it is our family home, and we stay here when we are in Australia we have ensured quality fittings and decorations throughout. The house has everything you will need for a relaxing holiday in a setting which means you are
fields.notes: What more can I say? We wish we were living there now...:-( There are few other places as gorgeous as Manly and our home is so light and sunny and spacious and relaxed.  There is one high chair and one booster seat, porta cots(2) and 2 sets of stair gates there if you have little travellers with you. I am delighted to say we have never had anything but wonderful reviews for our home and we don't seek to heavily let the house, so that we can ensure the quality of the house is maintained.
fields.neighbourhood_overview: I love Fairlight Beach and Delwood Beach, just below our house - these are flat water harbour beaches - one with a pool cut into the rockface - and both with fabulous snorkelling. Manly Surf Beach is gorgeous - especially in the early morning. I love the Manly to the Bridge Sydney Harbourside Walk - from in front of our house and via the Harbour National Park all the way to the Harbour Bridge. And I adore Manly's bars and outdoor restaurants...you can get there in your flipflops in 5 minutes! And a visit to Manly is not complete without a trip out to the 'Heads' at Manly to watch the yachts and cruise vessels coming into Sydney Harbour.
fields.transit: We are 7 minutes walk from the famous Manly Ferry and the fast ferry which zips back and forth to the city. Buses to other parts of the North Shore are 5 minutes walk away. We have parking for 3-4 cars in our double car garage and on the driveway in front...but we have only ever owned one car in Manly. And it did not get used much! It is such a lovely walk around the harbour foreshore path that we rarely use the car.
fields.title: Manly Beach Magic

fields.summary: Gorgeous homestead style house available for families seeking a relaxing getaway in Sydney.
fields.description: Gorgeous homestead style house available for families seeking a relaxing getaway in Sydney.  Occupying over 900 sqm of beautifully landscaped grounds in a quite cul-de-sac location, our 4 bedroom family home features generous accommodation and a series of in/outdoor living areas.  We have an impressive North facing terrace with a built in BBQ which makes it the ideal place for you to entertain. You can also enjoy a swim in our sparkling saltwater in-ground pool and spa which is surrounded by a leafy, private environment. We have just purchased a brand new Springfree Trampoline so the kids can bounce to their hearts content! Also a waterside (see pics) Linen and bath towels provided.  Welcome food package provided on arrival including locally baked bread, fruit basket, milk, tea and coffee. * Free Wifi * Foxtel * Modern kitchen appliances, Caesar Stone bench tops * 25 minutes from Airport * Our property is a 5 minute drive from Cronulla Beach  * Close proximity to all amenities includin
fields.title: Stunning North Aspect Family Home!

fields.summary: Gorgeous high-ceilinged studio apartment with everything you need. This sweet space is ready to go in an authentic Sydney workers cottage in a quiet cul-de-sac so close to the city yet so very far away in feel! Come and enjoy this divine space!
fields.description: Gorgeous high-ceilinged studio apartment with everything you need. This sweet space is ready to go in an authentic Sydney workers cottage in a quiet cul-de-sac so close to the city yet so very far away in feel! Come and enjoy this divine space! The studio apartment has rustic lime-washed wooden floorboards, high ceilings, a large recently appointed bathroom and a very comfy queen bed. The living/ bedroom is approx 10 metres x 4m  with two big wooden windows, a comfy sofa, small fridge, kitchenette incl electric oven, cooktop and microwave. Cosy rugs(all linens and crockery etc provided...just bring your suitcase!) add a warm touch. The space has been very nicely decorated (I am an ilustrator/designer and the house has been photographed over the years for several magazine spreads) and is a real home away from home with a big wardrobe to stash your stuff. Just 10 metres from the house is a wonderful little park (O'connor Reserve) which you walk through to the zillion buses that can take
fields.neighbourhood_overview: Rozelle is a great little neighbourhood, pubs and cafes on just about every corner, shops a 5 min walk away, gorgeous rambling parks and lots of arty haunts - including one of sydney's best 'flea markets' on the weekends, a 5 min walk away!. You'll love it if you don't know it already!
fields.transit: Parking is off street and we usually don't have a problem parking outside:) many buses leave from just up the road...many of the 500's straight into the city from victoria rd. Taxis to airport cost about $40 and to the city about $15.
fields.title: Gorgeous Rozelle Studio Apartment
